Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ava77_11
Reviews.Content: The Marrakech is an upbeat place to stay in a great location. A lot of young people were staying there and it was a perfect place for a night in New York. The staff is exceptional and room was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jem06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in December 2011. We found the hotel nicely decorated and the staff (especially Charisma) to be very helpful. When we first arrived, we were directed to our room but when we entered there was a problem with the washroom floor. I went straight to reception and told Charisma about it. She moved us straight away without any problem at all and apologised profusely. When we entered our room, there's no denying it was small but we expected that as it was a boutique hotel. Saying that, it was a king-size bed in the room, with a small closet and desk. There was also a small flat screen tv and a good sized en-suite. Having seen previous reviews claiming that the shower cubicles are small just seems silly. I am a big person and I found the shower absoloutly fine so please pay no heed to those claims. The shower was actually really good - great pressure and got nice and hot which was good in the December weather. I liked the decor of the room, which is bright and colourful and the painted bedside tables were really nice. There was one drawback, and that was the way the room was heated; as the hotel is connected to the NY steam system, there is no way to turn the thermostat down. Sometimes the room was too hot but I was able to open the window and use the ceiling fan so that was fine. The staff on reception were really more than helpful and helped us plan where to eat and what things in the city to see. They even organised a shuttle bus to take us back to the airport which saved us over $70! Overall, we really liked the hotel! It's ideal to see a city like New York; you are so busy the whole time you are there that you really just need your room as a base to wash and sleep. There is no facility to buy drinks (soft or otherwise) in the hotel but just on the street there is a liquor store, a 24 hour grocery store, a starbucks, countless places to eat and a bank. Also, the subway station is right outside the hotel which takes you straight to places like Times Square. Dont let the bad reviews put you off, this hotel is a great price and we honestly couldnt fault it. If you go in expecting 5star luxury then you will be disappointed, but, at the end of the day, you're not paying 5star prices. Thank you to all the staff at the Marrakech Hotel from Jemma and Andrew from Scotland. I hope someone got the use from those subway passes we left! :) p.s We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I imagined!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights and would do it again in a heart beat. The people at the front desk were great and willing to help with anything.The 24 hour service was absolutely amazing. We needed ice about twice a day and they brought it up to our room each time. The rooms were quiet, clean, and cozy. I would say this is a perfect place for some young people who are enjoying some time in the city (especially young women since the men who carry your bags and bring you ice are gorgeous!). There was a lounge in the lobby that had Wifi and looked very comfortable. I didn't get time to check this out, but I saw plenty of people hanging out here. Also, the Broadway Restaurant (GREAT breakfast), Starbucks, the subway red line, Subway (food), and the Wine and Spirits store, and CENTRAL PARK are all within walking distance. The staff helped make this stay an amazing experience and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “clean and cosy room”
Reviews.Author: donna c
Reviews.Content: room was clean and cosy,,,it was safe and the doorman was really pleasant and polite...didnt like the location..although it was nr the subway...would have preferrred to be more central but it was my first time in new york so i know for my next visit...reception staff were ok..one girl really was helpful....i would reccomend it though...

Reviews.Title: “Great quality and great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Pascal G
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2 night stay at the Marrakech Hotel in Manhattan's Upper-West Side. Pros: -Good location ON Manhattan -Subway station literaly 20m from the hotel door (The Red Line, #1 train) -Starbucks right next store (We all know how crutial this is in the morning) -Great value, especially for NYC. (We paid around 140$ night for a double room while everything else in New-York was 200-350$/night. -Clean, Comfortable and Nicely Decorated. Cons: -Small, especially the bathroom! (But again this is to be expected in NYC) -Service is not THE best. They are there to work and help but not anything more. We had a sheet on the bed that wasnt completely clean, asked to get it changed and it took everything to get a new one. Plus, girl at the reception wasnt the most inviting person you would want to see while entering a hotel from a long drive. All this being said, the rooms are still comfy, nice and clean and offer anything you need to sleep. Good location, great price and would stay here again no worry. GO stay there and enjoy NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, really liked my stay.”
Reviews.Author: kevenf
Reviews.Content: I just got home from New York and wanted to write about my trip. First of all, I stayed at this little hotel called Marrakech Hotel. It was not in the heart of Times Square but was fine with me. This meant it was quieter, less crowded and best part, CHEAPER than hotels I previously stayed at in times square. I thought my time at the hotel was wonderful. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. It was different from any other hotel I ever.stayed at. It was moroccan style so the room had more color than other hotels. I felt housekeeping did a good job.cleaning everyday. there was a nice flat tv on the wall and bed was comfy. Nearby was several restaurants including Starbucks practically in the hotel, Broadway bagels next block and metro diner. While not in midtown, the subway on the corner took me to times square in 15 minutes, even at night after the theater let out. Oh yeah, did I mentioned I paid like $100 less a night the when I stayed.last year in times square..... Perfect. I love saving $$$

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed a lot in Marrakech and NYC”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again if and when I return to NYC. The thing I love most in this hotel is location with reasonable price. I like it closer to Metro and Restaurants and Bars since it's safe to walk around late night. I shopped constantly while there and had amassed quite alot. Mostly, it was great for me to visit Columbia University since it is just around the corner so that people or students who want temporary to visit Upper West Side. I highly recommend to go here.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel Nice location”
Reviews.Author: PeterTavenier
Reviews.Content: Just a simple hotel, but a very good location. Next to the metro and Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience overall”
Reviews.Author: downtown_jerome
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Hotwire, so I didn't know the details about the hotel until after I made my reservation. I was disappointed when I found out (by reading reviews on tripadvisor) that the hotel had no elevator and the lobby was on the second floor because I was traveling with two small children. I called the hotel to ask for a room on the second floor so I would not have to climb more stairs than necessary. The person who responded was very courteous and told me I would have a room on the second floor, which I indeed got when I checked in. The staff was friendly and polite. We easily found someone to help us carry our 2-baby stroller on the way in and out. Our night there was pleasant. The room was small, but nicely painted and decorated. Like the other reviewers, I think the heating system is a bit of a problem, as there is no way to adjust the temperature. In our case, it was actually a bit chilly in the room and there was nothing we could do to increase the heat. I enjoyed the neighborhood and the subway was very close. We came by car and thought it would not be too difficult to find a parking spot on the street, but after going in circles for 20 minutes, I decided to pay for covered parking. Given that we travel with our babies, the Marrakech Hotel would not be my first choice on another trip, but I were only with my wife and got a good deal on the room, I would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Sabine F
Reviews.Content: We visited New York and we stayed in the Marrakech Hotel. It was horrible. Dusty, cramped and the service was unfriendly. Our room was a joke - just the bed nothing else. It was nearly impossible to walk around the bed!!! After one night we demanded another room and after hours and some discussions with the manager got one which was a little bit bigger but also like a room in a hostel. After one more night we left the hotel and went to another....

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Alex L
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed here for New Years, and comparatively the price was one of the lowest we could find ($390 for the the night on new years). The hotel reminded me of nice hostels I've stayed in in Europe. It was a smaller hotel definitely targeted for young people and those travelling, and the location was not ideal but it was fine and I wouldn't rule it out for future trips. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and provided great service. Our first room wreaked of smoke so we let them know and they immediately switched our room. The second room was perfectly fine and was actually an upgrade (two queen beds instead of one). The one compaint I do have is that the shower was not the cleanest. It wasn't necessarily dirty but you could tell it was old and smelled slightly of mildew.

Reviews.Title: “Looks could be deceiving .”
Reviews.Author: DTailo
Reviews.Content: I made a last minute reservation at Marrakech. I looked at their website and it appeared to be a small yet attractive hotel. Upon arrival I realized it was quite the opposite. There were other guest already complaining about rooms and were trying to get the rooms switched; however, the place was sold out that night. The rooms are extremely small even for NYC standard and they need major renovations. As others guests have mentioned, there are no elevators (families with kids and elderly should avoid staying here at all cost). The other issue is the hotel has central heating, hence at times your room would hotter than a sauna and the only way to deal with it is to either open the window or turn the AC on. I have stayed at several hotels in NYC and the stay at Marrakech was the most disappointing of all. I would highly recommend to spend a few extra dollars and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “good customer service, rooms vary greatly”
Reviews.Author: maddy_j_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after the hotel we originally booked with, had made a double booking. The service we received here was very good at all times. During the first night we were woken up by the sweltering heat, feeling like we were actually in Marrakech in the height of Summer! We were again woken for about an hour with the pipes banging (we were wearing ear plugs, so they were exceptionally loud). The next morning we asked if we could move, which they were only too happy to arrange. The next room was an upgrade, with the room and shower being double the size of the first. This room was at the front of the hotel, yet was quieter than the room we had at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a clean place to sleep, that's all.”
Reviews.Author: FairfaxBob
Reviews.Content: Boutique: A small company that provides highly specialized goods or services. Well, the Marrakech Hotel is highly specialized in stairs, uncontrollable heating and cooling and tiny rooms--even by NYC standards. I booked the room as a "Top Secret" on Travelocity, which is another story--stick with Priceline or Hotwire. The only big plus for this property is that it is directly across the corner from the 103rd Street stop on the #1 subway line, making access to where you really want to be in Manhattan very convenient. The neighborhood is decent, and there is a selection of decent restaurants withing a one block walk, as is a very well stocked grocery store. The lobby is one flight of stairs up from the street, and rooms are on that floor and four more above that--all without elevators. The first room we were assigned was at the back of the building. When we walked in, the heat was overwhelming--as in hotter than any Swedish sauna I've ever been in--and the window was wide open in December. We were told that it was central steam heat and that there was nothing to be done, except turn on the a/c. The room was furnished with a queen bed, which I gave a quick inspection for bed bugs (no evidence of infestation), and a cheap set of shelving. Not acceptable. A brief interview with the manager at the front desk got us moved to another room at the front (Broadway) side of the building which seems to be on a different heating system. This room was slightly larger, and the bathroom was almost double the size of the first room. And while we still had no direct control over the heat, other than opening and closing the window, it was at least habitable. Checked the bed for bedbugs...again no signs of infestation. Both rooms were at least clean on the surface, and the beds were both apparently relatively new, and comfortable. The heating system in our room started banging and clanging in the middle of the night for no apparent reason...it sounded like an old move of prisoners beating their tin cups against the jail cell bars. The shower was an adventure. The line between scalding and ice water was very delicate. Move the knob a hair too far either way, and you get one or the other. The hotel offers essentially no services other than the rooms. The lobby bar is closed, there is no food in the hotel. They do have porters to help with baggage, and they will also bring ice to your room. The front desk staff and the porters are all friendly and helpful, and clearly have great skill in dealing with surprised and disappointed customers. Bottom line. It's relatively clean and the bed is relatively comfortable. That said, for a few dollars more you can do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: kHope81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once and it was a nice little boutique hotel. There were only a few problems I had with the place. First of all, the shower was tiny and not that clean. The location is not that great, it is kind of a ways off from the action. Also, when you open the door, you have to go up several stairs to even get to the lobby. Then, you have to take the stairs to your room as well. If you cannot take stairs, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for budget-conscious”
Reviews.Author: ClergyChick
Reviews.Content: Going to NYC usually means finding affordable housing - and that it was. Not fancy (stretches meaning of 'boutique'), but very comfortable bed to collapse in after busy days. Rooms are tiny, and ours was incredibly hot: can't control the steam heat, but ran the air conditioner . . . But really, the visit is spent enjoying the city, not holed up in the hotel, and the staff were genuinely friendly and fine. NOTE: NO elevator -- and rooms are on five floors above a second-floor lobby, so you also get the benefit of stair-climbing. Still, location is great, subway right on block, and was good short stay.

Reviews.Title: “CRAP ON BROADWAY!”
Reviews.Author: GREG P
Reviews.Content: Well walked a mile from blue line, when should have taken red line subway. Rang for directions and they did not know the surrounding area of where I was currently located when I gave them my position via a store\business. Stairs, stairs stairs. Asked 4 times if wanted bags carried.....tip seekers First impression from room..small and HOT! Also smoke detector battery flat and beeping. They just took out battery and did not replace. Sheets looked dirty and underlay was stained. Bed rock hard. Asked for quiet room and with aircon and fan on to cool down...not quiet. Heating cannot be turned off! Lamp on side table has no powerpoint to turn on. WIFI as stated is only in the lobby, have to login everytime not auto :( What really poor is a Hostel is one QUIET block back and $150 a night less! Given a subway map on arrival and card for room. Hope your not a big person because you wont fit in bathroom. Laundry is around the corner...will update after a night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk...”
Reviews.Author: lena141
Reviews.Content: Not sure about you, but where I come from "boutique" hotel means something different... Had a confirmed reservation for a Superior Queen room and didn't exactly get what I paid for - the bed was a Full and still not sure what, if anything, was Superior about this room or establishment in general. Room and bathroom are tiny (even by NY standards), the extra blanket provided had someone else's hair all over it. If I was charged the correct amount I'd say you get what you pay for. Seeing how I was overcharged by $150+, this isn't really the case. Still trying to get through to the front desk to clean up the money mess. Their message has been saying "all lines are busy" for the last 20 minutes and it's 8:45am? STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK.

Reviews.Title: “Budget great for Students”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: I have friends at Columbia University, upper West Side NYC, so the Marrakech was convienant. I have stayed there three times. It is basic. Lots of stairs and the hallways are dark, and a maze of walls and corners, to find your little room. The closet was a cheaply constructed shelf with a white drapery over it. The walls are painted dark blues and reds Morrocan theme as they describe, no candle thank goodness, and cheaply put together. It is adequate but very closed in feeling. The lobby is a steep flight of stairs up onto the second floor of the five story building. Sometimes there is a young doorman sometimes not. A Starbucks is handy right outside the door outside, and the Subway #1 train going uptown and downtown again right outside your door on Broadway. excellent location. There are stores and eateries all around the neighbourhood and I always felt safe. Arties Deli and Zabars not too far away, and a nice Mexican Restauant steps away as well. The lobby is good, has a bar which never seemed to be open for business, but there is a computer corner and nice Moroccan style boutique bean bag kind of chairs and wicker with striped fabric pillows and exotic music. The staff is young and kind of uncaring to the needs and assistance of an older traveller. My lady friend fell down the stairs, and they would hardly help and guide her across the street to the M60 bus stop for her to get back to the airport. I purchased a cane in fact, so her ankel was badly swollen, The stairway was dark and the steps are not consistant in width. For students needing access in visiting the University, it would be ideal, the price is cheaper than every other hotel , and better than just a hostel . You will have your own bathroom and there is alway a shared bathroom and shower in each hallway for a cheaper rate. If you want to enjoy that. The bedding was nice, a white sheet collection, a multicoloured pretty light fixture and a window in the room. The side lamp did not work, and I felt quite closed in. A small tv and small bathroom they provide little soaps and the shampoos were used and half empty. I bring my own anyway. There is a grocery store next door, so buying bottled water and bananas and muffins for your room is easy. There is no fridge, but the window ledge will keep items on the cool side by the air conditioner. The place is fairly transit but I felt safe, and realized that it was affordable. Another hotel "On The Ave" was way more money basically a couple subway stops away, but I saved by staying Marrakech. For a lone travellor it is fine. I did recommend this place to a lady friend who was not accustomed to NYC high room rates, she thought the price was cheaper but I could tell she was Really feeling uncomfortable with the surroundings and stairs. A dreadful fall on the last day there. The hotel did nothing really to be supportive or even offer us anything complimentary , we simply wanted to move on and try to look at the trip in a positive way, even though it was unfortunate. They are Really lucky we did not sue. So many others in review mention the dark hallways and narrow steep stairs. I can not help but wonder, WHY do they not install brighter light bulbs down the stairs for saftey reason. I think they just do not really care. But it is a cheap place, you will hear talking and noise in the halls. Even at almost three hundred dollars a night, good grief. I have tried another place called the Belnord Hotel, also Upper West side, and found it better. I have written a reveiw on that one. I travel to NYC a lot and consider myself an expert and been there done that, so hope my review help you guys out. I just love NYC. The Marrakech has a great neighbourhood location, is basic, unique, and if you are not planning to hang out in your room alot, if would be perfect. Casual, most people in jeans and sports clothes, get the picture. Not for a big family, parents, your kids will be happy and fine there. Again Columbia University a couple blocks walk really nice area, 10 minute subway to Times Square. Trendy, artsy, and easy M60 bus from LaGuardia for a couple bucks. The bus is like a City tour going through Harlem, you see Apollo Theatre, and all the slices of life, that is a bonus itself, St. John The Divine Cathedral not far from the Marrakech, Central Park within walking distance, all in all I prefer more upscale, this place is for the budget traveller and I have never stayed in a hostel, not my thing, I like my own bathroom and security. This place is just ok and provides a room with a bed. There were no bugs or bites any of the times I was there, a believe me I check.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us”
Reviews.Author: CharmCityTraveller
Reviews.Content: If you pack minimally and plan to spend most of your time out in the city, this hotel will work for you. The location is terrific, with a handy subway stop, great nearby restaurants, diners, markets, bakeries, and local shops. Columbia and Bank Street are close by. It takes about 20 minutes to ride the 1 line to Times Square/Broadway. Be advised the subway cars are often packed. The room was quiet, the bed ok though not great; very firm and for some reason crackly. There was enough hot water (though trouble keeping it regulated). The downsides: Room was overheated, and the housekeeper kept forgetting to replace bathroom linen supplies (washcloths, bathmat).There are no elevators, so be prepared for at least a 1-story climb to the main floor, and more if your room is not on that floor. This is not a business traveller's hotel, if you need fast in room internet, workspace in your room or business room amenities, forget about it, you won't find those things here. But if you're vacationing and don't need luxury amenities to enjoy your stay, the Marrakech could work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job and great transport links”
Reviews.Author: Tab_London
Reviews.Content: The good: Rooms are clean, comfortable beds. no breakfast included but several diners and a grocery store nearby, staff were helpful and a subway station right outside the door that gets you to Times Square in 20 minutes. The bad: The room was quite cramped as there were four of us and they couldn't accommodate splitting the beds, so we had to share. The walls are very thin and you can hear the people in the room next door. The air conditioning didn't seem to work but not a problem as we went when it was mild outside. Rooms were expensive but so is everything in Manhattan. The free wi-fi is only available in the lobby. Overall: If what you are looking for is somewhere to rest up, has the basic necessities and close to the main areas of Manhattan. Not the place to go if you want something luxurious and want to spend a lot of time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the marrakech earlier this year. Before we left we emailed to ask to be in a room near our friends who we were going with. On arrival we checked in only to find out we were as far away as we could possibily be. Also we had both paid for the same size rooms however our room was considerably bigger than our friends and we were told this could not be rectified. Although this was a pain the rooms were clean and comfortable the only pain being the noise from outside but hey its New York not a desert Island so we expected this. The bar to the hotel was not open at all which was a shame as we were expecting this to be open and would have been nice after a long day walking around but there are places very near that you could go to chill out for a bit so it wasn't to much of a pain. Our stay there was good however the hotel is well situated for the tube station so getting around is very easy (the hotel is a long way away from any of the central attractions so tube or taxi is essential). Also the staff at the hotel were very helpful and gave a lot of good advice where to go when we asked. The atmosphere is very relaxed in the hotel and although there is no lift the door steward at the front did help my girlfriend with her case so it was not a problem at all. The staff also saved us money by helping us book cheaper transport back to the airport at the end of our stay. I would say that if you want to see New York at a reasonable price and not spend to much time in the hotel this is the ideal place however if you are looking for a nice hotel where you can spend lots of time I would look for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Ethical_explorer
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely cheap and cheerful. The decor itself is a bit dingy and has no lift but the service makes up for a lot. The location was perfect for me as i was based out of harlem but it is a little way out of town and the area, while lovely, wont give you a feel of buzzing new york. The room itself could do with a lot of work: My bathroom window didn't lock, my bedside lamp didn't work and it was really hard to find a temperature in the shower that was between freezing and scalding. The only downside to the service is that they do charge you $2 a bag for left luggage and my wake up call never came.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely expensive for a tacky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flavio_C
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no elevator, even though my room was in the fifth floor. The ambiance is very tacky and worne out, although the room interior was ok. Is was also noisy to sleep. Since it is in a "so-so" neighborhood, the price is unjustified. I would stay there for US$90/day, but not the outrageous US$240 that I sadly paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically helpful staff; and a bargain of a find!”
Reviews.Author: Emma_in_RI
Reviews.Content: While on my way to New York, i messed up my knee. The Marrakesh has no elevators, and the staff was immediately kind enough to give me a complimentary upgrade, which allowed me a room on a lower floor. The rooms are very small, but extremely clean and absolutely perfect for any trip to NYC where you simply need a quiet, clean and safe place for yourself and your things. The neighborhood is great; truly 20 feet from doorway to subway. An all-around fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Decent - you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: modern_gipsy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an Expedia mystery deal - the 3 star rating is a bit misleading, I think it would be 2 stars at best. Plus: decent location, and cheap by NY standards. The room was reasonably clean (not to my high standards, but okay). Front desk staff were helpful. Con: the room is small, but you expect that for anything under $500/night in NY. Bed and pillows a bit lumpy/old but not the worst I've ever had. The main problem is the noise - I was near the front desk and the noise never stopped! Bring earplugs! Overall: if you just want somewhere to sleep in Manhattan, its adequate and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A balanced opinion”
Reviews.Author: cmoulton9
Reviews.Content: I paid $175 on a night when everything else was $250 - $300 min. I got what I paid for. The entrance to the hotel (tenament stair well with musty carpet) was shocking. The room was a bit worse. No closet, depressing decor and a tiny, run down bathroom (the shower floor was grey/black -- intended to be white). No remote for TV and about 5 channels. More than a bit depressing, but there were some positives. I slept very well as my alley facing room was quiet. There is a Starbucks downstairs and the subway access was perfect (#1 line). Location is good for runners as you have quick access to Central and Riverside parks. If you just need a cheap bed, Marakech may be ok but expect the worst as far as accomadations are concerned.

Reviews.Title: “No Elevators and Terrible Beds...just for starters”
Reviews.Author: jtc281
Reviews.Content: The website of this hotel is beautiful. We were exciting about staying there. The location is pretty good and it seemed like our stay would be wonderful. Ummm....no. There are no elevators anywhere. The entrance basically is a three story stairway straight up. The rooms were small and if one person sat at the desk, then the other guest has to sit on the window sill or bed. Now the beds, they are terrible! Scratchy sheets, lumpy/springy beds that if I wasn't concerned about bugs, I would have slept on the floor. It has been 24 hours since I slept in that bed and I am still sore. These comments are only for starters, but definitely reason enough to not ever book there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was very good value for New York, but is nothing special. However, if you want to spend all day exploring the city, its fine for a place to sleep! Rooms were very small and basic but are clean and well kept by the maids. Service by staff was fine but slow. Location was very good as lots of places to eat nearby, I recomend the mexican three doors down! Theres a subway station right next to the hotel which is the same line which has times square and penn street on. The hotel is a short walk from Central park so is very central for places to explore. Overall, good value hotel for a short stay in New York but nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: camjts
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I found a deal with this hotel through hotwire.com and we were quite lucky. We only stayed for 5 days and did a lot of sightseeing (baseball game, shopping, Broadway), so we weren't at the hotel much. The hotel is literally right next to the subway station so it was very convenient for going around the city. Also, it's about a 10min walk to Central Park which was really nice at night when we wanted to go for a walking around. The area is fine, nothing fancy, but there are diners and restaurants around if you want to eat close by. The hotel doesn't have an elevator which became a little annoying, but was not a deal breaker. The room was a pretty small (especially the washroom), but mind you if you're there for sightseeing and are out of the hotel most of the time, it doesn't really matter. It was quiet at night, staff were friendly. The location (close to subway) is what really did it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Dean and Pat V
Reviews.Content: The Marrakech is located just outside a subway entry. It was very easy to get from this location to Time Square and only a few blocks to Central Park. There are many resturants which served a variety of different foods. We knew that the hotel room was going to be small. It stated in the brochures we read that the rooms were boutique, which means small. Yes, the rooms were small. However, they were clean and very comfortable. What amazed us was how friendly and helpful the staff were. There was always someone at the entry and at the top of the stairway. Yes, there are steps to climb, so you need to be able to climb stairs. The cost of this hotel was several hundreds of dollars cheaper then others that I checked into. Since we planned to be sight-seeing and only sleeping in the room. The size did not matter to us. Would I stay there again? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Great for a few nights in the city”
Reviews.Author: kristin n
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while at a conference in NYC. It was the closest to my conference, at Columbia University, which I wanted to be within walking distance to. The room was very small, but for 1 or 2 people what more do you need? My room was clean, a/c worked, bed was decent, etc. Staff was friendly and helpful. Seemed very popular for young travelers, but it was not noisy at night. Overall, the location was great for what I needed, and the price was fair for the accommodations/amenities. Would recommend & stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Online dating translates to hotel disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mick o
Reviews.Content: well as a user of online dating sites I am quite familiar with people who show up and look nothing like their picture... This is one of those such dates. The images are VERY different to the reality. Maybe 10 years ago when this place opened it looked fresh and sweet but now its in need of a revamp and rework!! I was in a "Superior" room. (no. 53 for those who care) It measured 8 feet x 10 feet. There was no place to unpack The window blinds had to be kept shut because it looked out into another window on the back. The aircon was pitiful and LOUD!!! The bathroom was tiny and wasnt cleaned particularly well. As a bald man I tend to notice long black hairs all over the place and can safely say - they arent mine!! Now thats not to say that it was totally awful - you get free wifi and the staff are really friendly... Unfortunately this doesnt compensate for the $240 a night rate I ended up paying!! Its the last time I'll let someone else book a hotel for me :)) I wouldnt stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Matthew P
Reviews.Content: Marrakech Hotel on Broadway is a really cool, urban, fun place to stay at. The room that I stayed in was the Quadruple Room & my friends and I felt it was very cozy. Although it wasn't as equip like other hotels we were accustomed to, if you needed something, the staff was happy to grab it for you. Speaking of the staff, there was a really great team member named 'Adam' who took great care of us. He was very nice, sweet and made us feel so welcomed especially when it was our first time in New York. He looked after us really well. Also another team member, who we believed was named 'Robertson' was so very sweet and helpful. He helped carry our bags around for us, was very nice and was always there if we needed something. If not for the great location and accommodation you should definitively choose this place for the great staff members.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: H S
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and we love staying in "boutique" hotels when visiting new york, however this is the worst one we have ever seen. The rooms are tiny, dirty don't have any furniture for storage and we made them move us to 3 different rooms before we found 1 that was worth staying in. Even the European backpackers who are used to staying in hostels were complaining about how nasty this hotel was. The doorman spent most of the time checking out the girls at the top of the stairs rather than actually holding the doors open on the street. The hotel is on the second, third and fourth floor with no elevator in the halls were so small it to people cannot pass each other and is definitely not handicap accessible. When we ask to speak to the manager he basically hid in the back room and forced his employees to deal with us, and the woman named "Charisma" that worked the front was the only bright spot of our whole stay. They also claim that this place is recently renovated, but in the Tip Advisor member pictures you can see that the rooms look the same in 2008 as they do now. We also used their crib for our son and the next morning he had bumps on his arms and legs that look like bed bug bites. We will never stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Totally appropriate for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: touristeaccidentel
Reviews.Content: Went here for a 3 night trip in NYC with our 3 children. The service was very professional, the rooms were clean at our arrival and the nights were calm. They allowed the five of us to stay in the same room. The area is quiet and it was good to come back here at the end of the day. We even had an ice cream from the close-by Ben & Jerry's in the middle of Broadway at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Ram K
Reviews.Content: No internet (even at lobby), crappy and small room, nothing is good about this hotel.. Its called boutique hotel in expedia undisclosed hotels booking..please stay away from this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations, Staff was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Lori H
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of the proximity to Columbia university and it met our needs. We did not expect much, just a clean room, after all it is a Boutique hotel, but were pleasantly surprised by the staff, Just wish staff wore name tags and lounge was open during our 1 week visit.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you can't afford better”
Reviews.Author: keuu
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel from the moment I entered. The carpeting in the entry, lobby and in the room was very worn, making it look dingy and rather gross. The room I had, with one bed, was pretty small and looked out on a fire escape. The furniture was worn and beat up looking ... a missing handle on the desk drawer, scratches on the bedside table. The bathroom amenities were minimal: two regular size towels. No wash cloths, and sometimes no bath mat. There was something weird about the soap that took it forever to wash off. The TV worked, but I'm used to many more channels from other hotels. The place seemed like it was run by rather inexperienced young people. The one bedside lamp in my room did not work, and I asked twice for a new bulb to no avail. On a third try I got a bulb, but the lamp still did not work. Once a male employee walked into my room unannounced ... he apologized, but it was still disconcerting and I made sure to keep door locked after that. The room did not appear dirty, but the overall condition made it feel dirty and made me uncomfortable. I feel the website misrepresents the hotel as a nice "boutique" hotel, which it is not ... it is definitely a budget place and borderline acceptable in my view. They also insisted on photocopying my drivers license on a prepaid room, which did creep me out. air conditioner was adequate, if rather loud. I spent a minimum of time there over the course of the 3 nite stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a no frills type traveler it's fine!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea O
Reviews.Content: First night was on the hot side, we were on the top floor. The staff was very nice and moved us the next day. Stayed on the lobby level and all was well. There is no elevator, no ice machine. Lots of places to eat,Starbucks, deli's, grocery right outside the door. Subway is right outside also. We only slept in our room at night, gone touring the city the rest of the time. The room was small but clean. Perfect for a no frills traveler.

Reviews.Title: “it is ok if you travel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Zolanito
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marrakech from 07/26/11 - 07/31/11, The pro pictures are that pro pictures the hotel has a great location if you can get around by subway, is not a luxury hotel is not the greatest hotel in NYC but for the price I would stay there again, lots of places were to eat around, the beds were comfortable, and the A/C worked ok for the room size, bathroom was ok also, the cleaning personnel were lazy to Vaccum the room daily, and were like saving money on the towels laundry and the soap, but a little complaining did fixed the problem the day that happened, overall clean, internet only at the lobby, no cable, no elevator, and the rooms are nothing like the pictures they are very regular rooms, like I said I would stay here again if I can not afford something different front desk people are friendly and Kaile was good giving directions to everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Only the bar and lobby are nice!”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller83
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, the metro is nearby. However, the hotel has no elevator. I had to carry my suitcase to my room which was on the 4th floor. For those traveling with children or old people, this is definitely not recommended. The hotel might be charming for some but it was very snug for me. The lady at the reception was not very friendly. I cut my stay here within 3 days and moved to another hotel. The rooms are small and clean. I got a better hotel with the same price with a more central location. This felt like an upscale hostel rather than a hotel to me.

Reviews.Title: “a good value for new york city”
Reviews.Author: quixoticsplash
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marrakech Hotel on a weekend trip to new york because it was only $99 a night. The hotel was well decorated with a Moroccan (I think?) theme throughout, quite beautiful. The rooms were small but clean and the tv, a/c, shower, everything worked. The hotel is only one block from a subway stop, and there are a few 24 hour delis near by for snacks, though beyond that there isn't much to see in the immediate area. The staff was friendly and offered us advice on where to go, and gave us a late check out. The downsides (expected for a hotel in Manhattan for under $100): the mattress felt old and was squeaky, there is no elevator (up to four flights of stairs), and no wifi. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to explore the city on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “HATED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: paredsl1
Reviews.Content: Terrrible! I can't find the words to discribe this..."hotel" very SMALL rooms, airconditioning did not worked, power went out, no elevators, dark, and for the price you pay, you can find something better.

Reviews.Title: “HATED IT”
Reviews.Author: rebeccakb
Reviews.Content: wifi didnt work cold shower not very clean noisy airconditioning which didnt work properly rude girl on desk no organisation as a business worst bed and linen i have ever experienced smelt odd. im not a complainer unless there is something to complain about but do not stay here. the only good thing was that there was a starbucks next door to use thier internet and get out of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hostel - like”
Reviews.Author: brokenfairytail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marrakech for one evening while in NYC for the night - I have stayed in better roadside motels for 1/2 the price, and have stayed in places in the city 3x as nice for less money. First, there are no elevators, the room numbering system makes NO sense, so we spent 15 mins walking up and down stairs trying to figure out which floor our room was on. Once we arrived to our room, it was understandably small, but the toilet had clearly been recently used, and not properly flushed. There was no closet, and our room did not even have a clock. The bed was beyond uncomfortable, the shower controls were automagically switching between hot/cold, and I could not wait to leave. I am sorry, but I do not have a single positive thing to say about the property or my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Old, small and lots of stairs”
Reviews.Author: Barbievancouver
Reviews.Content: Teeny tiny room with a bed right inside the door. Kept hitting my head in the tv located right next to what appeared to be dressing table.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Marlee66
Reviews.Content: nice, well located hotel on Broadway and 103 W Street. Close to subway and walking distance to Central Park. And a special thanks to Jeffrey, NYCÂ´s strongest portier...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Spot for a Weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NiMo416
Reviews.Content: Visiting NYC I would highly reccommend Marrakech Hotel for any budget conscious traveller. The location worked really well for 4 women visiting NYC for a wkend of sight-seeing, shopping and nights out on the town. We found this boutique style hotel online. Our criteria simple for 3 days: clean, spacious, 2 double beds, access to parking, convenient location, a place to leace our stuff, shower, change and rest on a reasonable budget. Marrakech was that and more. Its a brown stone building located in Uptown Mahattan near major attractions (Columbia University, Apollo in Harlem, Grants Tomb, and Central Park). Staid in room 51 on the 3rd floor. It was big enough for 4 women, clean white bed linen, small wash room with piping hot water. Only thing missing a small safe and mini fridge. Loved the fact that the Metro was just steps away, a direct line to Downtown attractions, Starbucks next door, and many local restaurants. We all agreed we'd go back to Marrakech especially because the staff were very hospitable and accommodating...made us feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative comments - Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: mingrid
Reviews.Content: We picked Marrakech Hotel due to its location and price, and both delivered. Staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival and throughout the stay. Room was large and adequate, cleaned daily with fresh towels and linen provided during our 10 day stay. Location was perfect for exploring New York, the subway is right outside the hotel, 15 minutes to Times Square. We will definitely recommend Marrakech to anyone exploring New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Gemsquash22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of March. To be honest I was dreading our stay here and even tried to find alternate accommodation after reading the bad reviews on here. We couldn't find anything else in our budget so had to stick with the Marrakech. I am so glad we did. This hotel is absolutely fine. NO bed bugs, we didn't have a problem with noise, water was always hot and the location is great. I've been to NYC a few times & hotel rooms are small and a bit dated in this city. But if you are looking for reasonably priced, decent accommodation the Marrakech is perfect. Don't be put off by the bad comments. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, poor service and plumbing”
Reviews.Author: akh86154
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several months ago and had a sub-par experience. My room was located directly behind the front office, so I was constantly woken up by the laughter and raucous chattering going on amongst the employees. I banged on the wall and even asked in person for them to keep the noise down, to no avail. In addition, the walls are very thin and noise travels easily within the halls and into the rooms. Regarding the cleanliness of the hotel, there were no bugs, but the sheets were badly stained. The toiletries in the bathroom had been used and were half empty, the tile floor was sticky, the shower curtain had mildew on it and there was hair in the bathtub. Speaking of the bathroom, plumbing was terrible - the water would either be scalding hot or freezing cold, with no middle temperature. I ended up kneeling outside the tub and using a cup with water from the faucet to wash my hair. Finally, the night before I left I called over to the front desk and asked for a wake-up call at 3 a.m. and if they could arrange for a cab to meet me outside since I would be leaving at 3:30 in the morning. They confirmed and said that both requests would be taken care of. Three-fifteen rolls around, and my friend wakes me up in a panic because we didn't get the wake-up call. We call over to the front desk to find out why we didn't get a call and to make sure the cab was coming, and find that they had no record of the wake-up call request and that they aren't able to have a cab pick us up at a specific time. Overall, it was a bad experience and I would recommend staying at a different hotel based on those points. I understand you get what you pay for - in terms of size and amenities, this was definitely a "get what you pay for hotel" - but those factors make it worth spending a few extra dollars to avoid the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “The VERY BEST place to stay in NYC - Marrakesh Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Shhh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel from March 04 to March 11 and I loved it so much! The rooms are really big, quiet, always kept nice and clean, but what's more important - the stuff is really welcoming, they definitely will help you to solve any problem. The hotel itself is only 30 seconds (literally) away from a Subway station and about 7,5 second away from the nearest Starbucks. All in all, I wolud give this hotel 6 out of 5 possible points.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay - not awesome, but servicable.”
Reviews.Author: boydhancock
Reviews.Content: The reviews here terrified me, so let me set somethings straight: Bugs-absolutely NO evidence of bed bugs, roaches or mice, and I looked extensively. Clean-yes, the hall carpets are worn, but they are in many NY hotels, even the high-end ones. The room was spotless, especially the bathroom. Noise-you're in NYC, so there's traffic noise. For us, it was like white noise that put us to sleep. Mattress-okay, yes, the mattresses were hard. Parking garage-two short blocks away. You can walk it in 90 seconds. There was always space in front of the hotel to pull over and load/unload the car. Other things: Neighborhood is good. Convenient to subway. Fun restaurants and convenience stores abound. The room was small - again, this is NYC. Staff was pleasant. Bar was funky. No ice buckets in room, and no ice available, but we bought some at a store. We got this room on a Hotwire deal for $132 for a double, so that price is right. If you're looking to pay over $200, you can probably find a higher-end hotel. Not luxurious, not the best, but certainly serviceable and clean if you're on a budget. Let me repeat, NO vermin whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: jmorgandavis
Reviews.Content: The basic double room was quite nice, with a Moroccan-style closet/shelf combo for storage and a flat screen TV mounted to the wall. Housekeeping cleaned our room daily, even organizing our toiletries when they put fresh towels in the bathroom. The bar inside is gorgeous, and their happy hour specials were great - sip the lemon-limey gin drink while lounging on colourful tapestries and observing other travelers. It's super close to a subway station, and there's a cafe below the hotel for your morning coffee fix. Our only complaint would be that we were right near a stairwell, so heard a lot of comings and goings. Our "next door neighbour" also went on a lot of nonsensical rants...but Lee "Scratch" Perry was playing in town that weekend, and we thought it might have been him, so we enjoyed it for what it was (or what we like to think it was). Please forgive the bad photography - we blame the humidity (or was it the alcohol?). :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: yuhh
Reviews.Content: Overall good experience. The hotel I had gotten through Name Your Own Price and only paid $75 although the reservation only came with a double size bed and I was traveling with a friend that I did not want to share a bed with (you get what you pay for). The hallway to our room smelled like smoke so we asked to move and we got upgraded to a queen size room facing the street (noisy but to be expected for NYC). It was nice on the last day when we got to see the street covered in snow from our room. I can't say enough about the location! Some people say itâ€™s in Harlem but itâ€™s not! Itâ€™s a very safe area and I didn't once feel threatened in any way. Itâ€™s across the street from a subway stop so itâ€™s so convenient for seeing the city. The bathroom is small but again, itâ€™s NYC. Only problem with the bathroom was that the liner was a little dirty. Good hotel for younger travelers. I would not go here with children or the elderly (no elevator). If you stay there hit up Hummus Place at Broadway between 98th and 99th. Also, across the street, Lenny's Bagels. I was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs verified by Private Commercial Terminex Inspector..”
Reviews.Author: aprils2011
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel 2/10/2011, & 2/11/2011. I awoke my second nigh itching horribly bad. This is when I Googled this hotel name and the words bed bugs. I found a few recent complaints regarding bed bug infestations just Nov 2010. I called an outside creditable source to come in and investigate my room, due to the management response to other customer complaints on this very site, and sure enough, I had bed bugs in my box spring. Definitely recommend not staying at this hotel ever. This was my first time visiting New York. What a horrible stressful experience. So glad to be home..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Great Value if you're on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelD
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfectly located on Broadway- just down from the subway. The stairs are a killer if you are less abled, but the staff were happy to help if necessary. Room was small, clean and warm. It was located at the front so was very noisy but was else do you expect from a City Centre Hotel? There was plenty of hot water and the bathroom was spotless. The hotel decor could do with a little bit of TLC but the value for money was excellent. Nearby were some authentic "diners" - fantastic breakfasts and also great dinner. The nearby Mexican was also really tasty. Would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: maren02
Reviews.Content: We had low expectations to this hotel, all we wanted was a place to sleep and shower between our hectic schedule, we only had a couple of days in NYC. Our room was really cold, even colder than it was outside. We also had some trouble with the temperature in the shower; it was either too hot or too cold. Except from that, we enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The staff was helpful, and our room was cleaned every day. When we needed another blanket, we got it right away. There was a little smell in the room, but it didn't bother us. The location was really good, with the Starbucks downstairs, the metro-station right outside the door and the restaurants right down the street. We specially recommend the Mexican and the Chinese a few blocks down the street. All in all, we enjoyed out stay at the Marrakech Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hostel not a Hotel - Stay AWAY from this place”
Reviews.Author: snjnbnt
Reviews.Content: Hi, This is my first review on Tripadvisor, cause I feel that I have to advise anybody to stay AWAY from this so call hotel. This place is nothing but a hostal, they have place nice photos on the site, provably from another hotel, dont be fool by the photos, rooms have nothing to do with it. You better sleep on the subway. No elevator, dirty and smelly carpets. Horrible beds. We sleep with our clothes on!!!

Reviews.Title: “A steal for Manhattan - clean & friendly with fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: BexYo
Reviews.Content: A fun, unique place to stay in Manhattan at a very affordable price. The room was perfectly clean, no bedbugs at all, the bathroom was spotless, all linens fresh. We were in an inside room (windows facing a brick wall) so there was no noise at all. It was too hot but anybody who has lived in NYC knows how heating works -- you have to open a window and turn on the fan. Luckily we had very little need to deal with staff, but when we did, they were prompt, polite and efficient. Location is excellent, right at the entrance of the #1 subway line, so you can get to all the major spots in minutes. We are both seasoned travelers and were quite satisfied with this hotel -- don't know why there is so much negative stuff on this site. One additional feature, if you like coffee, it's right over a Starbucks so we awakened to the smell of fresh brewed coffee! Not a bad way to wake in a city that never sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but helpful staff, clean (if rather dark) and in great location for eating and getting around by subway”
Reviews.Author: anndailly
Reviews.Content: Three adults and three teenagers stayed 1-4th December 2010 and the only complaint was that one of the rooms was nice with all facilities (such as a wardrobe and bedside tables with lamps) where the other two were very basic, although they were all supposed to be the same standard. They were clean though. The corridors were dark but hey! very Morrocan. We all had a great time, found the staff friendly and helpful and it was easy to get to anywhere very cheaply by subway 24/7. Some great restaurants nearby if you wanted to eat locally too. Try Toast on the other side of the road for to die for food and lovely staff. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: tynsley24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel with two friends last weekend. First of all, parking was very far away. The woman behind the desk was so rude I almost decided to leave as soon as we got there. We booked a room with two beds so we could all get ready together but when we got to the hotel they had changed our rooms and given us two. The size of the rooms was laughable. From the doorway, I could touch the other side of the bed. To get into the bathroom, a lot of manuevering had to be done. I could put my foot onto the toilet from the beds end. After our night out in NYC we returned to our hotel to find the stairwell and lobby so packed with people that we could not move. The people theat were in the stairwell and lobby were scary off the street kind of people. THUGS! I was scared to sleep that night.

Reviews.Title: “Astonishingly Horrible Service..resonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: busybond
Reviews.Content: Ill start by saying that this is not my first time in New York city, so I knew that I was not booking nor paying for a grandiose hotel, I was booking somewhere to sleep. In some cases this hotel surpassed my expectations, in others, it was a complete fail. First, the room and bathroom were quite clean and troublesome free. There was a television problem but I did not mind. The neighborhood is fantastic and it was very easy to travel around. The problems I had mainly took place the night that I checked- in: the bellman did not even offer to help my daughter and wife with their luggage. They literally stood at the front desk chatting up a storm and stared at my family and I. This would not be so problematic if the hotel had an elevator, but it did not. I even asked if I could have help with the luggage and the young man made a disgruntled sigh before disappearing into the back office where he had visibly kicked his feet up and played with his phone. The other was stumbling around the bar flirting like he was a prepubescent child. This is true, and I really wish I was making this up. Later that night I came back to the hotel and my door was not working, after changing my keys FOUR times, the clerk told me that I had to wait until the night manager arrived until I could go into my room; he was due to arrive at 11pm, at that moment it was 9:30. He arrived early and simply changed the batteries to my door,this took him two minutes and I wondered why on earth couldn't one of the the 5 men or women working downstairs could not do that it was not like they were busy! Hell, I would have changed the battery myself if I would have know that was the problem. All in all, my stay would not have been so bad if the hotel management hired a more capable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: iainmic
Reviews.Content: We had no problems at all with the Marrakech, and for the price in New York, I don't think you can ask for any more. Yes the rooms are small, but we only wanted a base to use for exploring NY, and for those purposes it's fine- Subway is right outside, and you can get anywhere in a very short time from there. We had no issues with cleanliness/ or bed bugs, there were problems with the water one day, but signs were placed around the hotel explaining the issue and that the water company were fixing the leak straightaway. We did not get our bags until the last day of our stay, and I must say the staff were really helpful assisting us with calling the airline, explaining where to shop for cheap items, and were generally very supportive in a stressful situation. I can't comment on noise in reception, as we were on the 5th floor, but the walls are thin and can be a bit noisy. I would suggest people read the reviews before they book, and if they book a budget hotel not to expect the world in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection for our needs!”
Reviews.Author: Voyage8082
Reviews.Content: This was my sixth stay at this hotel, my daughter studies at one of the 13 prestigious schools in Morningside Heights.The location including the subway entrance at door and walking distance to a vibrant restaurant and nightlife scene is an ideal situation.The staff is very attentive, rooms / price by NYC standard are more than adequate.The clientele is very international including me...nice feel! Being a frequent guest I am especially welcomed .

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a bowling alley”
Reviews.Author: ministeed
Reviews.Content: No bedbugs, no vermin, other than pigeons on the window sills outside. Tiny but clean. Hot water near scalding. Was near lobby and the room was loud. Reminded me of my college dorm experience, which was "active". All young folks and all seemed oblivious to the fact that they were sharing space with others. Doors slammed at all hours of the night and people coming and going, talking in the halls. Walls are tissue paper thin as far as sound is concerned. Sleep is difficult if not impossible. The location is convenient and price was low. If one is a 20-something backpacker, this place may suffice. For "adults", this isn't a viable choice; low cost and convenient location are not enough. No elevator and at least 20 steps up to enter. Starbucks right next door and plenty of restaurants in the area. Subway directly across the street. Still, none of the positives is enough to offset the fact that it is like sleeping in a bowling alley. If one is on a tight budget and suffers from insomnia, this may be an option to consider. Otherwise, as they say in parts of NYC, forget about it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay for BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: chadjelek
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel blindly on Travelocity's "Top Secret Hotel Deals". Great location, three stars, for a great rate, seemed like a steal at the time. But now, not only do I have to deal with bed bugs for 3-6 weeks, but I have to pay for the privilege! I stayed at the Marrakech Hotel. This hotel absolutely has bed bugs. They are not taking their bug problem seriously. Therefore if you stay at this hotel, you will be bitten by bed bugs, you will have to deal with this disgusting problem for a month, and your subsequent pleas will fall on deaf ears. My reports to management weren't taken seriously and they tried to pawn my bite marks off on other city attractions (that I didn't got to). I am positive that I was attacked by bed bugs at this hotel. I was only in town for a few days on business and the only time I held still long enough for the bugs to get me was when I was sleeping. I know they are bed bug bites because they were verified by my doctor. When I contacted the hotel to report this problem, I was told that they were unaware of any bed bug problem, however the internet reviews I've read since then would prove otherwise. Also, refuting the possibility of them not knowing was when the manager Keith told me that they would do "what they normally do" in these situations and call in an exterminator to see what they could find. (Notice they have a normal way to handle problems that they don't know they have.) Keith said that he would call me back the following day... that was a week ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Money!”
Reviews.Author: aggienmmi2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel blindly through Travelocity and after I read the reviews on Tripadvisor, I was very nervous about staying here. But this hotel just proved that the reviews are not correct. It seems people are not familiar with boutique hotels or NYC for that matter, but this is a standard quality boutique hotel in NYC. The rooms are small, that's NYC, but really I've had MUCH MUCH smaller, and I felt this one was relatively spacious. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've had in any hotel in a while. The place was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, its literally 28 steps to the subway (we counted). What more could you ask for at the price you're paying? In NYC, you're crazy to expect any more than this for the price. If you want 4 stars in NYC, pay for it - don't expect to get something you're not paying for. Also, there have been people mention that the hotel is in Harlem. This belies a lack of understanding about the city. This hotel is firmly, completely, and in every way 100% in the Upper West Side. Harlem is at least 7 blocks up by official standards, and really its 22 blocks to the heart of Harlem. The neighborhood is wonderful, nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “Great - for a college dorm”
Reviews.Author: ABQTravels
Reviews.Content: OK, I got this hotel off of Priceline and really wanted to prove a lot of these reviews wrong. So, I'll start with the positive stuff. It's clean enough for a few nights. The mattress is firm and there are no bugs or mice as previously stated. Housekeeping made by bed and the location is great - the 1 train is across the street and there's a Starbucks downstairs. The stairs weren't bad for me - I was on the floor of the lobby which is 23 steps from the street. For New York prices, the beer selection is scant but decently priced. Here's the negative stuff. First I'll start with the stuff I know they can't change. The rooms are small. You know that small room in your home that you don't know what to do with so you leave it for boxes and "stuff"? That's your hotel room. There's no thermostat heat. You get a floor heater - I assume it's a plumbing issue with a historic building. The hot water is sporadic. At one point in my shower, I would be scalded and in a matter of seconds, it became luke warm. Now the stuff that needs to change. I get that people need jobs - however, I don't like that the college students who work here are allowed to play their music rather loudly at all hours of the night. I arrived extremely late due to flight delays and had to ask AT 1 AM for them to turn down the music. Now, it's almost 11pm on my second night and I'll have to ask AGAIN for the music to be turned down. I know people want to enjoy themselves, but I have a room and need sleep. That's what hotels are for! The language. While hanging out in the lounge, one coworker decided he needed to let ALL of us know what he thought about another coworker. As I'm writing this, I can hear them all talking about what they're doing tonight after their shifts outside of my door. The young lady, while very nice, has a voice that carries. And she's not a quiet person. I understand that I'm next to the lobby and conversation happens - perhaps a door needs to be set up to separate the party goers from those of us who are here truly just for a place to sleep. This is ridiculous. In conclusion, do yourself and your thighs a favor and get a room far from the lobby if you have to stay here. Deal with the dark decoration (it's a Moroccan-themed hotel) and don't expect much. And certainly don't pay full price. It's not worth it. The rooms are small, but this is New York City - everything is small. If past reviews have been any indication, the general manager will read this and post a message apologizing. I really do appreciate that this is being done, but I don't want to stay here again, I don't want to talk to the general manager the next time I'm in town. I want to forget that I was here and that I had to deal with the college kids outside my door throwing a party in the lounge. Oh yes, please make sure that Tv's have remotes. I can't recommend this place to tourists. If you're used to noise and the hustle and bustle of the city, this place probably won't bother you. If you want to actually be in your room for more than a shower, spend a little more and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: strawberrygirlwa
Reviews.Content: A great price, close to the metro, friendly staff, and air conditioning in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but ok for two nights.”
Reviews.Author: BruceO1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was ok. The room is very small, but clean. Make no mistake, this is not a luxury hotel by any means. There is a small bed, TV (flatscreen), and a bathroom. There is no coffee machine, microwave, or refrigerator. I am not complaining about that, just letting people know what to expect. Also, if you have a hard time climbing up stairs, stay elsewhere. There is no elevator and most of the rooms are at least 4 or 5 stories up. It was reasonable for New York, but almost any other city, they could not get even half what they charge. The neighborhood is safe and there is a subway station right on the corner. There are some decent restaurants close as well. All in all, not a bad place to stay, but certainly not that great either. The staff was nice and they do have wi-fi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - It's a dump”
Reviews.Author: evakovac
Reviews.Content: Dark, musty, no lifts, towels are yellow/gray with holes, staff couldn't be bothered..., far too expensive for what it is - a budget motel!!!; we booked via newyorkhotels.com and paid USD280!!!. Definitely the worst hotel I stayed in NY. We only had to stay because of an error in booking (be very careful when using newyorkhotels.com booking system!! - in addition, the facts are not as represented on their website e.g. Marakech rooms don't offer free wireless as claimed!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you don't need much sleep”
Reviews.Author: mrsholmes2b
Reviews.Content: After being moved from the Broadway Hotel and Hostel, we checked into the Marrakech. We were on the 5th floor, and there aren't any lifts. Although my fiance and I are both young and fit, after a busy day of sightseeing, the stairs were an absolute killer! The room itself was fine, sheets were clean etc. The bath tub was a bit old and battered, but the shower was powerful (the hot water took a long time to come through, but did eventually come though hot) The staff were pretty helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok when we arrived but it got worse as we stayed...”
Reviews.Author: Jtang1
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel we had a look for some friendly advice online so although there were a few bad reviews, these were before their refurb. We were looking for a low-frill hotel to put our heads down at night and we knew we would not be there much with all the sightseeing in place. So we booked without high expectation. Arrival at the hotel was fine, checked in ok and had help with our bags up the six flights of stairs. The room was ok, size not big, not too small for 4 people. The only complaint was the holes in our towels but bed was clean. Fourth night in we were woken up by noises outside our room which was the Police banging on our door and someone shouting down the corridor. We found out the next morning that it was a drunken guest at the hotel and a neigbour had called the Police. That wasn't the hotel's fault but the reason the Police banged on our door was because they weren't escorted by hotel staff and they got the wrong room. On our last night while we were packing, we found that our food was chewed through by mice. We immediately went to report the problem at reception. The guy told us he'll make a note of the incident and asked us to take it up with the manager in the morning. We spoke to Keith the next day but he made an excuse that it was caused by the engineering work on the Metro, at one point he laughed. He didn't offer any compensation or seem too concerned with the situation. We had to ask for compensation which was agreed but we're yet to receive. We're still waiting for them to write to us after a month. I wouldn't stay there again purely because of the mice and how they've dealt with the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, safe and clean”
Reviews.Author: vikkijg
Reviews.Content: Great location on the Upper West side. Had never been to New York and so a good first time experience. Right on the main subway line. Safe at all times of the day and night. Only beef was that we had to climb four flights of stairs- no lift!

Reviews.Title: “If you are happy with basic, and good value for money then this is it”
Reviews.Author: LondonRomey
Reviews.Content: Before my trip to New York, I spent weeks trying to find a reasonably priced hotel as close to the centre of Manhatten as possible. This is NYC, probably one of the most if not THE most expensive city in the world. This hotel ticks all the boxes for good value for money, and although not quite central. It takes no more than 20 minutes of leaving the hotel and jumping on the subway to be in the heart of it. I came to New York knowing that a hotel would literally be somewhere to dump my luggage and somewhere to put my head down as there is just way to much to do to spend very much time in a hotel. The hotel staff were great, always friendly and accomodating, we had trouble one day getting into our room with the key card, it turned out the battery had completely died and needed replacing. They were onto it straight away, and fixed immediately. The rooms are small, but had all you need. A flat screen TV and CD player (most 4 stars don't have this). OK, it doesn't have a lift. But neither did a little plush 4* hotel we stayed in Quebec that had great reviews. So you get what you pay for and shouldn't complain if you expect any more, if you do then you'll have to pay more....way...way more........

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT go to this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skyglass
Reviews.Content: First of all, they would NOT let you check in untill 3 pm. This is NOT a hotel, Its MOTEL. Room is tiny, you dont really have any space to even put anything next the bed. The towel in the bathroom was wet when I checked in! Meaning it was somebody's used towel and they dont change if it looks clean. The TV does not work at all. which I didnt even bother to ask because the front desk people are UNBELIEVABLY RUDE, they laugh at you when you're upset with the services. One of the guy in front desk who kept my luggage put a prank on me that they dont have my bag and said that some guy took all my stuff!!! and when he saw my horrified face, he laughed at me and said he's joking because I looked tired!!!!!!!!!. If that wasnt enough, he continually enjoyed putting a phone prank on me saying that I signed for community services!!! What kind of hotel is this?? When I went to the front desk to complain about this idiot, they laughed at me saying that thats what he does!!!! Please, Please DO NOT GO TO MARRAKECH HOTEL. This hotel is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “To Be Fair...This is a Decent Hotel in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: hc546
Reviews.Content: We read reviews on TA before booking so to clear up a few things... 1. There are no lifts but the staff are more than happy to help you out 2. There is music in the lobby but the lobby is also the bar area so it is not without reason. 3. There is no space to unpack - this is totally true be prepared to live out of your case! The rooms were bigger than many rooms I have stayed in in NYC, they were basic but in my opinion clean. The aircon is old and therefore noisy which is annoying wherever you stay! The bathroom was very small although the shower was big and very good. The location was great in my opinion - there is a subway outside of the door and walking to a lot of places is pretty easily. overall we would stay here again. I would struggle to recommend a much better hotel for the same rate...you get what you pay for in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there at all unless you like sharing a bed with cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Sandyd1204
Reviews.Content: The Marrakesh hotel is in Harlem although said to be upper west side it is infact just inside Harlem itself, so that in itself was not a good start. There was just a doorway on the street and led straight up stairs with dirty carpet and no lift or any way to get your luggage up apart from lugging them up yourself. The staff were friendly and approachable on check in. Upon going into my room the first thing was that it was very small with one very small double bed when we had been told would be two. The bedside cabinet was dirty and broken with no access to drawer. The phone didnt work, there were no hangers and the bed creaked very badly. The view from the window was of a brick wall immediately outside. The carpet was dirty and generally the entire room was grubby. There was no safe in the rooms exept for in reception. We asked for an iron and were bought some ice (about 20 mins later). Told them we ordered an iron and not ice and an hour later had to ask reception again, ending up going to housekeeping and getting one ourselves. Then we saw something on the headboard of the bed. I got some tissue and grabbed it and took it to reception, not sure what it was. Reception confirmed it was a cockroach, we told them we were not happy and would not stay in the room, so they moved us to another room at the other end of the hotel which was adequate but still small and shabby and meant climbing 5 flights of stairs with out luggage. Before leaving the room the first room there were two more cockroaches to be seen. The hotel said and l quote 'We do not have a problem with cockroaches', well they may not but I DO!! We moved to the other room as it was late by this time but did not sleep at all. (After being up for 36 hours travelling). In the morning phoned my travel agent to get me out of there and find me another hotel. which they did and we moved to the lower east side in the Bentley hotel which was amazing and perfect. So my advice would be avoid the Marrakesh hotel at all costs, its a terrible, dirty shabby hotel with dim lighting that covers a multitude of sins, including the cockroaches that 'they dont have a problem with' :-(. Not a good first day in my first holiday in ten years. 4 Star?, more like minus 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a hotel, it's a motel.”
Reviews.Author: JCfromLA
