Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and here is what I gathered (see noted below). One of the taxi drivers told me that this place used to be a hostel so you can guess what this motel is like. Pro: - The location is ok (upper west side) and it is very close to a subway station. - Next to a Starbucks - Walking distance to the central park - Walking distance to a few small grocery stores - Housekeeping service daily - Cheap taxi rides from Time Square to the hotel, roughly $12 to $14. - A small but working air condition unit - Relatively clean, but you can tell the housekeeping folks do miss a few spots (or it may be the stains, etc). Con: - Very thin wall, you can hear what is going on outside, downstairs, upstairs, next doors, etc. - No heater (will be an issue if stay during the winter time) - No remote for the TV - No closet space, there is a rack right next to the door that has a few hangers. - Don't expect the typical stuff you get from a hotel (room service, ironer, TV remote) - Small bathroom (a few minor things - shower doesn't work really hard - hard to adjust water temperatures, a few tiles in the shower were replaced ( you can totally tell, it's a different color), one of the bath towels provided was torn and has a hole in it) My conclusion - It's a motel, not a hotel. Don't expect much. Note: After tax, I paid roughly $270 a night for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaC2010
Reviews.Content: First of all, the pictures on the website are a lie! I booked through Travelocity and thought the hotel was going to be what I read online. I had no idea the hotel did not have elevators. The first room we we got was on the fifth floor as we are walking up five flights of a dark, very humid,dirty carpeted staircase, to our surprise the room was just the same!!!!! The very small window AC was not blowing air, the room was dingy and cold looking it did not feel inviting in the least! I eventually asked for another room after it never cooled down. We get to our room and even though cooler the AC was located behind my bed so when sleeping I had to put pillows up so it was not blowing directly on my head. When I did that it made the room warmer and uncomfortable. The mattress was so bad, I actually felt the springs poking me! I did not get one nights good sleep! The lamp did not work, the bathroom was very small and dirty, there was visable dirt on the toilet paper holder! There was no closet, all we had was a dilapidated metal shelf. The blowdryer did not work and there was not a mirror outside the room like most hotels. One night the toilet overflowed and we had to call to have someone come up with a plunger!!!! If your looking for comfort, cleanliness and convenience YOU WILL NOT FIND IT HERE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonFattony
Reviews.Content: Stayed In a 2 double bed room on the third floor. Room was of a good size as was the bathroom. the bed sheets were clean on everyday as were the towels and toiletries in the bathroom. the room had a flatscreen tv and ikea type wardrobe to hang clothes. As has been said no lift but the staff in the hotel were both helpfull and freindly. the subway 103 street on the 1 line was next to hotel and was great for getting us around manhattan . As for food sal and carmines opposite sell a great pizza and the no frills diner 100 yards along broadway sold a great breakfast. This is a good value hotel with the budget minded tourist in mind. yes i,m sure there will be complaints about this hotel but on the whole i found it very good.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for more such a great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: momyto2
Reviews.Content: We stayed with young kids literally a toddler and baby just after july 4th weekend. After reading the negative reviews we didnt know what to expect but got more than what we asked for :) The hotel building is old and obviously the rooms are small and lobby is even smaller. but common this is NY where can you get this kind of rate? we booked thru hotwire but i would recomend you go online thru the hotel site to save $$$. I want to neatly outline my experience and the reason for 5 stars 1) We reached early very early but were checked in by the kind staff at no extra charge. 2) on seeing that we have baby the nice girl asked us to wait for 10 mins so that she can give us a first floor room as hotel does not have elevators this is without even me asking 3) The beel boy quickly came to get our bags and got them to our room 4) through out the stay the staff was kind and courteous got us tickets to the sightseeing bus and also upgraded it with a huge discount 5) we always came back to a clean room besides the location is unbeatable, starbucks, subway and that neat little mexican place you just cant go wrong with this one. Thank you Marakech staff we had a great NY vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: edward_wolff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, right in front of a subway station, at Upper West Side. The environment is a little bit too dark, and the lounge music exaggerated. The room is ok, but there are no elevators. So, if you donÂ´t mind going upstairs loaded with shopping bags, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel with an awesome location...”
Reviews.Author: ynth
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel, the location was great with the 1 was at the corner, diners down the street and Starbucks next door. No elevator and you immediately have to walk up a flight of stairs just to check in. They have a bar with tasty drinks you can take back to your room. The room is a normal boutique size with "Moroccan" flair. My room had a very nice flat screen TV and a radio/cd player/ alarm clock. The bathroom was clean and big for the size of the room. No view, no restaurant and normal NYC noise. All of this was fine with me and I will keep this hotel in mind whenever I go back for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMrs
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal and were very satisfied with our stay. Our first impression was great - yes, while there is club music playing in the lobby/hotel bar, the atmosphere is fun and upbeat. The staff is very helpful, funny, and friendly. The room, while small, was perfect for the two of us (traveled with a friend). The room was clean, had great character and (best part) a working A/C to combat the horrid July heat and humidity. While the neighborhood isn't the most vibrant and busy, it's comfortable, very close to transit and Central Park, and has great access to some yummy bagels and bakeries. One thing to note: five flights of stairs and no elevator. Had a great stay! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Unconscionable”
Reviews.Author: StopHop42
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a great get away for my girlfriends and I - we expected a vacation in itself while staying at this hotel. We had a TERRIBLE experience. Besides the good location, there is nothing to say good about this hotel. There are NO elevators which we were not told about. The music in the lobby was pumping out club beats and made it very hard to hear the man at the reception, who hit on us immediately upon check in and then again when we called down about our awful room. The room we were given was nothing close to what is pictured on the internet. The rugs were badly stained, and the beds were uncomfortable and had no blankets. We didn't stay more than 15 minutes before changing our minds about staying at this hotel. We were supposed to only be charged for the first night of our two night stay (as it states in their cancellation policy), however I was charged for both nights which put my bank account into overdraft. I tried to call and reach the manager about this issue and only received attitude and the run around from the staff at the front desk. When I finally got through to the manager after a week (his name is Keith) he barely showed concern about the disposition of his staff or the state of his hotel. I am still waiting for my refund. Do NOT stay at this hotel. We found a better rate at the Double Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but lacks customer service and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: kcmotrvlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night (THANKfully) and the smoke alarm would not stop screaming during the night. My husband had to get dressed and go to the front desk. Someone then came back to the room, turned on the lights (at 3:30am) and had to remove the smoke detector (AND it was one that spoke saying carbon monoxide had been detected!). After all this, we were still charged full price. As we were heading out for breakfast, the front desk told my husband feel free to check out between 12:00pm - 1:00pm. When we checked out at 12:30pm, we were told that due to our inconvenience through the night, they were waving the late check-out fee which is normally an extra $50-70. How about telling us upfront that we could check out late due to the inconvenience or have $50 taken off our bill when we check out on time?!! I am completely fine with paying for what I asked for, which was a room for one night, but I think it's bad customer service when the facts are not laid out up front only so they get what they want in the end with no regard for the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location & great cocktail bar!! (But no lift)”
Reviews.Author: FissyW
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in June at the Marrakech, overall it was a good experience. The bathroom appeared to be very new and it was nice although could've been cleaner. Plus points: the bedroom benefitted from a/c which was welcomed as it was very hot, there was also a hairdryer and toiletries as well as a new tv on the wall and a cool cocktail bar! We also left our bags with reception at a charge of $2 per bag the day we checked out. The location was good too with a metro stop outside and Starbucks next door. Downsides: no lift; no safe and no real storage space which in a small room was a squeeze. Try the diner down the road called "Broadway", very NYC and ace breakfasts!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: aniblue
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel was unexpectedly nice and clean. Granted, we had to climb five flights of stairs to our room, and granted, they forgot to leave toilet paper behind a couple of times -my one gripe is calling the front desk to get toilet paper and finally having to go downstairs to get it myself. Yet the room was clean, the bed was super clean and we had fresh linen and towels everyday. It's also a great area for good eats at cheaper prices than midtown. There's a fab diner to its left- no frills but GREAT omelets and pancakes- and one of the best middle eastern fast foods eateries I've tried. The subway station is right across the street and everyone in this residential area was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NYC hotel especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: yissylevi
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand the negative reviews on this hotel--I have been to many hotels all over the world and this one was very good. Yes there is no elevator but the stairs are not that bad--the staff will help you with you baggage if needed. There is a charming bar and lobby downstairs. The staff were friendly and the rooms were clean, well kept and newly renovated. There were no issues with the towels or bed bugs and the TV worked perfectly as did the wifi internet. Yes the rooms are small but that is standard for New York City hotels--they are no smaller than the rooms in the New Yorker for example. In addition most hotel rooms in NYC look out into other buildings--this is Manhattan and it is the nature of the place. Whilst this is not a luxury hotel for the price you are getting really good value for money. All in all this is a very cute hotel which is very well designed and kept in a great location. As someone who has traveled allot I would come back to this hotel anytime and also recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you get a bargain rate”
Reviews.Author: RdTripMom
Reviews.Content: Pro: It is convenient to subway, only one stop from Columbia; newly renovated bathroom was clean albeit tiny. Con: Very uncomfortable bed, broken TV, tiny room at the end of a long, dark corridor; thumping noise when hot water is on in shower; no closet (over the door coat rack); tiny pieces of furniture were old & battered, like something from a Maine summer house, no heat from the radiator, noise from bathroom next door. It feels like a renovated rooming house and sound travels from the halls the way it does in your house. It's like a high end hostel, not a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Website Misleading”
Reviews.Author: cljenkns
Reviews.Content: We have been to many great boutique hotels that are reasonably priced. Based on the website, we thought this would be no different. Unfortunately, our actual hotel experience didn't match the nicely put-together website. The room was small, the bathroom even smaller. There were little to no amenities. Several things inside the room were broken (IPod dock, remote control). The staff was less than helpful and not experienced. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: Ely63
Reviews.Content: I was worried when I read the reviews, but overall this hotel is ok. The entrance and steep stairs are a bit like going into a late night club. The stairs are a nightmare if you end up on the 5th floor, although when we asked for help the staff were very happy to assist. Our room was tiny, but clean, as was the bathroom, although our towels had seen better days & were full of holes. You can hear everyone else when they flush the loo or have a shower, which is not great if people are leaving very early.The bed is a standard double (british), & the air con is the old fashioned through the window style which is very noisy. On the plus side, the Starbucks is next door, & the metro is 50yds away, cheap & only takes 15mins to Times Square. The area offers some really good restaurants (Indus - Indian & excellent) convenience shops, take aways & is lively & safe in the evenings. You can cut through to Central Park, but I wouldn't recommend it after dark, as it isn't very well lit. WiFi is free in the Moroccan themed lounge. If you are doing 3 nights, this hotel is fine, but any more nights, or if you like space & home comforts, sleep & a good soak in a deep bath then avoid this hotel for something more lavish.

Reviews.Title: “MICE/MOUSE issue, Holes and Stains on Towels, Dust, and mattress is a box spring”
Reviews.Author: Vince1968
Reviews.Content: I had to write this review to save you from picking this Hotel. It's doesn't deserve the 2.5 - 3 star rating. I got in late, so I put up with the hard spring like mattress and dust. But when I saw the holes and stains on all 3 towels plus there is rust on the shelves it turned me off. However, I was too tired and I've already unpacked so again I put up with it. However, at 3am I woke up to get a drink of water when I noticed a MICE crawling near my bed. I'm a guy, so I don't scream but I certainly don't want a mice crawlilng around while I sleep. So I had to try to sleep with all of the lights on to scare the MICE from coming out. I didn't get much sleep. Needless to say, I will NEVER go back to this place again. For $200/night, I would have expected a little bit more even for NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Location/Staff”
Reviews.Author: jasonbenoit73
Reviews.Content: The price was excellent. The hotel is located on Broadway and surrounded by great restaurants. Clean rooms and accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “I can only reccommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: EndlessFighter
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August 2009 and it was more than I expected. Frankly, I had just moved out of a HORRIBLE hotel in midtown, so maybe my expectations were low. But the room I got had a queen bed and enough space to put my suitace aside, a rack to hang some clothes and a window still big enough to also put some stuff on. The bathroom was small but clean and enough for 1-2 people. My room had, as mentioned, a queen bed, a bedside tapble with reading lamp and telephone, flat screen tv with a lot of channels and pay per view movies, another small table under the tv with a CD radio alarm and a rack to hang clothes on. The lobby/bar are very charming. They're decorated in a marroccean style with very comfy couches and chairs. I spent ours there on one rainy evening, just curled up in one of the chairs reading a book and people watching. The hotel is on Broadway (corner 103rd street) but the subway station is right next to the hotel entrance and everything is easily accesible with the 1 train. The only minus point I give this hotel is that the A/C is build into the window, so if you have a room that goes out onto broadway it might get a little loud in the mornings but it wasn't so bad. There's also no lift and steep stairs you have to climb but the bellman carries your luggage, so it's okay :) So, if you're not looking for luxury but a nice, clean place to stay, this is definitely THE place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Fabulous Staff, Extremely Clean - will definitely stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyDNorthampton
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews we were very pleasantly surprised to find that our room was cleaned to a high standard, We stayed in the queen room which was just big enough for two people. Facilities are basic, ensuite room with tv and phone, internet access, phones, bar downstairs in the foyer. Starbucks next door to the hotel along with lots of eating out options and bars. The subway is seconds from the hotel which will take you on a direct route from 103rd to 42nd Time Square in a matter of 5-7 minutes. Cannot praise the reception and bar staff enough. We were 'stranded' due the volcano for an extra 5 nights and they were extremely helpful and welcoming. This is a great option for adults but I would not recommend it for families with young children, as it does not cater to the 'extra' needs such as space to run around and tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms - but then this is reflected in the price!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap chic”
Reviews.Author: Stew316
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for six nights in April along with friends. We booked with a budget in mind as it wasn't our only stop on the trip, and were more than pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and ensuite. Beds were comfortable, plenty of floor-space, storage was adequate, and more bedding/pillows were available no quibble on request from the front desk. Cleanliness was top notch. The shower was good, but it took a few days to really get the hang of getting it to stay at a given temperature. The location - mere steps from the 103rd St subway station - was fine. You were far enough away from the bustle of downtown, with the convenience of a short subway ride to wherever you want to go. The free wifi was just about available in our room, but that was a bonus as it is only really advertised as being available in the lobby/bar area, where connection was a breeze. Staff were helpful and courteous on the few occasions we had cause to deal with them. The decor was nice, especially around the lobby/bar, where the Moroccan theme is emphasised. Speaking of the bar area, a real gem of the stay was the red-headed barmaid named Heyden in the Kazbar Lounge. She was super cool, extremely talented (a future singing star) and genuinely made us feel welcome. In fact, when she was working, we never felt the need to venture out to find another bar. The only real downside is the lack of an elevator, which is a pain if you've got big luggage. There's probably not much that can be done to remedy that, given the location, but it should be a genuine concern for people who have trouble with stairs. It's one flight just to get to the lobby, then further flights from there to the different levels. Overall though, for a relatively cheap, yet stylish place to stay, the Marrakech will take some beating.

Reviews.Title: “mixed thoughts”
Reviews.Author: lilkal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was seconds from the subway which was 10 mins into time square and quite safe to use. There is a starbucks next door to the hotel. Check was very quick and the people very friendly and helpful. We were stranded in new york because of the volcano. We had 4 rooms. 310 and 311 which were quite from traffic noise but no hotel noise, 408 which had a window that looked onto a brick wall which if you put your arm out the window you could touch and 416 which felt like you were sleeping outside on the pavement. Sheets, towels and bathrooms spotless clean (we ususally stay in the Westin at time square and found the cleanliness on the same lines as there). Unfortunately the walls are paper thin and you could hear next door pulling their shower curtain. The hotel is very dark which was a little worrying as we wondered what it was hiding. The corridors are painted a darkish blue with terracota door frames and the lights have metal/bronze shades over them making the corridors extremely dark, the rooms are painted in these dark colours and they are also very dark. My children have stayed in many hostels on their trips and said it was like staying there but the linen was cleaner. The carpet was stripey and when you walk down the stairs you have to look hard as the stripes make it hard to see where the step ends and the next begins. There are no lifts but the guys there were more than happy to help my 70 year of in laws with their bags (we actually felt sorry for them and we all carried our bags). Reception staff were lovely but the two girls we met serving behind the bar was very ignorant and felt like they were doing you a huge favour in serving you. There is a housing project development behind the hotel and I would not suggest walking through there. We used the subway at all times of the day and even coming home one night at 1:30am and it was perfectly safe and quite crowded. In short I would not stay there again but once i got in my room and saw it was clean I breathed a sigh of relief. There were no funny smells either. My children said they would not mind staying there again although the location put them off, it was not a good area to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: NixiBixi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marrakech for 8 nights. I had been reluctant to book initially due to the number of negative reviews and was pleasantly surprised when I arrived. Overall, it's clean, comfortable, within a stone's throw of the subway and the staff are helpful and friendly, making it excellent value in my opinion. The hotel does play loud music in the lobby in the evening, which wasn't to my personal taste, but we weren't disturbed by this in our room (on the 4th) but were glad we weren't on the 2nd floor where the lobby is. Our room was comfortable and clean. My partner is 6ft2 and found the bed perfectly long enough for him. The room wasn't massive (double bed, bedside tables on each side and a bit of extra space) but we had enough hanging space (one of those metal framed clothes storage units with some fabric covering it) and space to move around. We had new sheets and towels each day. We could, however, hear the shower of the adjoining bedroom and some noise did come through the walls from our neighbours when they were being a little rowdy, but nothing terrible at all and no more than would be experienced anywhere, really. Yes, there are some stairs from the street into the hotel (I didn't find these particularly steep and was able to carry my heavy suitcase up and down & I'm no body builder) and there's no lift, so for people with mobility issues this might not be the best choice. We didn't have any view from our window, but this didn't matter to us at all. Location: The hotel is a 10 min walk away from central park, which was wonderful. Some posters have commented that to get there you have to walk through a 'project'. There are plenty of routes to get to the park, one of which you walk through some high rised housing, but this didn't bother us at all, we hardly noticed, hardly saw any people least of all those dealing drugs, the part we walked through actually had a children's play area on one side and definitely wasn't intimidating at all. There wasn't even any rubbish around. There would be no reason to feel intimidated, in my opinion. We walked around the area lots at night and always felt very safe. There's a cute & inexpensive diner called the Metro near the hotel which is a good, straight forward place to eat with a large menu.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: rgaldamez
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4/16-4/18 and here is my honest opinion of the Marrakech Hotel in NY. I found this hotel to be in a great location, this being my 1st trip to NY ever I wanted somewhere close to the Train station so I couldn't get lost, this place was wonderful. When I arrived it was pouring rain and I was checked in, in less then 10min. The room was small but would do for what I needed, the only issue was the TV and Telephone did not work, but not a big deal. The room was clean the bathroom had plenty of hot water, the bed a bit hard and it squeaked but other then that no complaints, and I did not hear any noise inside or out side I slept like a baby. The Lobby bar was wonderful, the bartender on Friday night was great her name escapes me right now but she was so nice and fun she made my arrival wonderful and the drinks were made just right. The night person that works M-F after 12M at the check in desk was a cutie not only was he so helpful in telling me where to go and where not to go, but he actually sat down with me and went over every area of NY with me. Great, knowledgeable guy. Check out was fast, gave my room # and returned my key and that was it. I will be back to NY in June and will be staying at the Marrakech Hotel again Rachel

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Fun meets Comfy”
Reviews.Author: ArtLover15
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at your great boutique hotel. Everything was perfect; from the decor & cleanliness to the helpful staff and the great food (pizza too!) all around the (unpretentious & not expensive) neighborhood. The upper west side is fun to walk around and central to everything with a Metro station right outside the door. The young woman who tends the cozy little lounge is an opera singer with a personality as big as an apple. Thanks a million for making our stay fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “More budget hotel than boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Number66
Reviews.Content: It was our hotwire.com booking which led us to the Marrakech hotel. Fortunately we obtained a good deal with hotwire. On approaching the Marrakech Hotel, the exterior signage gives the impression of a rather grand hotel. However, the reality is somewhat different. As soon as you step through the front door you are greeted by a dark steep narrow staircase which leads to the reception area. And this is my main issue with the Marrakech Hotel: it tries to portray itself as being something greater than it actually is. I challenge some of the boasts made on the website: "newly renovated accommodations" - our bedroom looked as if it had not had a major refurb for 20 years. "fantastic location" - it's not in a fantastic location (compared with, say, Midtown); I would say that it's actually in a not-too-bad location with the convenience of a subway station very close by, giving quick and easy access to many NY tourist destinations. "Situated near Central Park" - yes, it is close to Central Park, but be warned, the most direct way to walk to the park (walking east, along W 103rd St) cuts through a housing project area. When we walked through this area, even though it was in the middle of the afternoon, it was very intimidating. I later discovered that this housing project has been notorious for drug dealing. Don't let this put you off staying at the hotel though, since the area around the hotel itself seemed safe enough - just keep to the main roads when walking to Central Park. "WI-FI, High Speed Internet Access, Free in lobby and lounge" - yes, there is free Wi-Fi, but take your own laptop, otherwise you'll need to pay 20 cents per minute (12 dollars an hour!) to use the hotel's computer. "Starbucks Coffee, The world famous coffee shop located at the hotel" - the wording on the website gave me the impression that there's a dedicated Starbucks IN the hotel; in fact, it's not in the hotel, it's totally separate from the hotel; it's just a normal Starbucks which happens to be next door. Of course this isn't a deal-breaker, but stating that there's a Starbucks AT the hotel could give the misleading impression that this is a hotel with a large luxurious lobby with plenty of facilities, when this is not the case at all. "Sookk Thai Restaurant: This onsite restaurant... " - as with Starbucks, this restaurant is NOT part of the hotel, but just happens to be next door to the hotel. "plush carpeting" - in our bedroom, while not threadbare, the carpet was most certainly not plush! "Double / Double Room - Featuring ... coffee maker" - our room did not have a coffee maker. The best things about this hotel were the closeness to the subway station and the price. The staff were friendly, and they offered to help us carry our cases up the stairs. The bed was comfortable. Apart from the misleading website, the not-so-good things were that our standard double bedroom was small and dark and had a rather jaded appearance. The walls were thin - you could clearly hear people walking or talking in the corridors, for instance. There's no escaping that this is a budget hotel, despite its boutique pretensions. I would recommend the Marrakech Hotel to someone looking for budget accommodation in New York, but I would also warn them to take the descriptions on the hotel's website with a pinch of salt.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE BE CAREFUL!!!! INFESTED WITH BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeoDV
Reviews.Content: EVERYONE, Don't listen to other comments, the hotel is INFESTED with BED BUGS. If you choose to stay, be prepared to have a hell of a night with bugs biting you and having to deal with the bites all day, that could be infectious. NOT RECOMMENDED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for budget”
Reviews.Author: matsMontreal
Reviews.Content: good hotel if your on a budget , very great service at the front desk. Old hotel with some renovation but clean. ac was very noisy and the shower was changing from hot and cold water . Good location, next to the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gnomemother
Reviews.Content: Our second stay, and again can't fault it for value for money and location. Suited us down to the ground. A better room as we paid a little more which was definately worth the money, if we had one with us we could have swung a cat this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: paddler2301
Reviews.Content: Visited NY with my boyfriend during Valentine's Day weekend and stayed at the Marrakech Hotel. If driving into NY, the Marrakech is ideally located since it is in the Upper West Side area (so you don't have to deal with driving downtown). Plus, there is a parking garage close by (located at 101st - between Broadway and Amsterdam) that is reasonably priced. Another bonus is that the number 1 subway stop is just a couple of steps from the hotel. As for the hotel: we stayed in a room with a 'queen' size bed. I have to warn you that their 'queen' is actually a double-sized bed. The room was small but clean. Don't expect anything too fancy - and bring hair conditioner if you use it because the hotel only provides shampoo. The walls are thin and so you can hear everything. The first night, we slept horribly because we were woken up by slamming doors and people in the hallway. Also, we were unlucky to have a room where the was a water pipe right by the bed so we had to deal with water draining/dripping throughout the night. Secone night we slept with earplugs and that solved the problem. People at the front desk were friendly and helpful but they didn't seem to be able to give many suggestions with regards to good restaurants or things to do. The hotel does provide several useful maps upon arrival which is nice. (I highly recommond trying the Sook - thai restaurant - that is a couple of doors away from the hotel). When checking out - know that the hotel charges $2 per piece of luggage (for large luggage - carry-ons are free) if you need to leave them with the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cheap, and Horrible”
Reviews.Author: LesP_Lexington
Reviews.Content: Great location, but the darkly lit stairways are invitations to disaster. The room I had made rooms in Paris look gigantic. I could only get from the telephone to bathroom by climbing over the bed

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: phishphace18
Reviews.Content: No, it's not huge or posh. But it was very cheap for NYC standards. Also, the staff was incredibly accommodating - we got to check out an hour later for no extra charge; the doorman helped us find a place to eat at 3:30 am; and the staff carried our luggage. Overall, it was everything we needed for a weekend in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, fantastic location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: pinknatalie2010
Reviews.Content: I booked the marrakech because a) at the time it was a good cheap hotel, b) because of its location and c) because the photos looked really nice. I wasn't disappointed with the hotel, infact the pictures i'd seen on the internet were exactly the same as the hotel in real life! We had a lovely large room with a comfortable bed, large flat screen tv, telephone and a nice clean bathroom with a fantastic shower! There was always hot water!!! I loved the fact that time hotel was out of the city center which meant we could actually sleep at night time - although the fact the subway is directly across the road meant it only took 5 mins to get to times square! Me and my husband paid for subway passes for a week and it was only $27.00 per person, couldn't ask for anything cheaper really!!! The only downside to the hotel was a problem we had with the toilet - it flooded 3 times whilst we were there and the staff said it was a common problem at the hotel due to drainage - in saying this as soon as we reported it someone came to the room to fix the problem. All in all a fantastic time was had in the city and i loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An ok place, if you don't mind climbing a LOT stairs”
Reviews.Author: Minnimaia
Reviews.Content: We picked up this hotel based on the price and the location ( subway station just outside the entrance ), but had we known there was no lift would propably had picked up another one. The rooms were tidy, but REALLY small, they look a lot bogger on the hotels web page. Staff was very friendly and helpful and the lobby real nice. Wifi only worked in the lobby, not in the rooms. It was a BIG struggle to get in to our room, 4 th floor, no lift and very narrow and steep staircases. Our youngest children were 3 and 5 and we had 6 huge luggage ( a 4 week trip ), fortunately the staff helped us carry the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne23Newcastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marrakech between Christmas and New Year. Everything about it was great! Friendly and helpful staff, nice room and great location. Very near the subway and also near lots of nice cafes and restaurants. Lovely bar in hotel - very comfortable. A very relaxed and fun holiday. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay at this place or refer anyone to this hotel for a place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: DenverBlue
Reviews.Content: I looked on line to try to find a reasonably priced hotel in New York. Based on the Marrakech website, I though the place was decent. It was not. First, the traveler has to climb a steep flight of steps to get to the lobby. When I got to the room, the lamp needed a light bulb, the room was so hot that I was perspiring. I complained and was moved to another room that required climbing another flight of steps (no elevator, but the website doesn't tell you that). The second room was too cold, but it was late at night and I couldn't go elsewhere. I complained immediately and let the management know that I would not be staying any additional nights. They refused to cancel the second night because I didn't notify them by 3:00 pm. I was on the airplane at 3:00 pm, so had no idea that the Marrakech Hotel website was deceptive. The place was not clean, the so called lounge area was tiny and I was told that the bar was temporarily out of service. This is the worst travel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “BEST OUT OF THREE”
Reviews.Author: mdjschin
Reviews.Content: 10 Girls Celebrating The Holiday Season Stayed From12/3/09 TO 12/6/09...The Service was over the top, the rooms wonderful, although we were rarely in them..pillows fluffy, mattresses, thick and comfortable, amenities like soap and shampoo were of high value, one slight problem was no hot water for an hour one morning(no biggie for us) I encountered no hot water at a hotel of 42nd St. in 2006; The subway was sooo close, the bar area was friendly and inviting as we enjoyed a glass of wine after 3 days of shopping and touring the city. In fact, my niece, stated that New Yorkers were friendlier than Texans!!! We are Texans!!!! We will definitely be back...it was over top!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: aliceandbrendon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for nights. The room was small but clean, and very close to the subway which made travel around NY easy. There is a Starbucks directly beside, again, handy for those morning coffees, and a stall over the road for fruit. The cons, the central heating came on in the middle of the night, and it was extremely hot, and also no elevator so was interesting getting up to reception, and then to our room a few floors up. But it was a good price for NY accommodation and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Climbing the Himalayas? This is closer!”
Reviews.Author: 1West
Reviews.Content: Be warned -- 18-20 steps UP to the front door and 25+ more from floor to floor--narrow, poorly lit stairwells make it a challenge for all but mountain goats with built-in headlights. Special bonus--no elevator. Advice: don't bring a suitcase. You can also construct an accurate subway timetable given the station that seems directly below the hotel -- and keep close track of trash pickups that go on all night while the garbage crew noise alternates with the trains to prevent sleeping. OK, keeping it positive: Wi-Fi works in the lobby. Housekeeper let me use the staff fridge. Close to Columbia University.

Reviews.Title: “Worst nigtmare”
Reviews.Author: Tipadvisor9991
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a complete mess. The rooms and the bathrooms are very small. The wc isn't very reliable. The room is and stays filthy. With your fresh towels you get long dark hairs for free. In some rooms the temperature is as high as in a sauna and it isn't possible to adjust the radiator. In all the rooms the streetnoise and the noise from the lounge are incredibly loud. Don't expect any sleep...and yes there is no lift. The management keeps that a secret.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: MarioB4
Reviews.Content: nice place, comfortable, but not lift and not smoking. Near of subway, sure.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: stekes
Reviews.Content: was fairly ok but there was a small from the kitchen thoughout the rooms even though ours was on the third floor (no elevator BTW). Furthermore wi fi connnection was only available at the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: NYCGIRLUK
Reviews.Content: I booked to go to NYC a year ago and to be honest I was a little nervous about heading to this hotel after reading some of the reviews that appeared after we booked however the whole trip was AMAZING!! We were up on 103rd street which was a perfect location as it was nice and quiet at night. There is a subway station right outside the hotel which was fantastic for getting around, it cost us $27 each for a 7 day subway pass which could be used on any line so no need to pay for taxis. We never had to wait any longer than ten minutes between each metro and it took no longer than 15 minutes (at busy times) to travel down to Time Square (42nd street). There is also a 24hr supermarket very close which was rather handy. As for the hotel itself I really don't know what some peope expect for what they pay!! Yeah the hotel rooms are a little on the small side but your in New York all you need it for is sleeping and washing. Our room was cleaned every day with fresh towels always delivered. The staff were all very friendly and always willing to help, there are no elevators however the doormen were more than happy to help me with my suitcase on arrival and departing. All in all we were both very comfortable in this hotel and I would recommend to anyone travelling to NYC on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A 2* hotel with fresh towels and bedding every day...that's enough for me!”
Reviews.Author: JamesR78
Reviews.Content: As usual I'm quite surprised at some of the reviews on here. People seem to think they've booked 5* accommodation at this price! Here is my breakdown: Access: Yes, there are a long flight of stairs and no lift, BUT there were porters every time to carry my bags and they were very chipper about doing it too. Lovely people and very helpful. Reception: Very pleasant and helpful every time. Advised us on places to go and answered all questions easily. Location: I did hesitate when booking as it seemed a bit out of the way, but it's literally next to 103rd subway. So if you want to walk to Central Park it'll take about 10-15 minutes as it's a few blocks to the east, but better still take the subway 4 stops (10 mins) and you'll be down at Central Park and Columbus Circle, which is a great place to start. Getting the #1 subway takes just 6 stops to Times Square and took about 20 minutes, but equally you can take the #1 to 96th, walk 10ft across the platform and get a #2 or #3, and then it's just one more stop. Even down to Lower East Side (where we spent a lot of time due to the good bars) is only about 11 stops. Taxi from the hotel to Lower East Side took about 25 minutes and cost about $25, which we felt was good value as we were wrecked and it was usually about 2am. Rooms: We booked a twin room with 2 double beds. Bathroom was clean and of ok size. Bedroom still had a fair amount of room considering there were 2 double beds in it. There was a wardrobe that was in the sort of Turkish fabric over a frame type thing with hangers in, and 3 shelves. Not enough room really for 2 people to unpack all their clothes but we made do ok. Beds were changed and made every day, and fresh towels provided too. My only major gripe would be that there is only one mirror - in the bathroom - so getting ready was something of a fight! Bar: By the Reception is a nice bar area which at some times was quite busy, and nicely decorated. They have a happy hour every day with different drinks on offer. We usually took a bottle of wine from the local liquor store to our room and the bar staff always opened it for us and loaned us glasses! So all in all I'd definitely recommend it if you're not completely obssessed with Hilton-class comfort! The corridors are a bit gloomy but the rooms are ok. Our room looked out onto 103rd. I'd definitely go back. I think you get out what you put in and people who turn up with attitude probably get it back. Everyone we met who worked there was pleasant and helpful! In the vicinity are some great cheap eateries. Over the road is The Metro Diner which does every type of food you can think of and is stupidly cheap and has an authentic feel about it. We went there for brunch a few days. Also down the road is Hummus Place, which is self explanatory, but the dinner was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: mtonello
Reviews.Content: I just spent six weeks travelling around the northeast of the USA...mainly NYC, Boston, Cape Cod and the islands and Connecticut. I stayed in hotels the entire trip. I stayed in this hotel on the final two nights of my trip, prior to returning to Europe. Here are the problems with this hotel, in a nutshell: 1) many websites lead you to believe that this hotel is close to Central Park and convenient. However, it is not. It is up by Columbia University, around 103rd Street. If you take a taxi from the hotel to mid-town (Times Square) it will easily cost you $15.; if you take the subway it will easily take you 45 minutes. 2) there's no elevator! From the minute you arrive at the hotel you must climb a large set of stairs just to reach the lobby and reception. Then, you must climb more sets of stairs to get to your room (in my case, 4 sets of stairs). again, there is NO elevator in the building. 3) this hotel is essentially an old, run-down apartment building that was given a coat of paint, and re-invented as a "boutique hotel". be advised: it's dark and gloomy and somewhat creepy. 4) there is no closet in the room. no hangers. no dresser. no drawers. so, that requires that you totally live out of your suitcase (which you have no choice but to leave on the floor, tucked under part of your bed, since the room is so small). 5) the bathroom was the smallest bathroom i've ever been in in my life. 6) there was one small window in my room which looked out onto a brick wall of another building. during the day the room is totally dark due to the closeness of this building - and yet there are only two lamps in the room with a single light bulb in each...so expect dark! 7) there is no internet available in the room. the website for the hotel states Internet Access. Internet Access is only available in the lobby and you must pay for it by the minute. There was always a wait to use one of the computers. 8) the Rates for this hotel are no bargain. you can easily stay in the center of midtown, in a nice hotel, for the same rate, or even less. My suggestion...do not stay here. The hotel's website totally misrepresents this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, great location”
Reviews.Author: ClaireEastLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights and it offered everything we needed. To be honest, there is so much to do and see in NYC that all we did in our room was sleep and shower. Room was small but it was very clean and comfortable. Had a shower with a small bath tub that you could fill up and sit in which worked perfectly well if a little unusual. We were on the ground floor close to reception and the bar but room was very quiet. Free wifi was a bonus. Hotel is right next to the 103 subway stop on the 1 line which is really convenient and there's a 24 hour supermarket a couple of doors away and loads of nice cafes for breakfast. Short stroll to Central Park. From everyone we've spoken to we can't imagine getting a better deal in New York. We would definitely go back and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinktraveler83
Reviews.Content: I recently went with 4 girls to NYC and stayed at this hotel. The hotel is beautiful. The room & bathroom are small but it gave us ladies just what we needed. The beds are comfortable, the room temperature is perfect and the room is VERY clean. One of the ladies was my mother and she is VERY picky about the hotels and their cleaness and she loved this hotel. The staff is terrific & very helpful. The location was perfect, it is right next to the subway so you could just hop on the subway and go every where. I will continue to go back to this hotel over and over again and can not wait for my next trip back to NY. I give this hotel a 10+

Reviews.Title: “totally awesome”
Reviews.Author: timastartrek
Reviews.Content: One of the best Hotel I've ever stayed in. Nice, clean, friendly, totally worth the money! Unfortunately, the a/c was much too loud, ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: CJMAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Our room had terrific air conditioning during a bad hot spell; much better than the chain hotel we stayed at in Midtown earlier in the week. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would've liked washcloths and hand towels in the room but got washcloths delivered immediately when we called the front desk. Nice restaurants in the area; would recommend the French cafe with Soleil in its name, just a block and half away, and Carmine's nearby. Back to the room: smallish but a fine size for three of us, we slept very well, and the shower was good. No complaints. Prepare to haul your bags around or have the doorman help you; no elevators. But I loved the atmosphere, the cool temp of the room, the lounge where we often sat for drinks, and the staff. The neighborhood was also lovely -- liked it much, much better than Midtown and its crowds. Would definitely stay at the Marrakech again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redtyke987
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right outside a subway station that travels right down Manhatten, its ideal for getting around. The area that its located felt safe and was okay for walking around with my two sons ages 13 and 5. Hotel is nice and well presented however there is no elevator so luggage has to be carried up all stairs, there are door men there to help though. Our room was a little small but adequate, the decor was modern and clean, beds were comfy and linen was very clean. The shower in the small bathroom was really warm and also very clean. The air conditioning unit in the room was very noisy so we didnt use it at night, but there was a ceiling fan, not really adequate on te warm nights. Front desk staff were very helpful and answered any questions and offered advice. Overall it was a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Zirgo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week with 3 other friends. After reading the reviews at Tripadvisor about small rooms, we requested a big one since we were so many, and so we were given without extra charge. Even though the hotel lies at the trafficked 6 files Broadway, our room faced an other street, which meant no noise at all. Air condition in room, which worked perfectly, except from one day after there had been a small electrical fire in their basement. We forgive them. New towels and bed lines given every day, and the rooms where clean and nice. Subway just across the street, which brings you to Time Square and the more central parts of Manhattan in about 15 minutes. Tip: buy a one week pass at the subway station, the subway is the best and cheapest way to get around! We were very happy about our stay, just sad we had to get a little disappointment in the end. Our flight didn't leave La Guardia before afternoon, so since the checkout was at 11 o'clock, we needed to store our luggage in the luggage room, which they charged us with $2 each bag. Not much money, but they could have saved them self from that fee if you ask me. But anyways, this hotel is a cheap and good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great places in the neighborhood, but stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: KatieTaps
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel stay ever. Trendy lobby/lounge area, but the rooms are awful, stuffy, stale, and not comfortable. Lighting is awful. Front desk staff NOT helpful when we asked questions, it felt like we were a burden and an intrusion on their time. Folks standing at the door with their fancy headsets often missed the fact that we were coming in/leaving the hotel & failed to open the door for us. Bugs, both living & dead in our shower & they failed to remedy the situation. No closets. Bathroom space is WAY TOO CRAMPED for the rates they are charging. GREAT places to eat in the neighborhood, and an awesome Lounge down the street @ 107th & Broadway with comedy. I would visit the neighborhood again for the diner & lounge, but would NEVER stay here or recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excelente!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marlin074
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 days in Marrakech Hotel and it was nice......the rooms are small but clean and the location is very convenient, there is a subway station very close......and there are a lot of restaurants around, the people who work there are very nice and helpfull..if you don't want to spend too much money on a hotel but want something confortable this hotel is a good choice..

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: SATanthony
Reviews.Content: Didn't what to expect when I booked my stay at the Hotel Marrakech - in fact I had heard some not too great things prior to my visit. However after my weekend visit I will stay there again. The hotel/rooms were clean, staff polite and helpful, location was great, plenty of places to eat, subway a block away. The rooms are small but again for manhattan on a summer weekend in june you cannot beat the $ 100 rate plus tax (I booked through priceline). I would recommend this hotel for singles or couples..the rooms are small and would not accomodate families in one room. There are no elevators so ask for a low floor, if you are not good with climbing stairs - I stayed on the 2nd floor so it was perfect. Also the Internet was FREE, once in a while got disconnected but you can't beat the "freeness". Again i would stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “An Experience”
Reviews.Author: IndianaUs3
Reviews.Content: This is an affordable place for a short stay in the city. We had one of the smaller rooms, so i can't say if the bigger rooms are any better. The room was literaly a bed & 2 nightstands & a small bathroom and yes a brickwall view outside the window.. Even still for what we needed this worked fine. It is located in a safe area near Columbia University. Easy walk to Central Park & great access to the subway. We were able to get around quite easily. The walls in our hall seemed to be super thin. The room still had a bit of ambiance. The staff was great & very helpful. The lobby is the best part from what we saw. Very nice experience for our first weekend together in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value-recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: wzvktp
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my teenaged daughter and I for several reasons. First the price was fantastic. Secondly I read in advance and was prepared to get some exercise on the stairs. I even asked for a room high up as I know they tend to have less noise. Our double bed room was actually surprisingly large (room 866- top floor). It was clean, the dÃ©cor was nice and the air conditioning unit appeared to be new and worked well. We did not hear one noise all night long. It is within walking distance of Columbia and Barnard and the subway right outside is very helpful. We also enjoyed the dÃ©cor of the lobby and the staff was friendly and professional. Tips: I do NOT recommend this hotel for OLDER persons or people with limited mobility. The stairs would be an issue and it is just too trendy and young feeling for some. Ask for a room on the top floor. Ask for a room far from reception/lobby area. Book double bed room. Please familiarize yourself with New York City hotels prior to writing negative reviews. If you are going to book a value hotel in New York the rooms are going to be small and you will be giving up some amenities. I get tired of hearing about how small the rooms and bathrooms are. Pay $400 and up a night if you want a big bathroom. But if you are truly interested in getting bang for your buck, this is a great place to stay. I will be coming back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect thank you very much!”
Reviews.Author: Laurryna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights- perfect! There was some noise from the street to the room at night but what do you expect in the centre of Manhattan. The hotel is right next to the subway station by which you can get to time square easily on the red line (head downtown to 42nd st then to get back head up town towards Van Courtland Park (Bronx) to 103rd street.) The rooms were fairly small but had everything you need for a city break, beds, TV, bathroom, wardrobe, desk and are very clean. The bathroom is small, but sufficient, with a wonderful power shower (but no bath). It is also cleaned every day with replacement towels provided if you need a bathrobe you will need to supply this yourself. Yes the hotel is upstairs with no elevator, but any time we needed assestance with bags and stuff all we had to do was ask. There is also a left luggage facility if you want to leave bags for the day after you check out- very useful to have an extra day in New York! The restaurant service is limited, however, there are pleanty of places (cafes restaurants, supermarket, take away) accross the street which are open 24 hours a day if you need food or drink at any time- there is also no problem with bringing a take away back to your room. The staff are also always happy to reccommend near by places for breakfast dinner etc. All in all would defo reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty cool place”
Reviews.Author: Astra_FFM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel a few weeks ago during our week long stay in NYC. We were looking for something affordable but clean and on a good location. The hotel is in the residential part of the upper west side and in close proximity to the Columbia Uni so the "young" vibe is all around:) What we found when we arrived is that the hotel is on a perfect location on the metro station of the "1" train at the crossing of the103rd and Broadway. The connections to the midtown and any other part of NYC are good as besides the train you have the 104 bus (stops) almost in front of the hotel) which takes you directly through midtown (long Broadway to Times Square than down 42nd str. across 7th through 1st Avenue) to the UN building. The hotel indeed doesn't have an elevator but the few flights of stairs you have to take are not to be intimidated by. The staff is competent and will help you with your luggage at any time. The hotel will hold your luggage in storage after check out while you do your last city buzz before heading off to the airport. The rooms are really tiny but the bed seamed new and it was impeccably clean. We had a flat screen TV a desk& chair & small wardrobe. The best place in the room was the window seat where (if you are an insomniac) early in the morning you can see the Broadway strip waking up. The bathroom was in proportion to the room so you can say it was also pretty tiny but we had no problem with the water (hot water was always available) even though the pluming was a bit loud. For all NCY visitors coming from more serene and quiet places I would recommend the soft ear plugs for a good night sleep because except maybe on the top floor of the Waldorf Astoria there isn't any quiet place in the whole city:) The hotel has no food service but I found out this was more of a blessing than a curse. Few steps to the north of the hotel there is a 24/7 convenient store and a couple of pizza joints and the Starbucks next to the Hotel is open from 5am to 2am (the next day :). There is a pretty descent Thai place also next to the hotel but what I found really good is the Broadway Bagel shop on 99th street (Come by in the morining for the real NY breakfast experience) where for $3 you can get a topped bagel and coffee. Also the Metro Diner on 100th str. is a place I would recommend. All in all, great location, good value for money and will gladly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: MLiStockholm
Reviews.Content: This is not the best hotel I have stayed at but - this is New York! And if you spend little (or no time) in your room... this is perfect. The rooms are tiny. We had a queen bed and a window with no view (well... a brick wall that u could touch...) the walls are thin but we got a room away from the reception. The Aircon sounded like a incomin train but you get what u pay for. The bathroom is a bliss. It feels and looks fresh. I would definately stay here again! The Subway is ridiculously close and neighborhood is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel, ok service. Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: oddman
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review based on three days in a single bedroom w/ Queen bed. My wife and I booked this over the internet, based on the reviews we read. We were extremely disappointed! We got there with two suitcases of luggage and had to haul it up a long flight of stairs to get to the lobby. This isn't fun by any means. The receptionist then told us we had to go another two floors to get to our room. And the best part - no elevator. So if you have luggage, this is going to be a pain in the.. well.. all over. The room itself was very dark (even with all the lights turned on) and was cramped. The bathroom is TINY! I will be including pictures with my review so you can see for yourself. The beds were hard - and I'm usually not picky about beds at all. But this was ridiculous. We would have slept on the floor but there wasn't enough space. The room was so cold, we had to ask for an extra heater. But when I plugged in the heater, the fuse blew, so all the lights went out! Later, when I asked for an iron and board, they sent me an ironing board with holes in it. The iron spewed dirty water on my trousers so I had to wear jeans instead. All this on the first day! Needless to say, we were extremely frustrated. As another reviewer mentioned, the wireless is terrible. I've got better wireless at home. It was slow and had weak signal quality everywhere. So if you want to check out the sights and sounds of NY, bring a brochure because you can't use the internet to look anything up. There are only two good things about this hotel - staff and location. The staff were friendly and quick to respond to our requests and issues. And believe me, we had a lot of issues with this hotel. The location is also great. Lots of places to see and good food all around. It's also right next to the subway, so makes commuting very simple. We paid around $150/night and would NEVER come here again. It's not woth $75/night let alone anything more. Please look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PRICE, AMAZING LOCATION, VERY CLEAN!!”
Reviews.Author: FruitLoopsMontreal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an AMAZING choice!! We found it by "accident" because we booked through hotwire and only got the name of the hotel after we booked! But im so glad!! GREAT LOCATION: The hotel is on the upper west side. It is literaly in front of the subway (1 train) which leads you to anywhere in manhattan. It is located next door to starbucks, and has everything you need within a block or 2. Pharmacies in front and across the street. Varied restaurants, diners, terraces, bars, and fast food joints (McDonals, Subway, KFC). The area is quiet and great to just hang out in, benches everywhere, CENTRAL PARK just a few blocks away! GREAT STAFF: The staff is young and very very friendly! Always willing to answer any questions/requests! GREAT VALUE & VERY CLEAN: The hotel is quite small, no frills, no elevators but is VERY CLEAN. you walk in through some stairs and the lobby is big with a bar nearby. The entire hotel is themed to the Morrocan style, from the furniture to the wall colors, to the music. All very relaxing and warm. The halls are dimed low in lighting, again with warm colors. The rooms are small, but more than enough space to suit your needs! We were 4 friends and 2 per room. The room has a very clean and new bathroom, there is a double bed and a flat screen TV in front of the bed. Big windows that bring in alot of light. Phone access and radio. Internet access in the hotel and catch signal on your laptop in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with great value!”
Reviews.Author: B&JManchester
Reviews.Content: I was reading the reviews because I am thinking about staying here again. I was pleasantly surprised by the Marrakech. I had a lovely corner room with nice tall windows. I agree with other readers that I slept better than I did at home. The staff is very attentive - I had a few reasons to call down for service. In addition to being prompt they also tried several ways to troubleshoot a problem with the message indicator in my hotel room. I have traveled the world on business and pleasure and have stayed in many different style lodgings from hostels to 5 star resorts. Yes, the Marrakech is in an older building and there is no lift but that did not detract from my stay. As a single woman I felt safe in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As long as you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: HudsonTodd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three times through April - once with a friend, so we had a two-bedded room on the fifth floor, then twice by myself and I had a one bedded room on the lower corrridor both of these times. The room on the top floor was quiet and relaxing. Both rooms near the reception and staff areas were extremely noise, with doors from the luggage room slamming non stop, staff talking all night around the reception area, and one night the radiator in my room scared the life out of me, making a noise as though someone was walking on the iron steps outside the room, towards my window. If you do not take a room on the corridor near reception, then your stay will be good. But sadly the incessant noise lost me hours of sleep during my stay on the "staff corridor", which is a shame because it really ruined my experience. I am a deep sleeper, so would not like to guess what it would be like for someone who wakes easily. Because the noise came from staff, I can't give them the excellent rating that they otherwise deserve, and this is the same for the value and rooms ratings, which were all otherwise very good. The fact that there is no lift is potentially an issue for some, but they have staff to take your cases up and it did not bother me - I would rather have the long walk and avoid the overnight noises! The location is excellent, with a number 1 subway right at the door, any amount of quality restaurants nearby, a post office and a laundromat around the corner, a short walk across to Central Park and through to the Museum Mile on the East Side. The cocktail bar is very good, with a nice atmosphere and the cocktail waitress knows her menu, and gives service over and above anything I would have expected. I found the hotel very clean and well serviced. If you want to stay here, just make sure you get a room as far away from the corridor closest to reception so that you can avoid the night duty staff and their slamming doors and socialising!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: Honest119
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so bad that thinking of it makes me ill. I stayed for 7 nights. Firstly there is no lift which is just ridiculous as the hotel itself is UPSTAIRS. So you have to drag your suit cases up the stairs to even get into the place, and then probarly another 5-6 flights beyond that to get to your room. D'ont be fooled by the pictures used to advertise this hotel on websites - notice the dim lighting??Theres a reason for that. The room was OK in terms of size but the first thing I noticed was filthy towels in the bathroom. The whole place was very grotty and the worst thing about staying there was that I did not feel safe. Anyone could have pushed that door in at any time. The stairs are also tiny and narrow - don't underestimate the importance of no lift, I did and it was a disaster. Completley not suitable for children. The staff at the front desk were also unwelcoming and ungrateful on our departure. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiggy69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 3 nights, New York being a 40th birthday treat, this hotel is only ten minutes subway ride from most of the attractions, and the subway station is literally next door. It was a relief after a hectic days shopping or sightseeing to be able to relax somewhere a little quieter, with a few bars and restaurants close by, and Starbucks downstairs. The room was on the small side but perfectly adequate, and spotlessly clean with a super comfy bed and plasma tv. The only downside to the room was that we didn't have a view, only of an adjacent wall, but as we didn't go to New York to spend all day in a hotel room this wasn't a problem. The staff were polite and helpful, and there was a relaxed bar/lounge area. All in all, an excellent choice for a short stay on a budget for anyone looking to explore this city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect perfect perfect !. Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: robertopuerta
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we were looking for. It was our first trip to New York on a low bugget and I spent over a week picking out the perfect hotel on the perfect location so we could have a good time. It was a short trip of three days and two nights in New York, so we wanted to enjoy it as much as we can and I have to say this hotels, the staff, the servies, the door men, the front desk and the concierge are just giving everything to the their guest and visitors. You guys ROCK . I have been working in the hotel industry all my life and I was so surprise to find a place like this. We had a GREAT TIME, the room was small but perfect, nice big windows, our room was just beside the staircase and I thought it will be noise at night, but it was pefect, I sleap better than in my house. We are coming back to New York in summer and we will stay there again for sure. The subway is just at the doors steps, it is easy to find nice littler restaurants all around, one block, two blocks and three blocks away from the hotel, all very nice, sabrosos and unspensive, again for our surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Best value your money can get in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: kwright09
Reviews.Content: 3 of my friends and myself were in New York City for our college spring break. At first we thought we'd stay in a hostel, but then I found the Marrakech! Because of being off-season, we got 20% off 4 nights or more so we couldn't turn down those prices, especially being college students! Arriving in NYC, we quickly found the Marrakech, located across the street from the Number 1 subway line, which was so convenient! Checking in was a breeze and the staff was so friendly! (The stairs were a tad bit much, especially carrying a 2 huge suitcases and a backpack, but the staff offered to help!) The room was a tad small, but there were 2 double beds, a desk, a flat panel TV, and then the bathroom. For the 4 of us, it was just fine! The beds were sooooo comfortable, more than my own bed! The room was spotless, as was the bathroom. And, for the first time ever staying in a hotel, we had 4 towels without asking! Anytime we needed anything during our stay, the friendly front desk staff accommodated very quickly. Whether it was the iron and ironing board, a bucket of ice, or that extra trashcan, they were right there within 5 minutes. The Marrakech was an awesome place to stay and I think made our trip to NYC even better! I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a nice comfortable place with a great atmosphere without the huge price. The surrounding neighborhood has some awesome little bakeries and shops, and only a few blocks to Central Park. Great location, great atmosphere, great staff, great hotel! Thanks a lot for a memorable spring break!

Reviews.Title: “Pure dung heap”
Reviews.Author: DTyroneIreland
Reviews.Content: 14/03/09 I booked my mother and myself a 5 night stay in what I presumed from the brochure "a nice hotel" I have never been to New York before and I asked the travel agent to locate me a good hotel close to central park, times square and all local sights, I informed them of my mothers ill-health, and I asked if their was lifts in the hotel and I was told there was- and this is what they gave me? Yes its close to Central Park but its too far for my sick mother to walk anywhere!!! Its a dangerous area and the hotel doesnt even have security on reception at night. After arriving from Ireland we were both looking forward to a great trip but being held in immigration for over 5 hrs and not receiving any food plus we had both our visas approved through the esta site.!!! ( my mother is a DIABETIC) and now we are both knackered and just want rest but nooo. We eventually get to the hotel and get checked in, head for something to eat and then bed. But we had partying in the rooms beside us and they continued playing loud music and fighting into the wee small hours, I finally began to get some sleep at 06.10 am this morning...... this place is just a joke. My 61 year old mother hates this place and we've just arrived. STAY WELL AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL AND THIS AREA. This supposed hotel is just like a hostel, we haven't been informed of any amenities this hotel may have, but we aint going to be at the hotel much throughout the day - its only a bed for the night. D, Tyrone, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay , excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: looby674
Reviews.Content: this is the second year running i have stayed at the Marrakech and i cannot praise it enough , as a single parent i have to look for the value in any holiday and the prices are always fantastic with offers on longer stays i am adding a night a year ...in fact im going back in october , the staff are friendly and helpful the housekeeping is fantastic and every time i stepped back in my room after a long day shopping i knew everything would be spotless again .The location is amazing with a subway right outside on the 1 line so you can travel the length of manhattan and know you can get off at the hotel so there is no long slug with the shopping and the doormen are always keeping an eye out for you to help if you need it . There is a metro diner just on the next block where the service is always friendly and welcoming and i always enjoy my pancakes in the morning smothered in syrup and butter .If you want a night in to relax you can get food delivered to your room from any of the wonderful restaurants /take aways around and order a film on the television in your room of which a lot are new films in the cinema , this was very handy when my 7 year old just couldnt take another night out and we ate the worlds biggest pizza pie laying on our beds . I took 2 teenagers with me and they soon got the hang of the subway enough that they felt comfy enough to get in some sight seeing alone, on their return the hotel arranged their food delivery and they enjoyed every second of their stay as well , for a quiet moment the bar lounge area is perfect with low lighting and comfy seating i noticed it was used all day by a variety of people and looks out onto broadway which is a fantastic new york sight at night with the lights in the trees and the yellow cabs zipping by , i love this hotel it has only enhanced my New York stay and plan to stay there many more times

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a couple nights in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: mcal22
Reviews.Content: When I booked the reservation I was expecting a typical small crappy hotel room, with cockroaches. But when I got there I was very satisfied and pleased not only with the hotel but the staff and the service. The staff was very helpful with any questions I had, and pointed me in the right direction with sites to see. They also upgraded my room when my TV went out, and I didnt even ask for anything. They were very generous. The rooms were very Ny style, but very clean and nice. The other thing about the hotel was that it seemed very exotic, and I felt I was at a day spa. It was very relaxing. Also it is in a nicer part of the neighborhood, being in the midtown of ny. And if I go to NY again I would deffinately stay there again. Thank You Marrakech Hotel for a great weekend

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jaredross
Reviews.Content: I was quite nervous about booking this hotel as some of the reviews on this site were greatly against it. That being said, I booked three rooms between January 23-25 and overall we enjoyed a really nice stay. The staff, upon check-in and check-out as well as throughout the duration of the stay, was helpful and courteous. The three rooms did not look exactly like the pictures but all were comfortable and clean. The stairs throughout the hotel (especially those on the way up to the lobby) are definitely treacherous but worth it. We got a great deal on the website with some winter specials. The location is about 12 short blocks from the Columbia University campus and just outside is a Starbucks and subway station -- definitely convenient. Some minor complaints: the room was heated beyond belief and the window would not open, so we were forced to run the A/C; the wi-fi only works in the lobby, and although somewhat comfortable, was not as private as the room.

Reviews.Title: “If you liked living in the dorms...”
Reviews.Author: GingerTabby
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I stayed at the Marrakech a year ago for a short weekend vacation in the city. Our experience wasn't spectacular, but the price was right, so we booked again for a similar trip this year. It honestly reminded me of living in the dorms what with the constant racket in the hallways and cramped quarters. Every time someone walked past our room the floor shook. We could hear the music in the hotel lobby playing until at least midnight every night. After the first night I bought a pair of earplugs, which helped with the noise a bit. I expected city noise from the streets, not from inside the building. The doorman was mysteriously absent every time we had bags to carry up or down the stairs and the temperature in the shower never stayed constant for more than 2 minutes at a time. The good: the subway stop just feet from the door is always a help, the lobby and corridors are nicely decorated, the rooms were clean, and it's cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain on a budget”
Reviews.Author: mrsmemb
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the Marrakech Hotel. We had seen other reviewers' pictures of the hotel and I was prepared for the small accommodation's. We knew we hadn't booked a 5 star luxury hotel - we just needed a clean and safe place to sleep, shower, and dress. This hotel met our requirements. I also found the hotel staff to be helpful when asked. They helped carry bags and usually had a doorman at the main entrance. We also hung out in the Kazbar Lounge in their lobby on one of our evenings after a show. It was very convenient to the subway as the 1 line is just a few steps away. There is also a Starbucks right below where we mainly ate breakfast. I only wish we had ventured out to more of the restaurants near the hotel. If you're very needy and high maintenance, and prefer elevators over exercise, then this hotel might not be for you. Four of us stayed in one room and we were comfortable, happy and glad to save our money for other adventures around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: wanneroo
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms look absolutely nothing like they do on the Marrakech website. Rooms are tiny with cheap or non working amenities.
