We stayed there just before Christmas for a week, the heating could not get regulated; to cool the room down you are forced to use the Aircon (which didn't work in our room). There is no coffeemker, no Massage shower head, no Individual climate control...the WI FI was not working properly in the hotel room. No use of the Flat-screen TV, if there is not one free to air channel! The reception staff weren't very helpful. After all, for the price we have paid we could have stayed in a more central location, in a room which at least would allow you to turn around in!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bree2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights at the end of November. Booked it for price ($1,800 inc taxes for 3 sharing a triple room) and because of the reviews on Tripadvisor. Hotel itself is fine-nice decor etc. Beds were made daily and bins emptied but at the end of our stay the locker was quiet dusty-not really acceptable. Stairs are annoying but as already mentioned in other reviews the doormen help with bags etc... Reception staff weren't overly friendly- however check-in went without any problems and I had requested a low floor and which we got. Location is ok-subway literally outside the door and only a few stops from Times Sq. Some nice little restaurants around hotel as well as Starbucks beside it so very handy for morning coffee. Our main reason for travelling to NY was to shop(and shop we did!) and we mainly used taxis instead of the subway due to the amount of bags we were carrying(don't think the locals would have appreciated us bashing our way through the stations!) At the end of our trip we had spent quiet a lot on taxis due to the Marrakech's location near 103rd St. which we probaly could have avoided with a more central hotel. So to summarise I think this hotel is a nice choice for people looking to for a good budget option. However the next time I travel to NY I will probably go for a more central hotel-I think its worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked, downgraded, terrible service, incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: ongtay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few days while attending a conference. Although the location of the hotel is nice and the price may seem attractive, everything else was terrible and it was honestly the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Most of the hotels I've been to in developing countries have had better service than this one. 1. Since the hotel was overbooked, we were downgraded to a smaller room with a smaller bed, and never received any kind of rebate or reimbursement, even after asking the manager (who was also very impolite and rude). 2. Hotel rooms look nothing like they do on the Marrakech website. Rooms are small (not in a cozy way) with cheap amenities. We were there during the March and the room was very cold and musty. Make sure you bring warm clothes if you actually do go to this hotel in the winter. 3. Internet connection (wired) in our room did not work. 4. Hotel staff did not know the password to the wireless internet router. 5. Hotel staff did not know how to restart the super-slow computers in the lobby that actually had an internet connection (I had to do it for them). (in short, if you need an internet connection, this might not be the hotel to stay at). 6. No working elevator. Just to get in the hotel you must walk up a flight of stairs. 7. Construction was occurring on our floor starting at 8am in the morning, meaning we could not sleep in at all.

Reviews.Title: “it's okay”
Reviews.Author: lexsie
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel as part of a tour and was a little concerned after having read some of the reviews. I was however pleasantly surprised the hotel room while a little small was clean warm and comfortable It was quite dark in the hallways and rooms there needs to be better lighting but I canâ€™t complain about the room. The staff and the bar was very nice and well appreciated after long days of looking around New York. On my last night though I had major problem I had booked a wake up call first thing in the morning and double checked it again when I arrived back at the hotel which the staff had confirmed. However I never received it and ended up missing my train to Niagara falls and losing out on my pre-paid accommodation. (all up this missed wake up call costed me about $600aus). I received no apology and no real reason as to why the wake up call had been missed. Considering I had received all of my other wake up calls on time I was thoroughly frustrated as to why I never got this one. The hotel would have been great except for that major mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Not too good”
Reviews.Author: lilkelzboo
Reviews.Content: I was terrified to stay at this hotel because of the previous reviews about bed bugs. As part of an organised tour I was doing, I didn't have much of a choice. However, there were no bed bugs. I did get a bite on my stomach which stayed there for a few days, but since it was just the one I would probably put that down to something else. Our tour manager explained to us that the style of the hotel meant there were no elevators. I'm a reasonable person so I accepted his explanation but still found the no-elevator thing a real pain. Picture this: It's about 6.30am and it's raining and I'm five foot, weigh 45kilos, and i've got two large suitcases. Nobody was at the door so I attempted to start hauling my bags up the narrow stairs myself. Luckily, an older gentleman- a hotel guest, took pity on me and lugged them up for me. Here's the thing- if you're not going to have elevators at least have plenty of bellhops around. At one point there were about three or four of us all needing our bags to be bought up to our rooms. We all had to patiently wait as the one bellhop catered to each of us, one at a time. Also, I know America is all about the tipping but to have to pay to get my bags bought up- when I could have done it myself if there was an elevator, is kind of annoying. The rooms are fairly nice- I shared a twin. The bathroom was teeny tiny and the walls are paper thin, I could hear it when the people next to us took a shower. The beds were quite comfy and the pillows and sheets were soft. The maids came once a day. The lounge/lobby of the hotel is quite cosy as well, it has a little bar and some comfortable seating arrangements. There are also two computers with internet access, however you have to pay for them. I think it was about .20c a minute and you can pay with cash or credit card. It was the first hotel I had stayed in on my trip that didn't provide free access. The lobby also has a payphone and an ATM, however I found this particular ATM wouldn't let me withdraw more then $100- and this was not a problem with my credit card, as I was able to do it elsewhere. Odd. The cincher for my experience was a few weeks after I got back home and I emailed a friend of mine to jokingly remind her of some money of mine that she had been keeping for me, which we'd both forgotten about, so I never had it returned. I was gobsmacked though when she told me that she had actually given the money to the front desk, to ask them to pass it along to me when I checked out- which I obviously never recieved. It was only $20 but for a poor, travelling student it's a fairly significant amount. Thought it demonstrated poor service that it was never given back to me. All in all, the experience was okay - I was just relieved to not get the bed bugs. The neighbourhood is okay- it has some laundromats, some eateries and it's right next to the subway. Personally, I found it a bit far away from where I wanted to be - near the centre of town. But for anybody wishing to be a non-tourist, it's an okay neighbourhood. However, with the amount the Marrakech charge, I think you could find a much nicer place, for the same amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: willandjess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marrakech for eight nights in the last week of September 2008. This was our first trip to New York and a belated honeymoon, so we had been looking forward to it for years. I had done so much preparation forthis trip and was very aware that accom in NY was very expensive. I foolishly, was going to wait til just before we left in the hope of getting last minute rates and a cheaper deal at a higher rated hotel. HUGE mistake i thought, which is why we ended up at Marrakech. It's all we could afford! HOWEVER we were pleasantly suprised. Staff were not over the top friendly, just professional, which is what i like, and offered assistance if we required it, bbut certainly didn't try to upsell us on anything ( tickets/tours etc) We stayed on the 5th floor, which meant we had to walk up there with our bags, which was harder on the way down with all my extra shopping! But we didn't mind walking up thise stairs each night, it only got difficult after a few drinks! Our room was SO much bigger than i thought it would be, and i was thrilled that we got a corner room onthe top floor, the view was great! The bathroom was small, but we didn't go to New York to have a roomy bathroom. Bed was comfortable and clean, even though i don't think the sheets ever got changed. Sometimes there were long hairs in the bed ( not ours), but asides from that, we had no dramas. I would absolutey stay here again, it's a great base to see NY. Right on the 1 train, but alot of the time we walked everywhere. Night was relatively quiet compared to the rest of the city, it was absolutely dead quiet between 4am and 5am weeknights, the rest of the time it was just general traffic noises. There are great food /bars nearby. i recommend 2 doors down, Sook for Thai food and one block down Mama Mexico for mexican.

Reviews.Title: “Marrakech a really good choice”
Reviews.Author: superkbf
Reviews.Content: We had originally planned on staying 4 nights in NYC, but when we saw how expensive the hotels were, it dwindled down to two, and even then we were forced to book one of the cheaper, and presumably less nice, options. After booking the Marrakech, I was quite nervous and had often thought about cancelling, mostly because of some bad reviews I had read. But the price was much better than other hotels, and the location seemed interesting. I had prepared for the worst, but the Marrakech was really very nice. Here's what's true: you do have to climb stairs, they are steep and a bit narrow, and it is fairly dark on the inside. On the other hand, the rooms are big (we were 2 adults with 3 kids under 7 and had plenty of room) and clean, the beds are comfy, and the staff are super friendly and helpful. The lounge area is nice and there's a cool 'hang out here for a while' vibe there. FANTASTIC diner three blocks away on Bway and 100 for breakfast, subway just out the door, CP a few blocks to the east and R'sideP a few blocks to the west. Lots of grocery stores, eateries, etc nearby. DO NOT be afraid to book this hotel, especially if the hotel is for sleeping most of all, not for hanging out at. I was really very pleasantly surprised, thus this review!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: itfcandy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marrakech Hotel after a tour operator messed up our original booking elsewhere. We chose it for its cheapness and the attractive website/pictures. Good Points; 1. Just cross the street and there is a subway station entrance on one of the main routes through Manhattan. The route takes you through Columbus Circle, Times Square, Madison Square Garden and all the way to Battery Park. Very convenient. 2. Friendly staff. The doormen are always polite, as are the receptionists and chambermaids. They are also willing to have a conversation, making it nice and informal. 3. Comfortable bed. A little on the hard side, but at least you wont be getting back ache! 4. Ten minutes walk from Central Park, and some good food shops nearby. Not so good points; 1. Heating. When we went, the heating was either full on or not at all, and there was no radiator to control it. Instead, we had three heating pipes with pressure outlets on, which make a racket throughout the night. Luckily Im a heavy sleeper. 2. The stairs. The reception is on the first floor, and the rooms go up to the fifth, without a lift. The doormen will help you with your bags, but its not what you need after a long day. 3. Small rooms. Decent storage, and a reasonable bathroom but still cramped for two people. 4. TV. They dont have signal boosters so you get a very grainy picture on every channel. Shame as they use Samsung HDTV's. 5. Location. Has its bad points as well. During the day its nice, but you wouldnt want to get the subway back late at night or walk through the neighbourhood. Very little police as its not a tourist area. Get a taxi back during hours of darkness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: Fudge03
Reviews.Content: A really comfortable, welcoming and stylish hotel, with a subway stop outsiide the door allowing for easy access to the rest of the city. Spotlessly clean, quiet despite us having a corner room overlooking Broadway and 103rd Street, and with all the pleasures of the shops and local life of the Upper West Side on the doorstep. As noted by other contributors, it is a walk-up, so not for the infirm, but worth a couple of flights of stairs for such a pleasant location.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not awfull”
Reviews.Author: KarolineB
Reviews.Content: We foud the hotel on expedia.no and found the rates to be extremely good; much better than other hotels in that area of Manhattan, so we went for it. We were going to NTC for a 8 day vacation with my mom, my bestfriend and myself, ready to experience the best of NY. The hotel was perfect; the location is perfect if you want to live central (the subway is right next to the hotel!!) and the customer service was,well, fine. It's not the best choice of hotel if you want to live posh and fancy, but its fine if you have other things to spend money on and if you're not going to spend a lot of time in the hotel room. The rooms ARE small, and yes; it is a little noisy, but we were lucky to be placed in the end of the corridor, so we didnt really have a lot of problems with that. The only thing that i wasnt too happy about was the fact that there is no elevator; a lot of stairs.. On the contraty; the hotel concierges were happy to carry all our luggage up the stairs and all the way to our room. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are extremely small, and the toilettries are not the best quality, but again; just fine. We were 3 people sharing to kingsize beds and that was okay, but if we were 4 people it would be extremely crouded regarding luggage, floor space, bathroom and closet space(which is completely absent from all of the rooms; no closet space). The rooms were tidy and very clean at all times, no worries there. The neighbourhood was great; safe and clean. But again; no matter where you are in NY you can go 3 blocks and you find yourself being in a bad neighbourhood -but thanks to the thousands of yellow cabs swirrling around the city of Manhattan you can get yourself anywhere by hawling a cab at anytime of the day;) All in all; not the most fancy hotel, but a fine hotel with nice people and a cool theme throughout the hotel. Location; perfect. Rates;fantastic. The hotel meets all expectations and you are guaranteed to have a plesant stay at Hotel Marrakech! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: nicolepascale
Reviews.Content: We had just stayed in this hotel from the 10th to the 13th after being upgraded from the Royal Park Hotel unexpectedly. What a deal! Anyway, we had a roomy 5th floor room with a bathroom bigger than our apartment's in Florida with a huge frosted window and more than enough room to put our toiletries in the windowsill. Our beds were a little firm but comfortable. Definitely no bed begs, that is always the first thing I check for. The AC window unit worked great, and we had a flat screen TV. The front desk was helpful and sent us up ice whenever we asked for it, which was great after a long day of walking. There are some great places for breakfast just a block or two downtown- I suggest the Metro DIner and Broadway Bagel- both excellent. Our doormen carried our luggage up and down the stairs, and were always friendly. So were the housekeepers. All in all, a great stay. I just wish we didn't have to walk up five flights of stairs, but as long as you're not morbidly obese, it's a non-issue. =)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesleyJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on 103rd street, which is far enough away from the hustle and bustle, but not too far away that you can't get to places easily by the subway or walking. The subway station is outside the hotel almost and there are shops and restaurants around, and a Starbucks next door. The hotel itself is rather dark, as they are trying to create an 'atmosphere' but this does bring to mind health and safety issues, as the stairwells are not well lit, and when you come inside from the bright sun, it's hard to see the stairs until your eyes have adjusted. That said, the hotel is nice, and I really liked my room. Loved the simple, clean feel, created by the decor and bed linen. My room was always clean and the bed was super comfy. Housekeeping staff were always cheerful and friendly too. The only real negative is the lack of elevator. Staff are on hand to carry your bags/case, which is appreciated, but the hotel wouldn't be suitable for anyone with mobility problems. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “rats”
Reviews.Author: jlmPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible! They are invested with rats on the roof, in their alley way and I saw one inside the hotel too. The neighborhood is nice but this hotel doesn't care at all about the serious rat problem they have. I made a complaint and they ignored my request to talk to manager when I asked why do they leave there garbage kaying ont he ground without being in containers they just shrugged their shoulders. In this day and age and city this is disguisting and lazy. They have no respect for their guest or neighborhood. RATS EVERYWHERE GROSS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the horror stories!”
Reviews.Author: drunkenmaster42
Reviews.Content: Letâ€™s face it â€“ affordable hotels on Manhattan are rarer than henâ€™s teeth, and I should know because I scoured the island prior to this trip looking for somewhere to stay that wouldnâ€™t give me an overdraft. I opted for the Marrakech and immediately wished I hadnâ€™t when I read the reviews and saw the pictures. However, it seems that the hotel has got its act together quite a lot since a lot of these photographs were taken, and you wouldnâ€™t recognise the place from some of those sordid snaps. Oh, and there were no bedbugs. I didnâ€™t find the now-infamous stairs much of a problem except late at night after a day exploring the city on foot. It seems my room was in the furthest corner of the entire hotel, so as long as youâ€™re in reasonable shape you shouldnâ€™t have a problem. The location is obviously not central, but the neighbourhood is surprisingly pleasant and there are lots of places nearby to get something to eat (tip: avoid the local McDonalds â€“ itâ€™s a nightmare). The subway station is just down the street, and this is a big plus. You will probably go mad from the boredom of communing downtown on the 1 train every day (or twice a day or more in my case) but itâ€™s a small price to pay. That said, the Marrakech is still very much a work in progress. The bathrooms are indeed very small. VERY small. When I sat on the toilet, my knees were touching the far side wall. Furthermore, there was no cabinet â€“ only a small shelf for toiletries about the WC. This meant that if you knocked something off the shelf it would invariably fall straight down the toilet. This happened an alarming amount of times before I hit upon the idea of keeping the lid down on the WC. The air conditioning units are loud, but no louder than any other hotel Iâ€™ve stayed in. I feel for the price youâ€™re paying, staying in the most vibrant and exciting city in the world and moaning about the size of the bathroom or the air-conditioning unit shows a little lack of perspective. Who goes to New York to spend enough time in their room to be bothered about trivialities like that? I was disappointed in a couple of trivialities myself, though. I would dearly have liked a refrigerator in my room (it was supernaturally hot for a Brit when I went) and a wardrobe (or closet) with a safe in. I was very surprised to be charged $2 on departure for them to hold my luggage for a couple of hours until my flight. Nowhere Iâ€™ve stayed before, anywhere in the world, has ever done this. The staff were mostly decent, although one young lady was very dismissive and brusque. I had the need to speak at length to one member of staff for advice who was completely rendered insensible by my English accent and was unable to function for about half a minute but was most helpful once I was able to make myself understood. I feel the Marrakech is heading in the right direction. I like the fact that the management seem to read these reviews and take note of the comments. Itâ€™s obviously not the Waldorf-Astoria, and if I could afford to, I would stay elsewhere. But for someone on a modest income who would rather save money to spend in the city itself, you should be more than OK here. So ignore the horror stories!

Reviews.Title: “More than Adequate”
Reviews.Author: HappyIsles
Reviews.Content: The Marrakech hotel is a good hotel for exploring the sights of NYC. It is located on Broadway and 103rd Sts. Location is pretty good with about a 10-15 min subway ride to 42nd St (Times Square). It is 5 minutes walk from Central Park and on the Red Subway line (No.1,2,3). Plenty of restuarants, groceries and quick food about (try Mama's Mexican). The room (466 -Queens size) was adequate in size with good decor (nice colours etc). The bed was comfortable and had NO bed bugs as previous reviews suggested. Room included flatscreen t.v. Only issues was with the shower which had good water pressure but a tendancy to go between cold and boiling hot in seconds. But it was manageable. The bar/meeting area was nice. Make sure you tip the bar person! Overall, the place was very clean and tidy and I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: princessvixen
Reviews.Content: I reluctantly decieded to stay here in late June as I had a tour leaving from the hotel the next day.Firstly let me say the location is terrible.The hotel is up on 103rd st which is a LONG way from any sightseeing/major tourist spots.I arrived early in the morning so the doorman took my luggage and carried it up the large flight of stairs to reception.At first the front desk staff couldnâ€™t find my booking but did so after a few minutes.The front staff were anything but courteous and did not seem interested in serving me.I returned mid afternoon to check in and had a room 8 floors up.The reception area and hallways are dark and dingy so I wasnâ€™t thrilled about how the room would look but it was ok.The room had 2 queen size beds(one had a a/c right behind it-very odd) and a very small bathroom.The room was quite small but we had enough room for 2 people.It was clean and I had no problem with bedbugs or noise.Overall I would say pay the extra money and stay elsewhere.This hotel is ok for one night but you can get holiday inn midtown for a good rate in a much better location!

Reviews.Title: “Would consider staying again”
Reviews.Author: 4everfamily
Reviews.Content: No Bedbugs. A very clean room. It was a small hotel room for four people and the bathroom was tiny. I don't know how normal that is for NYC but I think it is probably not unusual. WE had a good overall experience. WE had NO ISSUE with bugs and we checked first thing! We never even saw a fly. We were there for 5 days and never heard any other guests, TV, or slamming doors. I know there were others there because we saw plenty of people when it rained. It is a convienent location to the subway and there are plent y of good places to eat within walking distance to the hotel. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: jrstravels
Reviews.Content: It is not easy to find a hotel room for under $275 in NYC, much less one with two beds. The Marrakech was both. Our room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom is small, but everything is small in NY. There is a subway station across the street and it is in a decent strip of shops/restaurants. The hotel is a walk-up so if you have lots of bags it might not suit you. There is no mini bar or ice on the floor, but we asked for some ice and it was brought up within 10 minutes. I often stay in more posh hotels (W, Sofitel, The Shoreham) - this is not that, but it is clean and fairly priced in a comfortable neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Marrakesh was a GREAT find!”
Reviews.Author: hol221
Reviews.Content: We thought the Marrakesh was a great hotel. It is small, there are no elevators, and the hallway was dark but for a smaller, lower priced hotel it was decorated very nice, was very clean, and the staff were very helpful. If you're looking for a luxury hotel this is not in that category. But if you are looking for a good clean place to sleep at night after hanging out in the city this is perfect. We stayed on a Tuesday night and it was not noisy. The air condtioning was frigid which was great! The best thing about the hotel was the location. Right next to a Starbucks and the 113th street train station. The neighborhood was fine and we felt very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed.”
Reviews.Author: Tony29ToaAlta
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have stayed. No elevator. No chairs, closet, table. Room was so small that you cant even turn around. The bathroom was small. Hallway and floor noise all day and night. I requested another room and the staff never came back with an answer. I wasted my savings in that little rat-hole

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not recommended”
Reviews.Author: BermudaDoc
Reviews.Content: No elevators in the hotel. Our room was on the 3rd floor and we had some difficulty wrestling all our luggage up and down the narrow staircases and corridors. Very poor lighting in the room and tired, worn decor throughout the hotel. Not very clean, tiny shower room with cracked tiles and stained grouting. Air conditioning unit ancient and really noisy - impossible to have on and get some sleep. There are much better value hotels around in nicer areas of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jabs2k
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very pleased with our hotel experience. This hotel is about 10-15 mins to Times Sq. but as you have the 103rd Street Subway just outside you are very well placed. Many eateries and ameneties very close by to suit many tastes. All staff friendly and helpful, room was comfortable and adequate, albiet small it was fine. Only small gripe is if you're staying at the front overlooking Broadway your sleep will be disturbed due to noise, however, we purchased some ear plugs from the Rite Aid store in the next block to sort this problem out. Bed sheets/towels replaced and room was kept clean daily. After a hot and tiring day we'd often return to our room with the air con already on - definitely a plus as it can get quite hot during this time of year. Our room was #202 on the same floor as the lobby and looked like it had new carpets and new paint on walls. It rained on a couple of occations but it never really lasted more than 10 mins, anyway, pleanty of shelter in the shops to escape. If not there's a 99c store a couple of doors away to buy your brolly ($2) and water. Overall we'd stay here again for the price we payed.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: dcunited074
Reviews.Content: This hotel located on the Upper West Side was budget-friendly and very close to Central Park. It was a very hot weekend, but the room had A/c and a fan. The bar was pleasant and the staff was accommodating overall. While the rooms are small, they are good enough for a quick stay. Noise level from people walking up the stairs was a bit annoying. I would stay here again if I have plans on UWS. It is not near Times Square, Rockefeller, MOMA, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Small Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: My_Own_Opinion_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and was satisfied. Its a small hotel away from all the hustle of downtown. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. We had a couple of problems (which we caused) and they responded very quickly to fix them. The rooms are small and bathrooms are even smaller, but we didn't go to New York to sit in a room. There was 3 of us and we didn't feel cramped. Our room did not have a closet but had a unique shelf that was used for a closet. If you want luxury and something close to times square this is not the hotel for you. If you want a friendly staff, quiet area, a place to rest your head and don't mind taking the subway which is right out the door then the Marrakech Hotel is the hotel for you. There are also several restaurants nearby. Starbucks is next door and they have a small lounge in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: bms13
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel we didn't realise it was quite so far along Broadway as it was, and although we liked the hotel, if we were to visit again would probably pay more to stay somewhere more central to the main touist areas. However there were two subway stations in close proximity to the hotel, so location is no problem if you're happy to take the subway. Hotel seemed a little dark and dingey on first impressions as you come in, but was actually much nicer once you got further in and the moroccan theme was cool. Our room seemed a little small, however it was clean and more than adequate for what we needed. Staff were really friendly and helpful, and it was definitely worth the room rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Quirky”
Reviews.Author: Professor_on_Guam
Reviews.Content: To put this review in context, my wife and I generally prefer to stay in small, "boutique" hotels and B&B's. You learn to expect some unique features in such accommodations...sometimes its part of the charm. In the case of the Marrakesh, however, the quirkiness was overwhelming. On our first night, for a cost of over $280, we were required to walk up five flights of narrow stairs, clutching our luggage, to reach a room (#86) without air conditioning and in fact without a closet, a bureau, or any other place to store or hang clothes. There was a ceiling fan and we were fortunate that was enough to be comfortable. When we complained the next morning to the staff, we were placed in a room on the same floor as the lobby bar. It had air conditioning, a bedside table with sufficient drawer space for underwear, and a collapsible wardrobe in which to hang clothes. However, the only sink and mirror was in a lightless corner of the bedroom, which transformed shaving and my wife's application of make-up into an adventure, and we still had to wrestle up and down a narrow staircase with the bags. On the positive side, the location on the rapidly redeveloping upper West Side is incredibly convenient --especially to Columbia University and Lincoln Center--and the front desk personnel are friendly and competent. They are overworked because they double as concierge and registration staff. The lobby bar is attractive, although it would be nice to find coffee somewhere--in the room or in the lobby--before venturing out in the morning. But the renovation of the rooms seems to have been performed without much thought. It was more a case of, "Let's stick some Ikea-type pieces in this room, and different furniture in that room," without focusing on what travellers actually need in even minimal accommodations. It was a good idea to convert what may have been either a delapidated apartment house or rooms for rent by the hour into a boutique hotel for the upper West Side. Unfortunately, the result is too quirky, too charmless and too costly for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Melinda, Sydney, Aust. 'Couldnt ask for better value for money!'”
Reviews.Author: MelindaSydney
Reviews.Content: Im so happy i stayed here - I work in hospitality in Sydney and I wish I could bring my staff to be trained by these people - the friendliest, most helpful crew ever, that made the unbelievable experience of NYC even better - Very clean rooms, whatever you need straight away - right on a subway (103rd St) - and I got to spend more money on sight seeing - but I feel like I got a 5 star service! My partner and I got great travel tips and I feel so lucky I came accross this little gem of a place - would 100% advise you to stay here, I loved it!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Much better then expected”
Reviews.Author: skonnesso
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot of bad reviews before getting there and I have to say I was quite worried. After being there I can confirm that the place has been totally renewed, the rooms are very clean and the position is perfect. A good plus is the subway stop and a starbucks coffee just outside, not to mention internet in the lobby. It is true there's no elevator and the stairs are pretty narrow (I had my room on the 3rd floor) but I never had to carry my baggages up and down as the staff will take care of that! The rooms are pretty small (sometimes with no closet) but most importantly are clean and the bed is really comfortable. You can get a much better place in any other country or city for that price, but believe me if I say that in Manhattan it's the best deal you can get! So I definitely reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “BEDGUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yannnn34
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights in the hotel Marrakesh for my wedding travel, the staff was nice but rooms were not very clean . after 3 nights my legs and my arms were covered of red bits and i thought it was a food intoxication, but later i learn it was bedbugs bites. When i came back in france, i had to go to the doctor and I can't work during 3 days. I a m very disappointed by this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: WendyTinka
Reviews.Content: I really loved the place. The rooms are small, but really clean. The shower en toilet are very clean. Our bed, shower en toilet were cleaned every day and we got fresh towels everyday. You have to climb some steps and there is no elevator, but besides that it is a very good hotel. Next to the entree there is a Starbucks en in a view blocks there a lots of nice restaurants, like Mamma Mexico (just on the corner) en Metro Diner. The subway is in front of the door. The people at the reception deks are very friendly and they booked a good Harlem Gospel tour for us. They also booked the taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTales
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were visiting friends in NYC and booked this room for $99/night through priceline. For that rate in Manhattan, I can't complain too much. It was a great location, just across the street from the subway. The room and bathroom was small, but seemed clean. It was frustrating to not know ahead of time that the hotel does not have an elevator, but the staff was nice and bellhops were available to carry our bags up and down the stairs to our room. In the end it worked out well as a less expensive option for 2 young women who have known each other long enough to share a big bed and small room. This isn't for you if you plan to spend a lot of time in the room, need your space, need luxuries, or are looking for a good view of the city from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Marrakech”
Reviews.Author: aubble
Reviews.Content: i stayed in Marrakech Hotel April 21 th 2008 to April 24 th 2008 with my son while i was in New York, its a great place to stay, the people who work there are very friendly and helpfull, It is at an ideal location,Its near 103 st on the Red line Subway so very close to public transport, its very clean hotel .Our room was very clean and there was a mordern slim Lcd tv on the wall and the room was very nicly decorated and room service was great everday the room was cleaned and towels changed every day no problem at all,safe feeling there.Hotel has a pleasant bar area there near the check in area on the first floor ,All the girls who work there are always smiling and helpfull, I used their left luggage service so i did not have to carry my large bags while i went to Washington DC, as i said its very good service from all there,All my luggage was safely kept for me while i was enjoying my self at Washington DC for few days,Also when i retured to fly back home the hotel staff booked a relible Taxi for us to catch our flight home, the taxi was good as well. they have lots of rooms but no lifts to go up as you have to use the stairs so you will have to have a good heart apart from that i can recommend this hotel to you,The hotel boys will gladly help you with all your luggage up or down also. please do stay there as you will have an experince to treasure thank you all at Marrakech Hotel

Reviews.Title: “ok but basic”
Reviews.Author: anfieldl4
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very basic it is ideal for someone who just wants somewhere to sleep in and will be out all day the facilities are none existent you cant even make a drink in your room as they dont even supply a kettle, you have to ask to borrow an iron ,and the rooms are small even the delux which we had only had a bed a bedside table on one side and a tv mounted on the wall it was on suite and clean in the rooms but the stairs are a killer, the paintwork and carpets are ancient, it is handy for the subway into thecity centre, it is quite a way from all the sights

Reviews.Title: “started out well but......”
Reviews.Author: becx27
Reviews.Content: We were really nervous about staying here after reading the reviews. However at first it didn't disappoint. It is in a great location by the subway with some basic places nearby for food and coffee. The decor was lovely and on arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was lovely with the Morroccan theme and it was also clean (we had paid for a supreme room but looking at the pictures on our return we don't think this is what we got). Check out was bit of a nightmare. When we put our bags in the guy was quite abrupt and impatient and upon collecting them they put them into the taxi for us (great we thought) but on arrival at JFK they had given us a wrong suitcase. This meant we had to call them constantly to get them to hunt for our bag to put it into a taxi to bring to us. We were offered no real apology as such and they seemed more concerned about who had given us the bags. Due to us having the wrong bag another poor soul had to fly back without their case!! We were very nearly in the same position. After begging the airline (Delta who were in fact excellent here) we managed to get our bag checked in late and hold off the gate closure. We were also quoted the wrong price for the taxi booked by them which lead to a small and embarrassing row with the taxi driver.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, rooms need some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: kjc75
Reviews.Content: Cheap stay so if your prepared probably not the worst place! Had a 4 night stay with some friends, room on the first floor to the front of the building. Windows didn't shut properly so it was really noisy, and the bathroom needed a right good clean! Not a great location overall. Staff were very good.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe other people”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolTeacher79
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever written a review on anything, however having read several very crittical reviews on this hotel I think its only fair I give the hotel some praise!! Yes you have to climb several flights of stairs to get to your room, so what? if you cant manage it yourself there are several mmbers of staff on duty to help. Yes there is a slight musty smell on the corridors, however the room was clean, the bathroom was fine, plenty hot fast flowing water, clean towels everyday, cheap internet use near reception and helpful reception staff. Good location right next to the subway. New York is fab and you will hardly be in your room but when you are it is fine

Reviews.Title: “Marrakech - my worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: MLouMidwest
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Marrakech hotel for 3 nights. The first issue we encountered was that there was no elevator. There were around 20 steps just to get to the front desk. The security was very helpful and carried our luggage up the stairs and to our room. We were booked for a queen size bed on the 3rd floor. My mother has an illness that makes it very hard for her to climb stairs. We explained this to the front desk staff. We asked if we could go to a different hotel. They said we could not and the best they could offer us was a double bed on the 2nd floor (the same floor as the front desk). They would not reduce the cost, so we ended up paying for a queen size bed but stayed in a double bed. We were told this is because we booked through Orbitz. The room was extremely small. There was no place in the bathroom to place personal items except the toilet lid. The shower temperature was hard to control. Either it was very hot or very cold. There were gaps between the air conditioner and the windows where air, bugs etc. could enter the room. We wondered if the air conditioner could fall to the street below. The room did get very hot at night. We called to ask how we could turn it down. We were told that they would need to do that in the basement. They must have turned it completely off because the following night it was chilly. I didnâ€™t notice any bed bugs. The room was mostly clean except for the floor by the window being dirty. I will never stay there again and we will be asking for a refund. The only positive thing I can say was that the security staff was very helpful and seemed to care about our situation.

Reviews.Title: “Another Bed Bug Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: SurreyNat
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend staying at this hotel under any circumstances. We got charged more for two nights stay than our flights to NY and I was infested by bed bugs all over my body. They were so bad I had to take two days off work and take high dosage anti-hystamines. The hotel accepted no responsibility but after 3 months I got a full refund via the travel agent. This is worse than a hovel!

Reviews.Title: “MarraHELL!!!”
Reviews.Author: SargeP
Reviews.Content: That was a worst hotel i ever seen before! Bugs, small dirty room, no elevator, strange smell...Never stay here! It's horrible!... and do not trust the pictures on the website, they are lie!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Patrick51184
Reviews.Content: My overall experience was an alright one, the lobby was very nice, the hotel staff was very helpful even though it was extremely hot when we first walked into or room, the staff was very helpful fixing the heater. Even thought we saw two bedbugs the hotel staff was very helpful moving us to their sister hotel. My overall stay was moderate, you get what you pay for, but I would not stay their again because of the bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, definitely bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: pickyaboutservice
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was in early October of 2007. I did report this to top staff--Front Office Manager and Hotel Manager. I discussed the issue with them in their back office. I showed them the bug bites on my body and explained that I had actually seen a bug in the bed, however, didn't realize that it was a bed bug. Also, I did not start suffering from the bites until a few days later. I was due to stay for 2 weeks, total.They offered me a glass of wine and moved me to another room. I ended up checking-out early as I could not rest. I was always in fear that I was being bitten again, and the itching was absolutely horrible! The bed was not very comfortable, but satisfactory. Also, there is a long flight of steps from the street to the hotel lobby--be prepared. The Front Desk staff are not very friendly. This by far, was the most humiliating and disgusting hotel stay I've ever experienced. I wish I had read this Web site beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean room!”
Reviews.Author: Pefad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average. Don't expect too much, because it is a fairly cheap hotel for Manhattan! The room was small but clean. We had a little trouble with the shower: It was either screaming hot or ice cold. With a little bit of patience, though, we were able to shower without burning or freezing. The heater was also a little hot, especially at night. I did not see bed bugs. Even if I would have seen them, the staff at the hotel would have probably moved us to another room. The staff is very nice. They make you feel welcome and help with luggage. The hotel is located close to a subway station and also very close to Central Park ( a five minute walk). Downstairs is a Star bucks. Don't get scared by the other reviews! I did and it was totally unnecessary. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday at Marrakesh Hotel - Satisfying Experience”
Reviews.Author: PhiloKing215
Reviews.Content: Having spent my previous birthday in Marrakesh, Morocco I decided to recapture the feeling by staying in a similarly named hotel for my birthday weekend this year. I was thoroughly satisfied with the experience. The lounge was beautifully, elegant and definitely taken from a scene in acutal Marrkakesh. The sight of it transported me back in time. The doorman was cordial, the front desk staff was prompt and friendly. I had no problems at all and they tended to my requests in a wonderful fashion. The room itself was a tad small and clean, but that's how it is in NYC. There was a flatscreen tv with cable, free internet, the bathroom was very clean, but again small. The authentic Morrocan furnishings were sparse, but the wall colors and painting nearly replicated a place we stayed in Casablanca. It was a great birthday treat! I'd stay again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “No Bed Bugs, but....”
Reviews.Author: ohi2u
Reviews.Content: Jan 4 - Jan 6 2008. No bed bugs seen or felt during our stay. Room was quite clean and maid service occurred during the day. Very convenient location on the Upper West Side, merely steps away from the subway station. Can confirm the other stories about the radiator being extremely hot. Our room was easily over 100 degrees when we checked in. Thankfully, the unit has a valve that allows it to be turned off and there is a window air conditioning unit that can be used to lower the temperature. The unit was loud while operating and made a somewhat annoying crackling noise. Another issue was external noise. Walls were apparently very thin and loud neighbors didn't help. Would NOT recommend to a family or to older adults looking for a quiet stay. Hotel was sufficient for a young person or a young couple more interested in the city than their hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Simon80
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. My friend and I stayed in a 4 person dorm room and became infested with bed bugs. It has been a nightmare trying to get rid of the spots. I was quite impressed with the lobby area - which is very pretty. It is a shame they can't pay a little more attention to the actual rooms. Also, the bathroom on my floor was out of action, so there was always a long line for the bathroom in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: penny688
Reviews.Content: There is no point in rehashing all the negatives about this dump. The only thing you need to know is that the hotel is infested with bedbugs! Don't stay here. I only stayed one night and came home to discover myself covered with insect bites - arms, legs, torso and neck. I contacted the management and they confirmed that the room showed signs of infestation. I was asked to sign a form waiving all rights to further legal action in exchange for a refund of the cost of my stay. I have discarded my suitcase and some other personal items that might have been contaminated - in order to avoid infesting my home. I googled Marakech and bedbugs and found that this problem is rather widely reported - wish I'd done this before staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Far too hot”
Reviews.Author: Angie_BLondon
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a problem with bedbugs, in fact we found the room to be reasonably clean, if rather small. The problem was the heat! The radiator was on full for the whole of our 3 night stay, and the only way to combat this was to use the very ineffective cooling unit situated directly above the radiator. We asked if there was any way to turn the radiator off and were told that if they turned off the radiator in our room, the whole side of the building would go off, which obviously couldn't be allowed to happen. They did offer to send maintenance round to unscrew our window, but this seemed a little excessive. The cooling unit was fairly useless and extremely noisy, so we hardly slept at all for the whole stay. Having said all that, the staff were friendly, and the room was clean, so perhaps for the cost it wasn't such bad value. Wouldn't stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Galore!”
Reviews.Author: ladybrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I WOULD NEVER EVER RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE! i stayed there from dec 18th to dec 23 and this was my worst stay in a hotel. there were bed bugs in my bed the first night i stayed in room 536, i didn't know until i woke up the next morning and found them under my sheets. They then moved me to room 402 and the same night i also found bed bugs. By this time i had over 45-50 bites on both of my arms and neck. thats when it occurred to me that they have had this happen a couple of times already...They then moved me a third time to another room, i don't remember the number ( i decide to just stop trying to remember, i had only 2 nights left at that time). They gave me on complimentary night, and had me sign a waiver.... one of the hotel staff said they had pest control in at least twice a week, and i suggested that obviously that wasn't working, maybe they should consider bombing the whole building to actually have a good shot at controlling the situation. today is December 26th, its been exactly 7 days since i had been bitten and the bites are still on my arm, still itchy but have finally started to go down i feel like i have waisted my money. The parking was horriffic, metered parking on Broadway from 8AM- 10 PM, $1.50 p hr and u have to pay every hour... no clue about the breakfast situation, i didn't want anything to do with that place.... no elevator, narrow hallways, the heater was ridiculous, too hot and then the air conditioner wouldn' t cool either... and u cant open any of the windows.... WOST EXPERIENCE EVER AT A HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Yes Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: viajeraverdadera
Reviews.Content: I am the type of person who reads bad reviews with a grain of salt. Which is why I went ahead and stayed in the Marrakech in Oct 07. I thought the photos looked nic & cool and thought the bad reviews were probably written by disgruntled guests or competitors. I wasn't going to write this, as I thought others would think the same thing. Also don't want to create bad karma. But truth is, it's been weighing on my conscious because it's a health concern and this problem is not something that I would want anyone to deal with unnecessarily, if my writing this could help. (I would never stay there again anyway, by the way, because unfortunately the rooms did not live up to the portrayal on their website. I will not go into those details here though) The bedbugs came home with me and caused me a week or two of hell. I received a crash course in bedbug education. I will share some of it here -- When a place has bedbugs it takes a huge effort and commitment on the part of a hotel to rid the problem, and they may not be able to completely. I do not have much confidence in this hotel's management to be so thorough, based on the other things I saw there. Some rooms may have them and some not. If some guests do not have problems it does not mean the other complaints were invalid. They were lucky to get a room/bed that were not infested. The bedbugs can easily travel to another room if chased out of one. Bedbugs for some reason can bite one person in a bed but not another. They seem to favor females more than males. If you did come home with them, here are examples of what I had to do to control the problem (i.e. you don't want to have to do all this if not necessary!): - put suitcase and everything that traveled with me in my bedroom, sealed the room and set off bug bomb - everything that came with me that could be washed in hot water was washed. - all bed linens and curtains washed in hot water - everything else had to be sealed in plastic bags and cannot be opened for 1-2 years - suitcase straight out to garage where will stay 1-2 years - bought steam cleaner, steamed bed frame, mattress and springs, cracks along edges of bedroom floor (luckily I have hardwood), all bedroom furniture especially cracks & crevices - bought very expensive special covers for mattress, bedsprings, pillows - put on and then sealed zippers w/ duct tape - moved bed so doesn't touch walls or other furniture, put vaseline on legs and placed legs in cups filled w/ mineral oil - treated my pets w/ flea treatment (believed that may help prevent them from harboring bedbugs) I won't go into rationale/ explanations for all above as will be too long, but they can easily be found doing a web search. You can find photos online if you need to compare to see if what you have looks like bedbug bites. Took about 2 weeks for the bites to clear, Luckily now seems to be under control but it was huge effort and I have some of my favorite clothes and other items that are sequestered in plastic bags for another year or 2. Also made visit to ER as I initially didn't know what these bites were, had never had them before. The doctor told me that looked like bedbugs. Also, when you go to a hotel: ask to see room before checking in. Pull off sheets and inspect bare mattress. Should not see any streaks of blood or dark streaks (bug excrement - sorry). Once in a room, just in case leave your suitcase far away from bed. the bugs don't usually travel far from bed where their meals are, so it reduces the chance of them crawling in your suitcase, on a plane, and into your home. To be safe, wash everything you can as soon as you come home and put your suitcase someplace such as a garage if possible. I read bedbugs had been virtually irradicated early in the 1900's with DDT, but as we know DDT was outlawed and there has been a slow comeback of the bedbug. Anyone who travels or lives in an apartment building has to be aware and prepared to prevent and treat this problem. GOOD LUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Infested Hotel! Do Not Choose This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: taylor62
Reviews.Content: I recently went to NY and when looking for hotels could not find anything under $450 per night, so when I stumbled upon the Marrekech Hotel located on the Upper West Side on expedia.com, I was absolutely thrilled! It turned out to be THE worst hotel experience of my life. One of the matresses in my room (556) was infested with disgusting bed bugs which bit and sucked my blood all night. The next day I noticed several mosquito-like bites on my upper arm, but my day two, I had large clusters of swollen bite marks on my throat, neck, other arm, hands, back and bottom. I am still itching as I write. When I spoke with the hotel management who actually knew about the problem, they agreed to reimburse me for two nights of my stay, which was the least of what they could do. PLEASE DO NOT CHOOSE THIS HOTEL! I fear that you will regret it. If the management is aware of the problem, but choosing not to entirely eradicate it, then you have to worry what other corners it is cutting.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine!”
Reviews.Author: triper693
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on 1st Dec 2007. Initally when we arrived I wondered what the hell I had done.... my boyfriend was mortified hahahaha but except for the steep, dark stairs to reception... it was absolutely fine! No bed bugs.. the staff were really helpful. Tidied the room every day/made bed extra. Hot & powerful shower. Room was quite small but who needs a massive room when you only sleep there. I would quite happily stay there again. There is a fantastic diner across the road slightly down a bit called Metro Diner... best breakfast we had. A sub way right outside the hotel. Even though its not on Time Square... its still close enough to everything by Subway (5-10 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: idontwannastayhome
Reviews.Content: Booked at the Marrakech since it was the only hotel could find for under $600 a night for a last minute holiday weekend trip. For $200 it was not bad. Fine for the budget traveler looking for a inexpensive (by NYC standards) hotel but would not reccomend to families with small children or anyone who does not want to climb stairs with luggage or dislikes dark hallways and rooms. Pros - location is good, safe, very close to subway, decent size bedroom, clean, plasma tv and pleasant staff. Cons - no evelator and a flight of narrow stairs just to enter the small lobby, very dark in hallways and rooms, small bathroom, leaky and noisy shower, charge $2 a bag to keep your luggage after checkout and photos/website make hotel look much more luxurious than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear! We tried to Ignore the reviews on here but..........”
Reviews.Author: JoMerritt
Reviews.Content: My friend & I arrived, from the UK, at the hotel at 10-45pm and were both exhausted so were desperate for a bed to sleep in! We were a little put off by the 'not so grand' entrance with 2 door men both with walkie talkies. We carried our own bags up the steep, dark stair case & were keeping an open mind (after having read awful reviews on here!). The girl at reception took a look at the pc to check us in, there was obviously a problem & she made up a fib that the pc's were playing up and could we take a seat for a moment! She promptly disappeared! After sitting for about 10-15mins alarm bells starting ringing for us! and we were getting rather annoyed -but whilst we were sitting there a steady stream of guests were coming to reception to complain about everything from heating to the lack of comfort/room in their bed! This didn't look good! Eventually another receptionist came back with the girl that tried to check us in to say that even though we had booked a room with 2 doubles in it, they hadn't got one and could only give us 1 room each -very promptly the two doormen appeared to chaperone us to our 2 separate bedrooms, which I might add were on different floors on completely separate parts of the hotel. My room, 4 flights up the dark horrid stairs, was in the older part & I really wasn't impressed. First night in NYC, never been there before & I wasn't happy to be separated from my friend so went to find her room. It wasn't as bad & had quite obviously been refurbished more recently than my room, the only problem is the heating was on full blast & there was no way of controlling it. We decided to share the one room & one bed in the end - which wasn't satisfactory really. After dropping our bags off we went down for a drink (We needed one desperately after being so disappointed with this hotel) & found 2 English couples who WERE sharing a 2xdouble room- they had been out all day come back to their room & found a couple making love in the bed they had been in the night before & there was no sign of any of their suitcases/clothes etc!!!!! We were horrified! They hadn't even checked out! Lucily we had just vacated one double room so they had at least one bed for the night, but the staff were planning on moving one of the couples to another hotel! Haven't a clue what had happened to their cases though! I have been all round the world and have never seen things like this happening in hotels. After a terrible nights sleep, noisy heating, noisy guests, uncomfortable bed and heating so hot that you felt like you were in the tropics with no ac - we got up extremely early & went down town (one plus point - the subway is just outside! about the only plus point I guess) we went into the thirty-thirty hotel to look at one of their rooms- that made our decision easy - we caught the subway back, went on the internet at The Marrakech and found a good deal on the Holiday Inn, near China Town, promptly checked out and flagged down the first cab! Best thing we did! despite having already paid for this hotel there is no way we could've stayed their another night - it was dismal and horrid and would've ruined our weekend. SO UNLESS YOU ARE REALLY TRYING TO GO TO NYC ON A VERY LOW BUDGET - DON'T GO TO THIS HOTEL!! YES, THE WEBSITE LOOKS FAB AND YOU THINK YOU ARE GOING TO GET SOMETHING REALLY DIFFERENT AND MAYBE A LITTLE UNUSUAL!! UNUSUAL IS DEFINITELY THE WORD! BUT IN A BAD WAY.........Ummm....... Our advice! Spend a little extra and go for one of the bigger, slightly more luxury hotels downtown and have somewhere to look forward to collapsing into bed at the end of your exhausting day sight seeing and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Hosteljumper
Reviews.Content: I needed someplace that was inexpensive, close to a subway, and that I felt safe in. The Marrakech exceeded my requirements with a staff that was extremely friendly and welcoming, the room was super quiet, and the beds, sheets, and towels were clean. The subway was right outside the door, the neighborhood had everything I needed and I loved the ambiance of the lobby. Internet access too! I stayed in one of the shared rooms and while it was small, it was perfect for me. As a hostel traveler, I don't need or expect a large room. I'm there to see the city and just need a secure place to leave my backpack and lay my head at night. I will definitely try to stay here the next time I'm in town!

Reviews.Title: “umm...what can u expect..”
Reviews.Author: dm87
Reviews.Content: Well me and my mother stayed for 3 nights and we arrived and luckily a room was ready, As soon as we opened the front door my mom was laready disappointed with the stairs. I liked the lobby, small, cute, and cozy, but the room was extremely small. Bathroom even smaller. Luyckily we had no bedbugs or rats, i was extremely concerned! I really liked the subway being so close and easy to acces many great locations. All i have to say is, if u use to 3 star hotels this aint for u, but if u just using this to sleep then its a good place and a good deal. I also have to give those eccosential soaps a +!!! me and mother loved em!

Reviews.Title: “Was not as bad as I expected”
Reviews.Author: chevvy26
Reviews.Content: After reading the many reviews on this website it was with great trepidation that I travelled to this hotel. My husband and I had won a competition to New York and this hotel was part of the prize - no laughing. I would not have paid Â£235.00 per night for this hotel which I found out to be the room cost. By the sounds of it we were lucky as our bed was clean. The bathroom was tiny - did not know you could put that many appliances in such a small space. Had to laugh there was not even any hangers to put your clothes up. Luckily no bedbugs or rats as per previous reviews. The bedroom we had was dark and the lighting isn't great but we did not experience any noise from other guests. The only time we heard anything was when the person next door put on the shower. The great plus was the location. I like to stay in hotels where this is an atmosphere when you leave the front door. On your doorstep there was the subway, various restaurants and bars. If you want a breakfast to start the day then go to the Metro Diner about 3 blocks down - great value. We did a lot of walking and never felt threatened in the area. I would not stay here again personally as the price charged was over the top for the lack of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: rollsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marrakech for 3 nights, it is dark, dingy, smells funny, has noisy pipework and has too many stairs and the staff are miserable. On positive note it seemed clean and the bed was comfortable. The worst thing about this hotel is it's security - we paid for our luggage to be kept in a secure room after we checked out as we had a later flight. We returned at 6pm and my case was still there, by 8pm when our cab was due to return us to the airport my bright pink case had gone missing. The staff didn't seemed bothered I asked for the manager who was not on duty and it took the supervisor ages to show her face. We eventually had to call the police, even though the staff told me they wouldn't be interested, well they were and asked about lack of CCTV and the why supervisor didn't know their insurance details, (even the police had to ask 3 times before she showed her face) It turned out my case had been put on shuttle to the airport with complete strangers, so much for the security ticket number I was given. The staff desperately need customer service training, it's not too much too expect a receptionist to smile is it??? NY is a fantastic place just chose a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “renovations!!”
Reviews.Author: tomthecat
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel april 2006. it has since changed its name. they were in the middle of renovating this hotel whilst we were there, although this didn't cause any problems to us. there was no lift so you have to lug your bags upstairs to the lobby then up more stairs to your room. we were given a large room overlooking broadway. it had not been renovated so it looked a bit tired to say the least. 2 huge beds, not many wardrobes but i suppose this will be different now. the price we paid wasn't expensive so value for money was good. as it's on tthr upper west side , it's not central but has a subway right outside the hotel which gets you about easily. there are a few (very few) bars and restaurants nearby, plenty of deli's, cafes etc. we went to the local pub (the tavern i think) and we were the only tourists there. it was full of locals who were really friendly and you get a proper feel of a NY neighbourhood. the staff were ok but didn't put themselves out for you. the maids did an average job. all in all it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Average (No Bed Bugs)”
Reviews.Author: Ollie81
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute Business trip to new York last week, and due to the Marathon, was limited on availability in most hotels. I read about the bed bug issues so called the hotel direct to stress my concerns and they ensured I had a room that was clean. (As they are aware of the rooms that have problems) Room 42 is fine, clean and comfy with a good bathroom.only has one room next to it so no problems on the noise front. It is also on the second floor so easy access. The staff on the desk changed almost every day while I was there some were helpful, however some just looked like they didn't want to be there. The bar is actually cozy when it is open. It states that on Sunday it closes at 11.30, however at 9pm the barman had gone home. I wanted a soft drink and was recommended by staff to have a glass of water from the taps in the bathroom. If I was going back to New York I would stay again if; I could not find a better option at a similar price and I was using it purely for a place to sleep. At the end of the day if pay 5 star prices you expect a 5 star service, if you book a 2 Star hotel, expect 2 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a shame...”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl100
Reviews.Content: I never tend to write reviews of hotels, but felt compelled to comment on this one as my boyfriend and I were really quite disappointed. We booked the Marrakesh having looked at their impressive website, and went in with a fairly pragmatic 'let's just give it a try' approach, having read of good and bad experiences on this site. We certainly weren't expecting the lap of luxury, but felt we were splashing out on something over and above our usual budget basic room...We are very used to backpacker accommodation, and believe I we are by no means fussy or demanding travellers. However, HUGE amounts of noise in room 42 (*repeatedly* loud slamming doors, perhaps by the domestic staff), and unfriendly staff left us feeling disappointed in our choice. I also have picked up 3 very distinctive bedbug bites!! The room was completely livable, but the squashy lumpy bed and bizarre decor was by no means in keeping with what the website seemed to promise... The location is great, the bar is atmospheric, and at the end of the day you can't expect miracles without spending a fortune in New York, but if you're looking for a comfortable spot to splash out a bit I think you might be better off elsewhere... Happy trip!

Reviews.Title: “No bug bites but it gets worse!”
Reviews.Author: Donegaltourist
Reviews.Content: My brother and his girlfriend have just returned from a stay in this hotel. My brother was woken at 0500 to a half eaten bar of chocolate on his locker and a rat (aaaaaaacccch) scurrying about his room. They tried to check out with Reception but were told that they'd have to go through the website they booked it with and would lose their deposit. Reception assured them that rodent control visit every 2 weeks and that they'd have to understand that the hotel is very old. They were offered another hotel room and because they'd only be in New York for a few days and the hassle of getting another hotel and sorting it out with the website they decided to stay. I'd have been out of there prompto! I told him that he should have visited Trip Advisor before he went and asked had he any bug bites, no he hadn't received any bites. Luckily none from a rodent either! Disgusting, I've never heard worse. Visit this hotel at your peril!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: reelaction
Reviews.Content: People need to cut these guys some slack. I visit New York pretty often but this was the first time a friend couldn't give me a place to stay, so he recommended me to stay at this hotel that he heard about in the neighborhood. I checked online for reviews and honestly they weren't too great. So I called the hotel and even got a manager, Beth, to speak with me. She assured me that the problem has been recognized and they're working on it. Since the price was affordable , I figured why not? The place isn't a luxury hotel but it makes an effort. I stayed for a few nights in a basic queen. Everything is nearby, including restaurants, bars, banks and the subway.The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, especially since I checked in past midnight. This was my first experience in this kind of hotel and it was better than I thought it would be. I would stay at the Marrakech again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: pattyl1940
Reviews.Content: I promised the girls at the front desk that I would write a positive review! My husband and I needed to find a place to stay while visiting our grandson at Columbia University. We requested a low floor since there was no elevator and we were accomodated on the lobby level without any problems. The rooms are, indeed, small but cozy, and contrary to past reviews I've read, I did not experience bed bugs. It was a narrow walk up to the lobby itself but it wasn't too bad. What made it worth it was the wonderful service at the front desk. A grand marble staircase wasn't needed for the hotel; just a friendly staff and a pleasant room was enough for us!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, arrogant staff, mental people in the hallways - a Homeless Shelter”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTraveller091
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel (party of 4 in 4 double rooms), we were helped with our luggage (4 flights of stairs), through dark and dusty hallways. The first night in my room I was bitten by bedbugs and woke up at 4.00 am. The nightstaff were fabulous and arranged another room for me, which was perst-free, but with no working telephone line. It is hard to contact your colleagues and the frontdesk with no phone, and being on the 4th floor, I had to walk up and down the stairs, to make sure I could move rooms again. They gave me an 'upgrade' and a 'free night' for the trouble (has not been credited by the way, nor did I get a confirmation of this). All but one member of staff, called Anthony (he was great), were arrogant, did not believe me, were not helpful. Lady at the bar was wonderful too, and made my stay at least nice in the Moroccan style lounge/bar. I have been back home for 4 days, but the bedbug bites still bug me. The whole hotel is very dirty, there was a mental woman out in the hallways screaming and yelling, so had very very little sleep. This is nothing more than a youth hostel with 4* hotel prices! On a slightly positive note, the area is nice, with some lovely restaurants, I enjoyed the Metro Diner, and a Peruvian/Chinese/Polynesian place, and the 103rd street Subway was right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: snedinonrunescape
Reviews.Content: As it says you get what you pay for!! This was the cheapest hotel i found and for that it was fine, Yes it had no lifts, Yes they did have bed bugs but they know and it has been dealt with. Our room was clean and the bed made every day.. be warned though if you go for a one bed room it is small, probably why they have flat screen tv's as they couldnt fit the older ones. The showers in other rooms have noisy pipework which comes on early due to people getting up but if your from europe youll be up anyway due to the time difference The staff were all very helpful, The tube was literally outside the door and went straight to times square or all the way to ground zero and the statue of liberty, also have a look around the local area it has great shops and a good atmosphere So all in all i would stay there again but i would get a double room

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs indeed!!”
Reviews.Author: Snowbored
Reviews.Content: First of all the pictures on the hotel main page are deceiving - they make it look like a nice, clean little boutique hotel. The hotel lobby was cute - which is why the pictures online mostly feature the little bar in the lobby. But as soon as you go down the dimly lit hallway with it's crusty dark carpeting and dark blue painted walls you start to realize you're not quite getting what you paid for here. After lugging my bags up two additional flights of stairs I see a community bathroom at the entrance to the hallway and realize ... holy moly ... I'm in a hostel. Now I have no problem with hostels, I've traveled all over Australia and Thailand and stayed in hostels the whole way. What I DO have a problem with is "hostels" that masquerade themselves as "hotels" and charge over $400 per night on the weekend! The rooms were brown, with cheap beds that felt like they had a plastic sheet on them. We were fortunate enough to book a room with a bathroom and it was so small it was almost impossible to move in ... and then came the bed bugs. Two of our friends found bugs, both had bites and one of them is currently having his room at home fumagated by an exterminator. We talked to some people in NYC who have had experiences with bed bugs and they said "It's like an STD for your apartment... it's almost impossible to get rid of them once they get into your stuff" ... pretty creepy. Now, I feel bad because the guy at the front desk was reasonable about the incident and comped the room. He acknowledged the problem and said they were dealing with it. I'm sorry guys - I stayed at the Hilton Millenium downtown for $269 a night earlier this year and it was heaven compared to this place - and cheaper. If you're a hostel you should advertise and maintain hostel rates - if you're a hotel then you should bring your establishment up to code. Sorry guys - but never, ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs - a disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: StellaAiello
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation on hotels. com. I arrived after midnight after 14 hours of travel only to discover a long flight of stairs to the lobby, then 3 more flights of stairs to my filthy, disgusting room. There was a dead cockroach on the bathroom floor, a bare bulb in the ceiling fan, yet the corners of the room were dark and dingy. I called the desk for a new room and they declined my request. Room/bathroom amenities were not as described. My room smelled like stale coffee by the morning due to the Starbucks below. The room was dirty and dusty. The halls were dark and dingy, and the carpet is filthy and looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in a long time. I left in the morning and stayed with a friend. Hotels.com said they needed Hotel M to approve my refund, and they wouldn't. After two hours in several phone calls I indeed got my refund. The next night I noticed tiny bites on my legs - Bed Bugs. I don't think I brought them home, but I was itchy and uncomfortable for the rest of my trip. Even if you are willing to tolerate the above conditions, this room is not worth the listed price.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in the Details”
Reviews.Author: meletele70
Reviews.Content: I visited New York with my motehr and 2 children and stayed at the Marrakech. I booked the reservations on line and was very excited about the chic hotel depicted on the web page. Based on the representation on line I thought I was getting a fair deal for the average $325 + tax /night, I was paying. When we arrive we entered a very cool second floor lobby via a very narrow walk up stairwell. The music was blaring and it was difficult to hear the lovely young woman as she checked us in. The disappointments came as we went to our room. The narrow hall was very poorly lit, the old rundown doors, trim and fixtures sported a very sloppy new pain job. Our room (#31) was directly over the font door with a window that would not close all of the way (making it impossible to quite the street noise) and the bright lights that illuminated the hotel flag in front of the building shown into our room. The only thing the air-conditioner was good for was creating white noise to cover the street noises from below. In the remodel Marrakech forgot to replace the carpet and bring the bathroom up to cleanliness standard expected for the price. The bathroom supported dirt and mildew in the calking that needed to be taken care of, the marble threshold kept popping off to reveal dirt about 20 years in the making, eek. The bathroom in our room was a polar opposite of the bathroom pictured on the web-page, it needed help. The single light in the room was from a bulb in a cheesy fan over head. When we requested a bedside lamp we discovered the outlet near the head of the bed did not work so we had to live with the fan light and could not read in the room.
