Better lighting would have made things look a little better and helped the room be more tolerable. The extra burn came when in the morning, we had to pay for the puny continental breakfast. With the low room quality a complimentary breakfast would have made me feel a little better but as things stood I felt a nicked and dimed. The upsides of the hotel were it's very helpful and polite staff, it's proximity to a subway station (steps away) a comfy mattress and down comforter and the number of other families staying there. If you stay at this hotel plan to eat breakfast 2 blocks away at the Metro Diner (same price as the continental of the hotel) fun great american soda fountain, or Picnic, an a al carte place a block away. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “awful...just plain awful”
Reviews.Author: polobearx24
Reviews.Content: no soap, flat out lied on their website about how close they were to certain areas (no times square is not minutes away on foot) and whats worse, i managed to pick up bed bugs while staying there and it's gonna cost me a bunch to call in an exterminator.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: eli200
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite nice in spite of the shabby looking entrance.Lobby charming. Nice beds and room. But when I came home I discovered bits of BEDBUGS! I have carried them home in my luggage. I have tried to clean our home thouroghly, but still after a month I discover big red marks on my body. I am now forced to contact an authorized compony to clean our home. Disapointed

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Marrakech”
Reviews.Author: iluvbelvedere
Reviews.Content: Contrary to popular belief, the Marrakech is definitely not a good deal. For nearly the same price (maybe about $20 more/night), I could've have stayed right in the middle of the Theatre District and had a much cleaner, bigger and all around better room. Housekeeping did a horrible job - never once vacuumed during our 10 day stay. They didn't give us soap and shampoo when we ran out. No face cloths, ice bucket, ice machine, vending machine, clock, radio, working phone, coffee pot. None of that. The continental breakfast is pay as you go. They neglected to tell us prior to our check in that there were no elevators. So we had to lug our 50 lb suitcases up 6 flights of stairs (3 floors, 8 flights including the stairs to get to the lobby). There are no closets/dressers in the room. Just a metal rack with 3 hangers and 3 shelves - one of which they use to keep your towels since there's no hooks to hang anything in the bathroom. The tub is half the size of a normal tub so unless your 6 years old, don't plan on taking a bath. You're luck if the toilet flushes properly twice a day, which probably has something to do with the water in the shower being scorchingly hot or ice cold at any given moment. It's definitely walking distance to Central Park if you don't mind walking through the projects - not a good idea after dark. You should take a cab or the subway to get to Times Square so that you're feet don't give out on you by the time you get there (about 60 blocks or so). It's obvious that the Marrakech is a past-hostile trying to become a hotel. However, they should make sure that everything is in order before they allow visitors to dish out the kind of money we did. ($269/$389/night) The pictures on their website are definitely deceiving - if you pay attention, they use the same ones of lobby and one obviously redecorated room in several layouts. Staff was also unsure of things like how to activate our room phone and my credit card authorization slip - not helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place NO bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: anny300
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed in this hotel and we didn't have a problem at all. There isn't an elevator so be prepared to walk up and down a couple flights of stairs (there are doormen to assist you with your luggage) but other than that it was a nice place. The people were friendly and very helpful and supplied us with plenty of maps to help us get around the city. Although we were a little nervous after reading a review about bed bugs, we searched the room top to bottom and didn't see a single bug. There was a flat screen tv, towels, shampoo and soap available. Maids came in everyday to freshen up the place so all in all it was a great stay and very conveniently located, there is a subway right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS...”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghJulia
Reviews.Content: I was bitten all over on my first night by bed bugs. DO NOT ACCEPT ROOM 507. And do not believe the plush looking website, the lighting is not atmospherically dark, it is just dark in an attempt to hide the shabby refurbishment job. We were staying for three nights, when we discovered that it was bed bugs that had bitten me (my partner squashed one which was heading his direction), they moved us to another room. We decided that we did not want to pay for the first and second night of our stay and they agreed that we would not have to, which was fine but further investigation has shown that they had had problems with bed bugs before. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Damn fine hotel in Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: iwastherethen
Reviews.Content: The only problem we had with the hotel was the lack of lift or elevator. The lounge was charming, the noise of the water feature was soothing. The LCD Flatscreen TV was easy to use, and had parental controls if needed. There were three of us, all male, so they kindly gave us a rollaway bed at no extra cost. It was a double bed. I was terrified after reading reviews here that I was about to enter the tiniest space int he world, but even with three double beds, all particularly comfortable, there was plenty of space in the rooms. House-keeping came every Week-day, and even unblocked the Loo we blocked up without so much as a bad word. The staff were friendly, good natured and courteous, and the room was air conditioned and surprisingly spacious. The hotel was on 102nd on Broadway and right beside the 103rd street Subway stop, which was great. Someone bemoaned the fact that its a "One", a local train, and said you had to go 6 blocks to get a main train.. thats insane! After just one stop on the "One" you can jump across the line to get the express, the "2" or "3", (Its right on the other side of the track, usually there when the train stops). However, the "One" leaves you at Times Square (A fairly central part of New York), Penn Station (to get the Path to New Jersey), and is the only train to leave you at the South Ferry terminal (to see the Statue of Liberty), so the "One" is a rather good train to have within a 60 second walk from the front door. There is a supermarket just in front of the Subway stop, which gave us our cheapish snacks and drinks. All in all, if you are on a budget, its difficult to see a better place to go to. Recommend that you book direct with the hotel, we got a 15% discount for doing so!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: DMafra
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, located on the upper west side, right next to the subway station. The rooms are not big but with everything you might need in it. The staff is friendly, they will hold your bag for a fee and they have bathrooms with showers if you'd like to fresh up after check out and a hot day in the city, before you head to the airport. I would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: travelingtripper
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on the hotels.com website. It appeared to be very reasonable. The website was convincing enough for me. I looked up the reviews and contacted the hotel myself. The price was very reasonable compared to downtown areas. The hotel is located around 101st St, New York's Upper West Side which was fine for me. It wasn't too far from downtown area where I needed to be. About a 17 minute train ride, but New York Subways are awesome, so it worked well. Incidentally, hotel is located across the street. The hotel is undergoing a challenge with breaking down the previous hotels reputation. They are doing their best to make it a first class New York City hotel. Bed was very comfy. Flat screen TV's were great, but hotel room was the tiniest I've stayed in. The hotel has taken great pains to make it memorable. I can't complain about the effort, but the noise was something else. The hotel was a bit noisy for several reasons. Tiny corridors lend themselves to every noise of the guests that are going in/out of the hotel rooms. The noise outside, and the most annoying...the noise from the next room over when someone is in the shower. I had to literally shut the bathroom door which was about 12" from my head. Once I shut the door, everything was fine. I think at one point, this hotel was set up like a hostel and the hotel was trying to provide private bathrooms, which possibly made for quick construction and no insulation. An "A" for effort, but a need for quieter quarters. The bathrooms were extremely clean, had great herbal toiletries, but bathroom mirror was too high for my 5'2" height, so had to tiptoe to see myself and apply my make up. All in all, was it bad. No! Not at all, it was just some place to sleep. It was geared toward a younger audience who could make it down to the bar and have drinks. For me it worked out beautifully because it was in a potentially terrific neighborhood and it saved me some dough. Keep in mind there is a doorman who is watching out for your safety and announces you in. Peace of mind. Although it's in a good neighborhood, it's like any New York City location. Turn the corner and you're in a questionable area. I personally felt comfortable, as a single female to walk around, have dinner at a nearby restaurant and walk up and down the area at night. The location is a chic, up and coming area. Truly fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: GazIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just terrible. It is not in a fantastic area for a start, yes there is a subway stop right outside the door but its only the local 1 train so you have to walk 7 blocks if you want main trains. The building itself is the worst thing about the place. Firstly you have to walk up a flight of stairs to get to the reception, which is almost pitch black. The reception area itself is the hotels only redeeming quality but even this you would get in your average coffee shop. The staff are fine but fighting a losing battle when people see how bad the place is. The worst thing of all is when you go to your room. Depending which floor you're on you may need climbing gear and oxygen as there's no elevator. The stairways are cramped, dark and tatty (ripped carpet and flaky paint). We had a superior room which was the size of a shoe box with no space for clothes and a window looking at a brick wall. The a/c is too loud to keep on and the bathroom is just as bad. The hotel is also a hostel as there are shared bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hall. People will say it's cheap for NY but you will find much better for the same price. The one plus we had was that we got sick while there but the hotel was so bad we didn't want to lie around in it so it kept us out and about.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't suggest Marrakech Hotel, New York”
Reviews.Author: Natasja31
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the hotel. The rooms were clean, maybe we were lucky not to have a visit from the bedbugs ;-). The hotel was only 15 minutes from downtown Manhattan by subway. The guys carrying the bags and holding the doors and the cleaning ladys were very nice, but the people at the reception desk weren't friendly at all. I mean they helped you, but certanly not in a friendly way. Our room was on the 5th floor, meaning you have to walk a lot of stairs every day because there is no elevator. As a tourist in NY you propably walk the whole day as we did and climbing the stairs to the 5th floor is too much, 8 stairs. We wouldn't go back there, because the lack of an elevator and the chance to get a room on the 3th floor or higher is very big. In that neighborhood there are more hotels, clean and with elevator or walkable floors. I suggest you to look further....

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Not the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: clolopops
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked to stay for a week from late November to early December. We are used to budget hotels so had no qualms if it was slightly rundown. When we arrived we were told that the booking we had made was not for the twin room we were expecting but a double. Luckily we have known each other years so we accepted this as we had just spent 9 hrs flying and wanted to sleep. The double was actually very small and cramped. The room slanted downwards on one side and had a massive heating pipe which would come on around 4am every morning making the room incredibly hot and a massive noise would come from it. The location is great as it's right near a metro stop which will take you to all the major sights. As i have read from other reviews, bed bugs do seem to be a problem at the hotel. Both my friend and I arrived home to find ourselves with several bites. The staff aren't overly friendly and you would think that if they knew they had a problem on the booking site they would have sorted it by now. If you are on a budget and just using the hotel for a base it is fine, however I think you would find better hotels for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for price, Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: JuanQuebec
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty interesting. I Initially checked in around Midnight and was quite disappointed to have some one stand in line in front of me complain about bed bug bites. The young man in the front, Emed, made sure that the gentleman changed rooms while offering the most polite and sincere, apology, then he helped me find some confidence in the hotel by being VERY friendly as i basically interigated him about the state of the hotel. Throughout the entire stay the hotel i found that most of the staff was almost as friendly, but defiently helpful. They all made me feel very comforitable as it was my first time in NY. So other than that initial shock, the stay was good and great location. I will defenetly be back mainly due to the great staff

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price!!”
Reviews.Author: plushiam
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. The room was the size of an average bedroom but was equipped with all necessities (air conditioner, CD alarm clock, flat screen TV with cable, ect). It was clean, the bed was firm, and the staff accommodating. The hotel reminded me of a night club: it was a little dark inside with lots of color. Itâ€™s cozy and intimate. The location is very central to tons of eateries, the market, the library, subway ect. The subway is needed to get to a lot of the main attractions but it still isnâ€™t very far away them. Overall I had a good experience and would definitely stay again (considering the price, and location.)

Reviews.Title: “strange but OK”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandTraveler88
Reviews.Content: You enter the hotel from Broadway up a dark but clean flight of steps. The rooms are found by winding througb some dark hallways. But the room was decent size, clean, comfortable, with a very good bed. TV service (flat screen!) was fine. I actually had a nice view of the adjacent street (W 103). When I asked for a reading lamp (the room was not well lit) I had one in just a few minutes. I recommend this place, but don't expect a traditional hotel setting.

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: noworriesholland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. We traveled with 2 adults, 1 child age 5. The beds were a bit too small to sleep in with a child, and the rooms are small too, but clean, as well is the bathroom.The staff is very friendly and helpfull, the location is prefect, safe neighborhood, close to the subway and groceries/restaurants, nice breakfast, good choice/price. Only 1 real complaint: the light in the hotelroom.They really have to put extra lamps in the rooms, brighter lamps and extra bedlight.

Reviews.Title: “Engorged Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler082007
Reviews.Content: If I wanted to stay in a youth hostel, I would have. The primary purpose for my stay at Marrakech Hotel was cost and proximity to the local universities. Since I had only planned to sleep at the hotel I opted for an inexpensive stay. However, my mistake was that finding a cheaper hotel meant compromising hotel cleanliness. This is not a family place: Loud thumping music abounds from the time you open the door to the quick ascent of the stairs up to the main desk. The dim lighting hides the worn out, faded carpet. Apparently this hotel defines new renovated as a quick paint job and new shower curtains. Its only saving grace are the flat screen bedroom TVs. My second night I pulled back my sheets and found a huge, engorged bed bug on my pillow. I squeezed it, it popped, and showered my pillow with blood. I immediately took it down to the front desk to report it. Wondering whose blood that was and how many others would feast on me that night keep me up resulting in a miserable day of meetings that followed. The next night, again around midnight, produced yet again another huge bed bug. This time it was flat. It was hungry. I took it down to the front desk. The young man assured me this was unacceptable. Really??! Then someone who appeared to be the maintance guy yelled at me, "Hey, weren't you here last night? Why didn't you change rooms?!" Hmm, that wasn't offered and quite frankly I was exhausted and didn't feel like moving. But this second night I accepted another room on the other tower. I was promised a bigger room. Instead, it comprised of only a tiny alcove to house the suitcase stand. Don't compromise cost for convenience. We don't need to relive our college days. I paid over $1000 for the week when I could have spent a mere $400 more and stayed at a chain hotel that I know would not tolerate sub-par conditions. Its not all the same once you close your eyes,... you never know what comes out to feast on you at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent For Just A Base . . .Suberb Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: ranj1979
Reviews.Content: My brother graduated from University so me, my two sisters & brother all decided on a last minute trip to NYC for 5-6 days. When i first read the reviews i had very mixed opinions on whether to stay here or not...but it was too late as my sister had already booked it!! I was pleasantly surprised, when we arrived we asked if we could have a bigger room as we had a lot of luggage & they gave us a bigger room without hesitation, with enough room to store our luggage. The room was clean (apart from the carpet, which was hoovered in the morning for us). The bathroom was small but clean. As we only wanted to use this as a base and somewhere to sleep it was ideal. We used to get up in the morning & were out by 9am. Didn't return until at least 11am every day so all we did was sleep & shower there. We had a room with 2 double beds to sleep 4 adults. The beds were comfortable & our towels were changed daily. The staff were very friendle & very helpful indeed. We had a room on the same floor as reception so that was good. The only downside to this is if you are on other floors there are NO lifts!! But the staff are more than willing to help with your luggage up/down the stairs.. The hotel has a subway station right outside!! I reccomend you get a pass for a week (only $24) which allows you on the subway & buses all week!! It is very easy using the subway system for all the main attractions & especially shooping!! Also has KFC. Subway, McDonalds, Pizza Hut & many diners within a few minutes walk.. Overall this is an excellent choice if it is just a base for sleeping whilst you enjoy site seeing/shopping in New York!! I would not agree with the negative views on this site!!

Reviews.Title: “Really good for price!”
Reviews.Author: Gee01
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying what most people say, i heard the mixed reviews but needed somewhere cheap and was booking last minute so i just went with what the website pictures looked like. My girlfriend and i were delighted with our stay. We checked after midnight and were really tired but the hotel staff were really polite and friendly. Yes the room was small but it was fine for us,we only really wanted to sleep there. We had en suite which was all clean with fresh towels daily. We also had a great plasma screen tv with a fair few channels. The hotel offer $3.00 dollar breakfast which is good and happy hour on a night.The lobby is nice and relaxing with the morrocan theme. The hotel is also well located with a subway station right outside which can get you anywhere.(Buy a 7 day metrocard you will need it).There is also all the stores you will for bits and pieces right outside and the area really seems safe. I would 100% recommend this hotel and when i return i will hope to stay thier again.

Reviews.Title: “Drab, dreary, dark, no elevator”
Reviews.Author: campbell70
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminded me of the youth hostels I stayed in when backpacking across Europe. And indeed it is fine if you expect bare minimums of things. It is clean, the front desk and hotel personnel are friendly. If it has been renovated it was a superficial job of paint and not a very good one at that. The most disappointing and shocking aspect was there was no elevator and this fact is not listed on their website. I arrived with baggage and although was assisted with it to my fifth floor room, I was not impressed with the small, dark hallways and stairwells and certainly resented the stair climb to and from. The room itself had comfortable enough beds and clean sheets, but no light except a harsh overhead ceiling fan lamp (the fan didn't work). Air conditioning was left to a small window unit which sounded like a jet engine throughout the night. No fans or vents in the bathrooms. The concierge service proved not to be helpful as to locations of business services or things like what time the Starbucks opened down the street. For a bed and shower and a younger person, it is adequate...for anything other than that, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Basic New York”
Reviews.Author: tincase
Reviews.Content: There is a conventional slogan for New York vacations "You just want a place to sleep" We were glad to have stayed at the Marrakech. It worked well for us as we were out the door early and come home late. It has a $3.00 continental breakfast and a happy hour and the other guest seemed to like that but I can't speak to that as we would have breakfast at one of the many places just outside. The room was basic ..bed,tv,washroom. The subway stops right outside and so does the Broadway bus. We didn't go to Manhattan to hang out in the hotel and hotels that have all those extra's in Manhattan cost a lot more money . The idea for us was to experience New York and you can do that from the Marrakech quite easily . Just beware there's no elevator and you might have to walk up a lot of stairs. If thats a problem then you need to look somewhere else. Personally the next time I go to Manhattan I would stay here again . Better to save a few bucks on accommodations to spend on shopping or sightseeing .

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative reviews and book now!”
Reviews.Author: LunaSisterMoon
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad we ignored the negative reviews and stayed at the Marrakech. I don't know what those people were smoking, but my friend and I thought it was a great hotel for a great price. The staff was helpful and friendly, especially the guy who ran the breakfast bar. He could rattle off a dozen restaurant suggestions within a few blocks, and his suggestion to get to the Empire State Building was excellent. Just after we got there, a line started forming, so he saved us a lot of time. The room and bathroom were small, but we were only in there to sleep and shower, so who cares? The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept on, ditto for the pillows. Not once did I wake up with a stiff back or neck. The room and bathroom were clean, and our beds were made and towels restocked every day. We had a nice wardrobe to store our clothes in, plus a luggage rack. Only complaint there is more hangers would have been nice. The location also couldn't have been better. For one thing, the route for the M60 bus from LaGuardia stops just three blocks from the Marrakech. Can't beat a $2 ride into the city! Also, the 103rd Street subway stop is just across the street, and we found tons of great restaurants nearby. The only downside was the dark hallways and many staircases, so I definitely wouldn't recommend this to travelers with disabilities (or at least with disabilities that affect their walking/climbing), and it might be difficult for the elderly as well. Heck, it was difficult for me! But I'm not complaining; I'd highly recommend the Marrakech.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal909
Reviews.Content: I was like many who read a ton of reviews and still didn't know if people were just being picky....THEY ARE NOT! Let me just say two words....BED BUGSSSSS!!!! I had to stay here during some work related business for about 10 days, and I shared a room with two other women. It was one of them who acutally chose the hotel. When we first got there, I do admit I thought the lobby was cute. Dark...yes, but cute. However the bell man was nothing but nasty and didn't crack a smile. I carried half of my luggage up the two flights to the lobby, set them down for a second, to which he proceeded to yell that I was creating a hazard in the lobby. (Later in my stay I was made to feel uncomfortable again by the same man when I spent some time in the lobby bar). When we first got to our room (on the 5th floor, no elevators) I actually thought it was small, yet cute and clean. Boy was I wrong. I had to make a trip upstate during the weekend and on Sunday night the ladies I stayed with called to let me know they changed rooms due to newly dicovered bed bug bites! When confronting the front desk they were not suprised and just offered to pay for the laundy that needed to be done. The second room they moved us to was abs horrible! In the hallway the celling was falling in, walls dirty, rug ripped up around the edges. I believe they are in the middle of refurb the hotel. Needless to say I was out of there! Check in and out were long and frustrating. They had 3 women at the desk who couldn't handle the people plus phones. When I finally got to talk to one of them....I was informed my questions would have to be answered by the other woman. Which was another 10 minute wait. I'm not sure about you, and I know NY has problems with bed bugs, but I highly doubt this was the first or last time they had this problem. I would just be scared that you would stay...not get bit...and then take them home to live in your bed/furniture/clothing. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled”
Reviews.Author: bks1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really a disappointment. The lobby looked really cute but that's about it. The hotel is really far from all the tourist attraction and is dishonest on their website when they say it is 1/2 mile from Times Sqaure (it's 50 blocks away). The stairways and hallways were dark, stinky, and dirty. The room was tiny and smelled bad too. I would definitely recommend dtaying in a hostel for much cheaper b/c they will be better located, cleaner, and definitely cheaper. Don't be fooled by this hotel's fallacious website.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Boogiegirl18
Reviews.Content: I've pretty much stayed in some of the nicest hotels, and also some of the worst! So, that being said I have a lot to judge from. Let me just say that this hotel was not as bad as some reviews made it out to be. The single rooms are a bit small, so if you have a few extra bucks I would recommend the double room. The rooms were fairly basic, no frills. But everything seemed pretty clean and the staff was very accomodating. They were helpful with city tips, as well. The location was good as there was a subway stop right outside the door and it was a short walk from Central Park. This is definitely a case of "you get what you pay for". If you're looking for a decent destination for a decent price, I recommend this hotel. If you're looking for luxury at a cheaper rate, this isn't exactly it.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm... Great ... But....”
Reviews.Author: sunface17
Reviews.Content: Well the Marrakech is a beautiful hotel, the front desk looks nice theres a bar inside.. internet everything looks nice.. until you get to your room.. while everything was clean it was so small, this was the smallest room I have ever stayed in and Ive stayed in quite a few in Manhattan... I have to say though, it was clean and the customer service was excellent... I feel like that was how they made up for the small rooms lol Overall it was a good stay but I would probably not stay there again at the rate I paid.. I have stayed in bigger spaces for just a few dollars more.. I feel torn so I'll say the service was GREAT, the room was CLEAN, and the location was good BUT the room was TIGHT, you have to request the iron and board & there are no full length mirrors for those of you that care. One slip up was that we did find strands of hair on 2 of our towels which was very disturbing for me but we were leaving and forgot to mention it.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Summer200799
Reviews.Content: We were afraid of all the stories we have heard of the small cramped space in hotels in Manhatten. The hotels in this area are very expensive compared to those near the airport in Newark. However, it is worth it for the location. It would haved been expensive to travel each way into the city, and being able to get to our room whenever we were tired was high on our list. So we expected it to be more expensive with little space, and that was okay. We looked at several options and took a chance on the Marrakech Hotel on the upper West side. We loved the Marrakech. After reading other traveler's negative comments about this hotel, we were worried that we made a terrible mistake. It turned out we had a beautifully decorated room with a clean comfortable bed and sheets. We got a queen bed and the room was not cramped at all. We had a corner room with a veiw of Broadway. The room and bathroom seemed almost new after their recent renovation. A grocery store and everything was right downstairs and best of all the subway entrance was just a few steps away on the same side of the street. The staff were very accomodating and we will definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “Marrakech in New York City”
Reviews.Author: citygirl200170
Reviews.Content: Forget about the negative reviews (concerning the former Malibu Hotel), enjoy the journey there. Even if there was a trouble with my reservation at worldres, the staff was efficient enough to solve the problem and make my journey be a pleasant one. The staff is friendly, the place is nicely oriental and the rooms are cosy. The new owner has managed it to build up the reputation of this place. Enjoy your journey there...The french croissants are very tasty, even better than in France! Do not hesitate and forget about negative reviews belonging to the past.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Caractacus2012
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel through a travel agent (who told us it was just 5 minutes walk from Times Square!) we were apprehensive after reading some very mixed reviews. Thankfully, none of the negatives were experienced by us. The hotel is superbly situated for 103rd st & 96th st(fast line, very handy). It proved great for getting around and even greater for a three block walk over to Central Park. The hotel reception is absolutely gorgeous, well presented in a Moroccon styley (see photo) and the front desk were, on the whole, helpful. One brusque guy counterbalanced by a lovely helpful young lady. Behind the front of hotel is a labyrinth of rather plain corridors and rooms. A bit of an anticlimax after the reception but, hey, you want the whole package, pay twice as much! The room was quiet and comfortable. Fresh towels and made beds daily as expected. The only down side was having to pay for the hotel to keep your luggage on the last day before leaving. No hotel should charge for this service in my opinion. Oh, and more hangers for your clothes. Why do hotels only put 3 hangers in a room!? A do think some of the reviewers can be quite intolerant once they get home behind the safety of their PCs and write a review (I read one complaining about the seeing a rat outside, hardly the hotels fault considering the problem the whole of NY has with vermin!). Just go, stay and enjoy your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: camclog
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED this place! It was very convienent. It was very clean! Service was good. Beds were clean. I am booking for Thanksgiving weekend and New Years Eve as I speak. There are many stairs to climb BUT I knew that when I went! It would be stupid for me to blame someone else for that! Never felt unsafe. Loved the fruit stand right outside the hotel. Security was always at door! Hotel let us pay a VERY SMALL FEE to keep our luggage there after checking out so that we wouldn't have to drag it around the city all day! Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: dramamama3
Reviews.Content: Wonderful front desk personnel. Smallish rooms, but this is NYC, afterall. Terrific location, lots of local restaurants and subway entry across the street. 4 blocks from Central Park. Would stay in this hotel every time I'm in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Rats abound - run for your life!”
Reviews.Author: lc16
Reviews.Content: This place is horrendous - they pile their garbage up in an alley next to the building, so we were treated to huge rats running across the sidewalk everytime we returned to the hotel. We also learned from neighborhood residents that the hotel used to rent rooms to the City, to house homeless persons. The rooms were dingy, dark and cramped. Don't ever stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Mannino
Reviews.Content: Located on 103rd Street and Broadway the Marrakech Hotel is a few feet from the Broadway Subway line station where you can catch a train and be in the theater district in 10 minutes. Hotel was comfortable, our room was clean and economical, and the staff was efficient and friendly. My wife and I reserved a room with a double bed which gave us room to stretch out. The hotel has a very nice small lounge where you can relax and unwind after a busy day in the city. Located one block north of the hotel is the dinner used in the Seinfeld series. Stop in for a coffee with Jerry and George while your there. Reading some of the negative reviews, I must say I donâ€™t totally agree with their assessment of the hotel. Ok, itâ€™s not the Ritz Carlton, but for the price in NYC, it was fine. One important fact that may be a concern to some travelers is that there are no lifts, so luggage must be carried up and down the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: i-invst
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely horrible and should be charged with fraud!.. If you are reading this and thinking "maybe it will be ok for me", STOP...it won't be. It's disgusting, dirty, run down, horribly furnished, poorly lit, just so awful it makes me mad that I spent even $1 to stay here. It's just so awful I could go on and on, but PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE believe me do not stay here, you will absolutely regret it. The website makes it look really exciting...it's not, it's just horrible, awful, and a disgrace. It feels like a boarding house/dorm.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my ghod!!!! Run, run for your life!!!”
Reviews.Author: ninacruz113
Reviews.Content: This was the nightmare from hell!! The walls are so thin could hardly sleep, the water would go really hot and burn you then go cold and freeze you to death, the bathroom was so small that you could not blow dry your hair with the door open, it was cold, no heat control, we asked for wash cloths and hand towels, the room was so small, good thing we liked each other, the staff was good nice people, save your comfort, dont stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst NY hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Soldo
Reviews.Content: This has been the worst hotel I have ever been into. It is not stilish to start with, as moroccan style is much more luxurious and sophisticated (please go to a nice riad in Marrakech and you will notice the difference straightaway!!) Aside from the would be stilysh lobby, the rest of the hotel looks like a motel on the highway: the "style" has disappeared, the rooms are incredibly small, the carpet is quite dirty, bathroom are less than essential and last but not least the walls are so thin you can hear everyone sleeping on the other side of the hotel So overall for the price it charges, you can get much much better hotel in a much much better location. So don't go there never!!! It will spoil your holiday in NY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and shabby”
Reviews.Author: StefaniaLondon
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel so shabby and sad that we had to leave two nights earlier than planned, desperate for some sleep and heat! The room was very cold and dim. There were no lights on the bedside tables, one towel per person, no heating whatsoever (it was snowing outside!). We didn't sleep for the whole night because we could hear very distinctly every word from the neighbours' conversations! Don't waste your money or health on this hotel. Oh, by the way, the location is terrible too, way up north...so you'll end up spending a fair bit on taxi rides!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: brookeh1684
Reviews.Content: The Marrakech hotel was very trendy, which I liked right away. The single rooms are a little small, but the hotel upgraded us right away to 2 double beds. This was a much better fit for what we were wanting, and it wasn't a huge hassle at all for us. The doormen were great at carrying our luggage everywhere. The workers were very knowledgeable about where to go for good food and great prices. They even helped us get back to the airport on EXTREMELY short notice, something that was our fault. We made our flight and because of Marrakech's service, it didn't ruin the end of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Forget it - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Neenz
Reviews.Content: I was confused by the mixed reviews of this hotel. But after having stayed there I actually understand why. Half of the hotel is habitable the other half is dire. I know this because on arrival I was put in a double room which was awful and then later was given a deluxe twin double room which was bearable. On arrival I was told that the room I actually booked had been given to another guest due to internet overbooking! So on the 1st night I was given a campbed to sleep on. The staff retorted there was nothing I could do as I'd already paid for the room. It also has very narrow staircases and a plywood feel to it. They cannot use vacuum cleaners due to the thin walls so it feels dirty and the carpets on the stairs are taped down. The bar was closed the last 2 days of my stay and no reason was given. Various heated conversations were overheard whilst at the reception desk, so I wasn't the only dissatified customer. My advice stay away. Go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “An ok stay (sort of)”
Reviews.Author: pinkstar1
Reviews.Content: well, we booked our hotel through Thompsons travel agents, and checked it out on the internet before going. once we arrived our first impressions were that it was very dark and we found it hard to make out the next step up to the lobby. The darkness made it look like a seedy brothel. however the good points were, very convient to subway station. doormen always in attendance. rooms almost clean even though we had problem with our toilet. the water was either boiling hot or freezer cold, no imbetween. The pipes in the room were very noisy and we were woken by them at 4.30 am (not impressed). Loved the hairdryers in the bathroom. towels not large enough and not enough. the bar (once it opened) was very nice, not expensive and the bar maid was very pleasant and friendly. State of the art t.v with plenty of channels , not that you have time to watch telly in NYC. NO BED BUGS FOUND!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very good bargain”
Reviews.Author: Gamecocker
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was great. The staff were professional and friendly. The rooms were a bit small, but were clean and offered the latest in flat panel TVs and good channel selection. Although the city was noisy, the rooms were quiet. There was no elevator that we saw. The staff helped us get our bags to our rooms. Towels were plentiful, but there were no washcloths. Our room would have benefitted from a bedside lamp. We liked the neighborhood around the hotel. Central park was nearby. The restaurants were very good and other services we needed were close by. Convenient subways took us everywhere with ease. Overall, my experience was great. I would stay here again. We are already talking about returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at the Marrakesh”
Reviews.Author: flortx23
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel room had a modern look but the light, in the room, was dim. Another disadvantage is that my room didn't have a lamp and an office table. But, it had a plasma TV which is a plus. The hotel is right at the corner of the subway station and there are many places to eat nearby. ***Advice: If you are coming from LGA, take the M60 bus, it will take you directly to the hotel and you save money. Overall, good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marrakech not bad for ur buck”
Reviews.Author: kleina21
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is seeking the minimum in hotel accomodation. The premises is clean and the staff is friendly. The bedrooms are very small and the hallways are narrow with no elevator (so you must walk up flights of stairs). If you are just looking for a clean spot to sleep for a low price...then stay here. By the way....another review said there were bunks and hall bathrooms to share but i did not see any of this.

Reviews.Title: “The price is right!”
Reviews.Author: aerlinndan
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was extremely friendly, even at 3 in the morning when I checked in. They gave me an incredible price for my room, which was clean, well-kept, and bigger than a room I stayed in at a different hotel later on in my stay in NYC (for nearly twice the price!). There are only two problems I had with the Marrakech, and that was that the walls were a little thin for my liking and there was no thermostat in my room. However, despite the fact it was about 20 degrees out that night, the staff kept the building at a comfortable temperature. The Marrakech also has a hostel and other lower-budget lodging, but I didn't stay in that part of the building. This review is solely for the hotel part of the Marrakech, which, in my opinion, is a great find for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Accom, what can you expect?”
Reviews.Author: Dangerous_travelbug
Reviews.Content: Where the staff a the hotel had no idea what customer service was, the place was decently clean, and although old well maintained. The rooms were tiny with bunk beds (I was in the hosel style accomodation) and not all the luggage fit without everyone pilling it sky high. Also, there are no lifts, so luggage must be carried up and down stairs, quite a difficulty when you have been travelling a year and have quite a bit of luggage.. The location is excellent, the surrounding area is fun to explore and its right near the heart of manhatten. THe bathrooms are clean but old, and there isn't really enough per floor, even on off peak times. However, if you are just after a place to sleep and store your belongings, it has a great location and inexpensive for New York.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tybeegirlCharleston
Reviews.Content: The worst dump. Don't be fooled. This is not really a hotel. It is part hotel and part hostel. It was so gross I could not even spend one night there. Most rooms have bunk beds and share a hall bath. We check out immediatly and went to the Super 8 in Midtown on 46th. Great hotel, great location for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the budget minded”
Reviews.Author: rwpwn3
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that they partially renovated. It was kept clean, but its hard to hide age with some new paint. We were never left a wash cloth and were shorted shower towels all but one day. ( we were there 4 nights) One bed was okay (somewhat firm), but the other one sunk in the middle. The only thing that was real nice was the TV ( 26" Flat Panel) and the bed linens. I would stay again but not if I was trying to impress anyone. Its a good place for a decent price if you just need someplace to lay your head and watch a little TV at night. The staff was always very friendly, they greeted you with a smile and always said hi when entering or leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: mndavid
Reviews.Content: This was the absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life. It was early December and there was no heat in the room, the shower didn't work (it was either all cold or all hot), the window didn't close all the way making it less than 50 degrees in our room in the morning. And it was filthy. There is absolutely no reason to stay at this hotel. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “would definately come again!!”
Reviews.Author: princessLondon
Reviews.Content: we went in a group of 10 young people and 3 staff. the staff were very polite and welcoming. enjoyed the atmosphere of staff and other people using the hotel. facilities were great and staff were always at hand if and when needed. i would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: Retiredlimeys
Reviews.Content: After booking this Hotel online, I found the reviews on TripAdvisor and to be honest, I was very worried about staying there, but we had already paid our money and we could not afford 5 star in New York. We contacted the hotel by e mail and advised that we would be arriving late in the evening and they confirmed that they had our reservations and would be expecting us late. When we arrived, two of the rooms that we had booked had problems, but it was all sorted out the following day, one of the rooms being upgraded for no extra charge. The rooms we had were clean, bed linen was of high quality, bathrooms were very small, didn't have a cat with us so couldn't test the theory of swinging one! The lack of bedroom furniture was a bit of an irritation, we had to live out of our suitcases all week as we were unable to unpack, but it made throwing everything back in very quick when we left. Another irritation was there were no bedside lights, so if you read in bed, you had to get out to turn the light off. There was a flat screen TV in the room and a coffee maker, the rooms were cleaned every day and new towels were provided. All the staff were very pleasant, helpful and courteous, whenever we had a query or wanted information, they were only too pleased to help us. They recommended places to eat that were within walking distance and we tried them all. The hotel is right next to a metro station, so although it is a long way uptown, it is very convenient for travelling. We bought metro cards for $24 and used them every day. It was the best way to travel as while we were there, the temperatures were below freezing every day and we needed to duck into the metro to get warm while we were out sightseeing. The hotel was fairly noisy, but it was the guests that were making the noise! TV left on all night and very noisy activities from some guests! Not a bad stay overall, ti made a good base for sightseeing, but we probably won't go back, the next time, we will stay with relatives as there will be fewer of us travelling together.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Sshores
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain is trouble; they are obviously running a scam with bait-and-switch tactics, overbooking and then shuffling people around.Stayed here with In-Laws. And yes, those reviews where they talk about overbooking and then sending you to a sister hotel: this is exactly how we ended up here; booked over yahoo, and the other hotel (The Astor) said they had no record, even though we had print-outs with "confirmation number" on it; they wasted hours, and then sent us here. Very noisy, cramped, but cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Loving it!”
Reviews.Author: judithbr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 25-1-2007 till 29-01-2007. This is a verry good Hotel. The rooms are small but you only sleep there and thake a shower. The rooms and hotel are verry clean and the sevice is really great! Everybody wants to help you! There is no elevator but the personell is there to help you with it! So i really want to recommend this Hotel to other persons traveling to New York!!!! and it only is 5 min. away, bij subway, to Times Square!!!! The Subway is only 1 min. walk

Reviews.Title: “Hell of a Hotel ”
Reviews.Author: LatinRuby
Reviews.Content: I made a last minute same day trip plans and booked this hotel without reading the reviews nor the specs on the hotel... Everytime I travel I always ask for dble beds meaning 2 beds in the room. I have a son that goes to all my trips with me. I get into NY on the 20th of January late at night get to the hotel and check in. I get the key and when I open the room it has only one bed and very small I go back to the front desk and tell the clerk there must be an error I asked for double he said yes thats what you got... I said well I meant double beds 2 in a room he said "well mam thats a common misleading on travelocity we always get that error but that room is called a Quad it will be $20 more per night"..... I said "ok go ahead and upgrade it.".. after staring at his computer with a confused lookon his face he stated we had to wait because he wasnt able to upgrade it .His co-worker had todo it.... Here we are sitting there waiting for his co-worker to finish his check in... and we hear him state to this couple that he made a mistake and he is ugrading them from a dbl to a queen at no charge... The couple goes up to the room he then stars counting his drawer knowing that we are infront of him waiting! The couple comes down fast stating they want there money back... after arguing with the customer about giving him the money back infront of all the people waiting there...They finally give him his money back... Finally its my turn. The clerk tells me "I am sorry for the misunderstanding but Anthony told you wrong its $30 per night not $20".... (I am already upset of having to wait so long). I told the guy "I really dont see a reason for you to charge me this amount after having me wait here this long and just upgrading the previous couple at no charge"... Anthony says "if you want you can do the same thing they did"..... Now that just made me sooo mad! I told him to shut up! I had no choice! I thought of my son, It was 10pm and I know nothing about NY, its 33 degrees outside and my son is sleepy! I had no choice but to pay for the upgrade. I made the guy upset enough to send me to the last floor with no elevator and did not call the bell man to help me with my luggage.... I cried with anger that night...and I will NEVER ever go back to that place nor recommend it to anyone not only there customer service is poor but there rooms are so cold you cant control the heat theres only a fan in the room that on a summer night a Lady like me that is only 4'11 will never be able to reach not even getting on a chair. The 2 nights that I stayed they never came in to pick up the dirty towels but yes they did knock on the door to bring more... It's Just a Crappy Place to Stay! Not even while I was leaving... even when the bell man saw me coming down the stairs with my 2 luggages did he help, he just stood there holding the door! Knowing I was struggling with my son and my luggages. The Pictures on there website JAJA they are nice but don't get Fooled by them that's just the Lobby. The rest of the hotel looks like a refurbished housing authority development with creepy hallways and plain rooms No Cable ... No Lights to Dim. Like in there room photos.... Very unpleasent place to sleep you can hear the doors opening and shutting as if it was your room they were opening and closing... Vents made noise all through the night and the view jajaja that great big brick wall was not a pretty site. Gotta Say though. The bathrooms were Super Clean. The only good thing in that place I take Is the cleaning lady for the bathrooms only because as far as the hallways, carpet and stairs she cant do miracles for the scum they have.

Reviews.Title: “HATED IT SO MUCH”
Reviews.Author: Guggli_Muggli
Reviews.Content: SCUM OF THE EARTH. NOISY BANGING DOORS. WALLS WERE SO THIN YOU CAN HEAR A PIN DROP. OUTRAGEOUS RATES FOR SUCH [--] ACCOMODATIONS!!! They charged us $179/night for a deluxe room(++hotel tax) by misleading us through their website photos. We could've stayed somewhere else for that rate. IF WE ONLY KNEW!!! It is a horrible hoStel, not a hotel at all. Our room smelled like insecticide everyday! Gross! NO FLATSCREEN TV. Just a tiny matchbox of a screen. Pathetic..and NO CABLE!!!! Staff was very indifferent...and unhelpful. I will sic the Better Business Bureau on you SCUM hoteliers!!!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed it.........”
Reviews.Author: Africangirl24
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel on many website and generally they weren't very good. But it was the day before my trip I was strapped for cash and needed a GOOD RATE. I arrived 30 minutes early and couldn't check in till 3pm. That was fine. Check in was easy. My room was located on the same floor as the lobby. It was small, but it looked like the rooms on the website except no big screen or flat screen TV. But it did have a desk and full size bed. Well I left and came back 9 hours later or so. When I got back to my room condensation had formed in the room, I don't know how, but there was a fog/mist in my room. EVERYTHING was WETT! The bed linens, the desk, the walls, ceiling, was sweating or either SOAKED! I went to the front desk and they came and checked it out and WERE SHOCKED! They didn't know what was going on. Well they upgraded my room and gave me that night free. The only drawback was it was on the fourth floor and I had stairs to walk up. The other room was bigger and I had a Queen size bed. I had no problems with bed bugs as some reviewers stated or any insects on ANY KIND! I didn't spend a whole lot of time in my room, but I liked it! The staff was VERY NICE to me. I never had anyone disrespect me, ignore me, or get an attitude with me. The bell man were very nice about getting a taxi, opening doors and just for general information about the neighborhood. If you are just looking for a place to just shower, sleep and not spend much time in the room then this is the hotel. I wasn't in my room THAT MUCH, so it was all good. The location of the subway stop IS EXCELLENT!! IT can't be beat not unless you are staying in Times Square. Once you walk out of the hotel the subway is literally 10 seconds MAYBE 15 second away. I'm a woman and I went to NYC by myself, so I was glad of this fact. There are many restaurants around the property and STARBUCKS!!! Also Bank of America has an ATM really close by. I would stay here again if and when I return to NYC. I hate that the hotel doesn't have an elevator, but I can overlook that by minimizing my trips up and down the stairs which I did. Also the hallways weren't the nicest because they are remodeling the hotel. But so what the hallways aren't nice? It's not as if you are sleeping in the hallway. You're there to sleep, bathe and stuff. The lobby is true to form. It looks exactly like that in real time, except for the dim lighting. It won't be dimly lit or have candles lighted when you are there. I had no problems leaving my goodies that I shopped for in my room. I SHOPPED constantly while there and had amassed quite alot. It was never bothered by any of the staff when they were cleaning my room. There appeared to be no heat in the room which was disturbing. I was cold most of the time I was there, except for when I was in the bed. But like I said, I wasn't there much, so no big deal from me. I went to the hotel not expecting much and got sooo much more with GREAT customer service and a staff that was willing to go beyond to help the customers. On my previous trip to NYC I stayed at the DoubleTree in Times Square but this time around I wanted something different and CHEAPER! And I got it at the Marrakech Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprized”
Reviews.Author: msleye
Reviews.Content: i read some of the reviews before i went away and was scared that i would find insects and all that crap. When we got there i was surprized at the high level of service and helpfulness of all the staff. I didnt come across one rude member of staff maybe because it was the holiday season but i was always greeted with a smile. My nly advice is that if you go to new york you sholud stay midtown cause you will be closer to time square,soho, downtown and central park etc. but this hotel is good if your looking for somewhere to sleep and refresh.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: quinquagesima
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in! We arrived in mid-December & were put in an unheated room. When we complained, the front desk kept insisting that the heat was on. Finally, we were told nothing could be done because it was out of hours. We were given a couple of blankets. The following morning other people on our corridor said they had also had no heat. 2 days later we were transferred to a smaller, more basic room on the pretext that the corridor was going to be painted. We spent the next 7 nights in a tiny room with no closet, no hanging space, no drawers, no hairdryer & no phone. We had to live out of our suitcases. We were directly under a heating or ventilation duct which made a loud noise & kept us awake all night. The water was often lukewarm, but on the day before Christmas it was ice cold. When we complained, we were told that there were boiler problems & that we were "about the fourth people" to complain. In the meantime another person was complaining that his room had no heat! All our complaints were met with rude indifference by the front desk staff. The bar was supposed to close at half past midnight but when we tried to order drinks at midnight one night, we were told disapprovingly that the bar was closed & that it was "very late". When we pointed out that closing time was half past midnight, we were informed that this depended on how many customers there were. When we checked out we requested a partial refund for the lack of heating & hot water. We were simply blanked out & told that no refund had been authorised. In summary, stay at this dump at your peril!

Reviews.Title: “it fair for the price”
Reviews.Author: stevwang
Reviews.Content: booked on hotwire, said it was 2 stars....well, i disagree. the place was pretty crappy, room was small. you couldn't even change the heat settings in your room, and it was cold in december. the staff were VERY nice though, several of them are very attractive young ladies. the area is good; safe and close to central park and subway #3 (103 street stop??). There were also no elevator, and carpet was yucky looking. bathroom was clean, towels and bedsheets were also clean. you could purchase internet access for $1 for 8 minutes. overall ok for the cheap price of $99/night (on hotwire, $120-ish with fees and taxes). but this was definitely not an enjoyable place to stay. don't come here if you're looking for a decent place, but ok place to crash for a night if you're broke like me.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: CrashMandy
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I needed a place to lay our heads for one night. We live about 30 minutes out of the city, but planned to have some bevvies, and preferred not to have to drive at the end of the night. That being said, it was hard to justify spending $300 for a night's stay when we were so close to home. I had almost given up on affordable accommodation, when I came across the Marrakech site [a really impressive web site]. I usually check the reviews here before booking a hotel - but truthfully, I was pretty desperate! The room was reasonably priced, and the online reservation system was quick and easy, so a room was booked before I could type t-r-i-p-a-d-v-i-s-o-r. I was worried when I read a lot of what was posted here, though I'm a pretty hearty traveler, and I figured I would give it a shot. I had booked a room with 2 singles. When we arrived two nights later, the lobby was busy, but we were greeted promptly by an attractive, friendly young man. When he looked at our reservation in the "system", he noticed that our room had been given away. He stated boldly that they were "over booked". He followed that up with, "We have upgraded you to one of the newer, recently renovated rooms - with one double bed". Thankfully my friend and I have no qualms sharing a bed - but I guess that could have proved inconvenient / unsatisfactory for other pairs. He also knocked $40 off the rate. We were not prepared to argue, and signed for the room. There are no elevators. I did read that here on someone elses review - so that didn't bother me. The room floors, however, are not very clearly marked [ie, no sign telling you which floor / or direction your room # is] - that was a pain in the butt. We visited 3 floors with our luggage before landing on the right floor. And I do have to say: the hallways to the rooms ----- very, very creepy! The walls are painted electric blue - there are random holes in the walls - dangling, blinking ceiling lights - and trippy tri-color striped carpet .... we laughed - and didn't mind - [as a former backpacker, I've seen it all!] - but I could see how others may feel they were mislead by a swanky web site and lobby. I hope the Marrakech is just slowly "swanking" up the whole hotel, one floor at a time! Our room: Very, very nice. An exposed brick wall - a real brick fireplace - a wall mounted flat screen TV - new, high thread count linens - clean, clean bathroom with great toiletries and towels. Very tastefully decorated - very modern. *I cannot speak for the "older" rooms that I did not see We had some drinks in the lobby before leaving that night. The female bartender was friendly and down to earth - mixed a mean martini - and the ambience in the lobby / bar area was very "Moroccan" .... The door guy flagged down a taxi for us in .5 seconds - and with an impressive flourish. Nice touch! And we both slept well [though, admittingly, we were well sedated thanks to Absolut ...] My friend and I have since concluded that the Marrakech is where we'll stay on future nights in the big city .... at least for now, until we can afford The Plaza .... =)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid! Do not book: Bait & Switch Reservations”
Reviews.Author: pinnacle109
Reviews.Content: Looked nice on the web site: newly renovated, cleaned up, North African charm, a flat screen TV in every room (!). I booked a room with two double beds for my 14 year old son and I using their web site. Got a confirmation number, etc. The day prior to arrival I called the hotel to ask if we could check in early. No guarantee was made, but a comment was added to the record that we'd like early check in if possible. We arrived a couple hours early in NYC for a wedding that afternoon and I called from Penn Station to ask if we could check in at 1pm rather than 3pm. I was told that yes they did have a room ready. When we arrived the indifferent staff told me that they had no such room, only had a queen room available and we should just share it. No way. I was a told that there was a computer error, especially with the Internet bookings. Well it was not a computer I was talking to on the phone just 45 minutes before, it was a live female who said come on down a double room is waiting. Then they said they had a room with two beds available at their "sister property" just two blocks away. By now we were pressed for time to get to the wedding so we went to look at the other hotel. It was not a hotel, it was a hotel & hostel. A dark, dingy lobby with curtains hung on the walls to hide cracking plaster. The room was decently clean with two beds so we were forced to take it, but It took 15 minutes for them to figure out how to book the room and they took cash only. To top it off the room had no heat, no hot water on Sunday morning, the bathroom was unbelievably small, no telephone, the smallest TV made today (no flat screens here) and had an elevator that should have been condemned decades ago. I am amazed I didn't see any rats in the staircase. Of course, the room had no iron/ironing board. The whole experience? A complete disaster. The Marrakech Hotel owners do not deserve your business. They are the scum of hotel operators. Avoid at all costs. Stay further away at a reputable chain and use the subway or a cab. You do not want the type of experience I just went through. Find a decent hotel and enjoy your stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff members, nice and clean room”
Reviews.Author: chatina
Reviews.Content: After I read the reviews I was a bit scare of the quality of the hotel. Once we arrived the members of the staff gave us a bigger room with a big bed , tv and nice and clean bathroom. The rooms are simple but very comfortable It's 30 seconds from the next tube station and it has internet connection. I have to say that our stay in New York was great and the stay for 6 days on this hotel it's was very good. It has no elevator or bar facility, but it's a cheap enjoyable option for budget travellers The staff also was very helpful providing directions and arranging taxis Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not as advertised, but lobby is nice & great UWS location”
Reviews.Author: 1jst
Reviews.Content: Lobby is nice. Hallways are quite dingy; holes in plaster, stained carpet and bare light bulbs. Room was advertised (on website) with image showing desk, nightstands and reading lights; our room (Deluxe/$199) had none of these. There was no furniture except for a bed, nightstand, luggage rack and small TV stand. The only light in the room is a single CF lightbulb. This did not meet our expecations. We expected 'spartan' but not like this.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent staff who don't give --, stairs are a lawsuit waiting to happen”
Reviews.Author: ThomasGHeinrich
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever. No elevator, so I had to walk up 3 flights of stairs with my luggage. I didn't get an iron. Nor was one available. I complained. Staff were not proactive in getting me an iron. I was simply told "all the irons are taken", and they took no further action. I asked the front desk to book me a cab to the airport. I went for a walk, returned in an hour and nothing had been done. Very ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “A Dreadful Night”
Reviews.Author: BayouBleu
Reviews.Content: Let me add to the Fall 2006 criticisms. Fresh paint throughout the hotel was nauseating and gave me a sore throat. The desk crew did not say one word about the paint upon check-in. My room was stark and dismal. The only light was from the ceiling fan - no lamps on the nightstands. There was no television. The window air conditioner was a tiny consumer model that went on the fritz in the middle of the night and made horrible noise, forcing me to turn it off. (It was unusually warm this night) The bathroom had 2 towels, both bath-sized. There were no washcloths or hand towels. They had been laundered in detergent that smelled strongly of pine. The bed linens smelled similarly. And the mattress was hard as wood. Bottom line: I'm glad I was only here overnight. The $124 Travelocity price was the big draw here, but I will now be much more willing to pay more for a decent NYC hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again”
Reviews.Author: Mins_Redditch
Reviews.Content: Hmm would I stay here again, hell no worse hotel ever.I booked of the website, from the glamorous pictures on there Yes the lobby was nice but thats were it ends smells weird very dirty even by NY standards. I think even guests from [-] would be appaled at the standards this hotel conveys my rooms bed was covered in bed bugs and the bathroom was like a ethiopian refugee camp toilet. worse hotel ever I left 3 days early and checked into what is known as a 5 star luxury hotel compared to this joint, A roadside motel. Do not stay here save your money i'd rather sleep outside.

Reviews.Title: “No elevator, not TV, clogged toilet, no iron”
Reviews.Author: wifi888
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe my eyes. No elevator so be ready to climb 40-50 stairs to get to your room. I am 300 lbs and it was hard. I get to the room and there was no TV, no iron, the room was cold (the radiator did not work), and the toilet was clogged. I will really read reviews on any hotel that I stay in. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Think About It Avoid At All Costs!”
Reviews.Author: dafc
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for 10 days as the best man at a friend's wedding and ended staying here for the 3 nights and had 2 different rooms before moving out. Had mice infestation in the first room. Complained and was moved to another room which had mice & bed bugs into the bargin. The staff weren't too bothered, I think then know and don't really care. They seem happy to to play musical rooms every time you complain. Don't be fooled by their web site, the entrance & reception is decorated well, the rest of the place is poorly maintained and decorated (a dump really). And for the price it's jus not worth it. DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: adr55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marrakech for 3 nights in October, and we found the place to be perfectly comfortable for a 3-night stay. The staff let us check in 4 hours early, and offered us help with our bags. There was always at least one doorman/bellhop near the front door or at the top of the stairs on the way to the lobby, which made me feel as though the door was always being watched. Our room was clean and we found no evidence for rodents or bedbugs. Travelers who are used to American chain hotels may find the Marrakech to be too minimalist (examples: the showers and rooms are small, there were no bedside lamps, no elevator, no place to hang clothes). Travelers who have stayed in Europe will not find anything strange at all about this place. The hallways on our side of the hotel desperately needed to be painted, however, while we were there, we noticed workers painting the other side, which makes me think that the place is still a work in progress. For the convenience and price, this hotel is great find. I would definitely stay here again. I would not recommend this hotel for those who cannot climb stairs or for exceptionally large people (showers are very small--but perhaps they have rooms with larger showers if you ask).

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JayEmmZee
Reviews.Content: I decided to go with the more recent/favorable reviews of the hotel, especially since I knew it was being rennovated. I booked the hotel over Labor Day weekend and the room, although small with few ammenities appeared like it would serve it's purpose for two people in NYC for a short stay: a place to sleep. We awoke the next morning and as my boyfriend was showering, I saw something crawling over the sheet...a bed bug (I've seen Dateline, I know what they look like). I was horrified, squished it, and noticed it made a mark much like several other marks I then noticed on the bedsheets. I went immediately downstairs to complain and the front desk girl didn't seem surprised at all (similar to another review below). We were offered a new room. We took the new room, not wanting to make a big deal and ruin the rest of our vacation. I am now home a week later and COVERED in bed bug bites. It's incredibly common for bed bugs to stowaway in suitcases and come home with you to infest your own home. So, until the entire hotel is bombed for bed bugs, no one is safe, and it's obvious the hotel has no interest in fixing the problem. In addition, I've called the hotel twice regarding my issues and they have yet to return my call.

Reviews.Title: “Left Early, Never to Return”
Reviews.Author: elisguistics
Reviews.Content: I took my college daughter to NYC for a weekend of fun/shopping for her 21st birthday. This was not our first trip, we have visited and stayed at several hotels before. We booked this hotel which had fairly good reviews and excellent picture on their web site. The location was great, right across the street from a subway stop and close to a small grocery store, coffee and bagel shop, and other essentials. The picture of the lobby was accurate, and that's where it all ended. Knowing many NY hotel rooms are small we booked a room with a double bed and a single. We arrived and were told there were no more rooms like that so we were assigned a double. Hmmm. I showed the manager my internet paperwork indicating we booked a triple, and were paying for such. He apologized and made a copy and assured us that we would get the room we booked the next day, just to bring our things to the desk in the morning to store. OK, we could deal with that since it was so late and we were just going to go to bed anyway. While the lobby looked great the hallways/stairways carpeting and walls were filthy, the walls looked to be falling apart. The room was relatively clean but we soon learned we needed the extra bed to put our suitcases/bags. Our room only had 1 nightstand, a tv stand with a 12 inch tv, no bureau, no closet, and only 2 bath towels, which were stored on the tv stand because there was no place to hang them in the bathroom, and there were no hand towels or wash cloths. We left the next day in hopes that we just had a one room bad luck situation and returned at 5pm. When we asked for a key to our new room we learned we had no room reserved for us at all, and all they could give us was a room with 2 twin beds or a queen. That would have been fine in many other hotels, but not this one. The place was, as my daughter put it, "so disgusting," we decided just to go home. I asked the woman at the desk how it could happen that being first on the list we still didn't get the room we wanted the second time, never mind the first. She said that if they see there are only 2 people on the reservation, regardless of what you want, you will likely get a room for only 2 people, even if you are paying for a room for 3, this so they can fit more people in the hotel. We asked if we could just check out and get our money back for that night, and were first told no - but after complaining about their twice mixing things up we were able to check out and pay just for the one night.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in this hotel for 5 nights in mid June 2006. I have to say that I'm a bit amaized about the reviews I found from this site. I found them after we made the booking and I have to say that it definatelly scared me, but... If you have made yours, I can honestly say that no worries. Living in Europe give's me a perspective little bit better if I may say so... this hotel is above average from my point of view from the European hotels this size! The room was not a hell hole as many of you describe, it was small, but we had four of us in the same room and we managed just fine. Lineans were all frech and bathroom was tidy. No bugs, definatelly not! We had to ask more towels and got them right away, staff was very kind and helpful also. Location is exellent, metro is just few steps away. Security staff standing outside the hotel all times, front door locked during night time. I felt safe and comfortable. If you want to complane about the stares, please do try some small hotels in Amsterdam or London or Berlin. I assume that they've had big renovations though, so ofcourse the hotel is now much more better than before. I will suggest this hotel to anyone who wants to spend ones money with something else than Luxorious hotels. City was hot and it was nice to come to the Marrakech and rest and start the next day with a smile on our faces.

Reviews.Title: “I Do Not Recommend This Hotel At All!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was NOT what I expected. As soon as we got there we had to climb 21 steps to get to the lobby. The desk clerk checked us in and gave us swipe cards for the room, which was 4 flights of stairs up. THERE WAS NOT AN ELEVATOR!!! When we got to the room some guy in the hallway working on something let us in with his key because that room did not use swip cards. The phone didn't work, The air conditioner didn't have knobs on it. The doorhandle was broke, the bathroom was extremely small. Instead of getting two full size beds they gave us a room with 1 full size bed and 1 set of bunkbeds. This was for 4 adults!!! My husband had to climb up & down 4 flights of stairs twice to complain. They finally gave us the room we saw on the website. It was a little nicer, but when we called room service to get wash clothes they didn't have any. The extra towels we asked for (because there were only 2 towels and 4 of us) were in the dryer. Our toilet clogged twice and we didn't have pillow cases for 2 or 3 of our pillows. The carpet in the old part of the hotel hallways was nasty!!! The employees were very kind and helpful, but I was very disappointed in this hotel and would NOT recommend it for anyone!!! I do NOT plan on using this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel last minute, and was a little nervous since some the previous reviews were not great. The hotel is still undergoing renovations and the rooms and bathrooms are small. The staff is extremely helpful and nice. It is very reasonably priced and even though it is not finished and some of the hallways are in bad shape I would stay there again, the rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel is also right on the 1 subway line which will take you all the way to south seaport in about 40min. I was told by the manager that renovations should be finished by the end of September. The rates will go up slightly then. One importent fact is that there is no elevator, so if you have a problem climbing stairs you need to ask for a room on the 2nd floor level.

Reviews.Title: “Stairway to heaven it's not.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on line. There was no mention on their site about the long narrow staircase you have to climb just to get to the lobby. We came early before it was time to check in so they held our bags for us. We told them we will be checking in late, they said they would make a note of it.
